#OTD in 1961, President John F. Kennedy, addressing civil defense, advised American families to construct fallout shelters for protection in case of a nuclear conflict with the Soviet Union. Just one year later, the Cuban Missile Crisis unfolded as the USSR deployed nuclear missiles in Cuba, pushing the world to the brink of nuclear war. During this 13-day crisis, Americans stockpiled canned goods and rushed to finish their backyard bomb shelters in preparation for potential nuclear conflict. #NineLineApparel #JFK #CubanMissileCrisis #FalloutShelter #NuclearCrisis #USHistory

FIRST VOYAGE TO THE SOLOMON ISLANDS (1567-1569). The discovery by √Ålvaro de Menda√±a.

The two ships, the 200-ton Los Reyes (the Capitana or flagship) and the 140-ton Todos Santos (the Almiranta or secondary ship) sailed from Callao, in Peru on 20 November 1567, with about 150 sailors, soldiers and priests on board in search of Terra Australis, an imaginary continent with origins in classical Greece that used to appear on European maps from the 15th century until the 18th century

After sighting a small island in mid January (probably Nui in what is now Tuvalu), a significant body of land was sighted on 7 February 1568. It was Santa Isabel Island, where they landed several days later. The expedition had discovered the Solomon Islands which they named Islas Salomon. The Spanish immediately came into contact with Solomon Islanders who were later found to be cannibals, though at first the relationship was cordial. However, the Spanish expedition's need for fresh food and water quickly led to tension and conflict as the islanders were unable to provide supplies after some time.  The real prizes were pigs, desperately needed by the Spanish, which were also important to the local people's economy.  The Spanish were horrified to find the islanders were cannibals when they were offered "a quarter of a boy with the arm and hand" which the islanders urged Menda√±a to eat.

After building a small brigantine, the surrounding islands of Malaita, Guadalcanal, Makira (which was named San Cristobal) and Choiseul Island were explored. However, the attempts to barter for food led to the same cycle of friendly welcome, misunderstandings, sullen retreats, occasional reconciliations, robberies and violent retaliation.  Finally, at a council meeting of captains, pilots, soldiers and sailors on 7 August 1568, the decision was made to return to Peru. Menda√±a had wanted to sail further south, while Sarmiento de Gamboa and several soldiers unsuccessfully urged the establishment of a colony.

The two ships sailed north then east, passing the Marshall Islands and Wake Island, before reaching the Mexican coast in late January 1569. It was a long and difficult voyage, with numerous deaths from scurvy.

Halos araw araw magkasama dahil magkakilala din ang pamilya naming dalawa. Ang hirap pigilan mga papa. Lagi kasi siya andiyan lalo na pag down na down ako. Siya lagi ang maaasahan ko mga papa. Takot akong umamin baka maging awkward ang lahat. Di ko din alam ang gagawin ko pag nalaman ito ng mga family niya. Kailangan ko ba itigil ang nararamdaman ko para sa kanya o ipaglalaban ko ang sinisigaw ng puso ko? Mga papa hindi ko naman ito nararamdaman dati sa bestfriend ko. Habang nag kaka edad po kasi kami mas nagiging malakas po ang samahan namin. Tapos ayaw ko din na magbago ang turingan namin sa isa't isa. Sobrang daming conflict mga papa kapag lumabas ito. Lalo na po hindi ko alam kung matatanggap ako ng parents ko. 50 years ago today, the deadliest Arab-Israeli military conflict commenced with a surprise attack, coordinated mainly by Egypt and Syria, on the Israeli-occupied territories in Suez and the Golan Heights. The Yom Kippur War would go down in infamy as the bloodiest military confrontation between Israel and its Arab neighbors totaling nearly 53,500 total casualties on all sides involved; compared to 5,500 casualties during the 1967 Six-Day War, and 10,000 casualties during the 1956 Suez Crisis. üì∏: Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir holding the first press conference on the second day of the Yom Kippur War. Why is the FEAST of the OUR LADY OF THE ROSARY, on every October 7th? 
..... The story of the  VICTORY OF OUR LADY OF THE ROSARY at the Battle of Lepanto, on OCTOBER  7, 1571.

IN TIMES OF ACUTE DANGER AND HARDSHIP, WE MUST ALWAYS FLY INTO THE ARMS OF THE MOST POWERFUL MOTHER OF GOD AND TURN TO THE RECITATION OF HER HOLY ROSARY. The Battle of Lepanto is a great lesson of confidence for us today. 

When Saint Pius V became Pope, Christendom faced the perils perhaps unequaled in its history of continual conflict with the violent followers of Mohammed. All the information and intelligence that Pope Pius V had been gathering indicated that the Ottoman juggernaut was about to roll across the Mediterranean and adjacent lands, spearheaded by the Turkish fleet, with Italy and Rome as one of its target. (The Ottoman Empire is also historically known in Western Europe as the Turkish Empire)

Only Spain and Venice had the resources to resist, and they hated each other along with deep mistrust. Yet Saint Pius ‚Äî calling down divine grace as only a man of prayer could ‚Äî forged an alliance with them as the core of an organized fleet of over 200 galleys. With his considerable tact and diplomatic skills, he not only kept them unified, but he convinced them to attack the enveloping menace.

The Archbishop of Mexico had an exact copy of the HOLY IMAGE OF THE LADY OF GUADALUPE sent to King Philip II, who in turn gave it to Andrea Doria, one of the three principal admirals of the fleet, who placed it in his cabin. When the Armada went from file to line abreast and attacked on the morning of OCTOBER 7, 1571 the blue standard of OUR LADY OF GUADALUPE was also flying from the masthead of Don Juan‚Äôs flagship. 

Pope Pius V, a Dominican prelate before becoming a Pope, did what Catholics have always done in times of acute danger: FLY INTO THE ARMS OF THE MOST POWERFUL MOTHER OF GOD. As a follower of Saint Dominic, HE KNEW THE MOST EFFECTIVE MEANS OF IMPLORING HER HELP WAS THROUGH THE RECITATION OF THE HOLY ROSARY. He ordered all monasteries and convents in Rome to increase their prayers for the impending battle and organized ROSARY PROCESSIONS in which he, as sick as he was, participated. OUR LADY‚ÄôS PRESENCE THAT DAY WAS MORE ACUTELY FELT THROUGH THE HOLY ROSARY.

As the Christian fleet sailed toward the great clash, MASS WAS CELEBRATED AND THE ROSARY RECITED DAILY ON EACH VESSEL‚Ä¶.. THIS HEARTFELT REQUEST FOR DIVINE ASSISTANCE RESULTED IN A CRUSHING DEFEAT OF THE OTTOMANS AT LEPANTO THAT ENDED THEIR DOMINANCE AND CRUELTY IN THE MEDITERRANEAN. OCTOBER 7, 1571, WAS THE VICTORY OF OUR LADY OF THE MOST HOLY ROSARY, EVEN IF THE CHRISTIAN FLEET WAS GREATLY OUTNUMBERED BY THE OTTOMAN FLEET.

TO CELEBRATE OUR LADY‚ÄôS INTERCESSION AND VICTORY, THE CHURCH HAS DESIGNATED OCTOBER 7 AS THE FEAST OF OUR LADY OF THE MOST HOLY ROSARY. Similar acknowledgement to the Blessed Virgin‚Äôs intercession through the Rosary were made when John Sobieski forced the Turks to lift the Siege of Vienna in 1683 and after the victory of Prince Eugene of Savoy at Temesvar in his successful campaign to remove the Ottomans from Europe in the next century.

Thoughts used to trouble me, now I can easily see them come and go. Earlier I used to struggle with my thoughts. I can now be observant of my suffering or conflict and dissolve them with my awareness and prayer. There is no disturbance within.

Earlier when a troublesome event happened, I used to feel a lot of stress and tension. Body used to go into struggle mode. Now it feels light and I am able to quickly bring my inner turmoil into calmness.

If some hurts me now, I can see the hurt within me and in 10 minutes it is gone. If something major happens, I could dissolve it in an hour. 

I can easily go about my everyday work without conflict. 
I used to eat mechanically, now I eat with total awareness. Concentration has increased. 

I know my journey of Enlightenment has just begun and there is a lot Sri Amma Bhagavan has to offer me in the path ahead. So grateful for all Your timeless blessings.

The 6th of October War also referred to as the Yom Kippur War or the October War, was a pivotal conflict in 1973 involving Israel and its neighboring nations, Egypt and Syria.  On this day we celebrate 50 years since the day the first domino fell on the path that led to Egypt reclaiming Sinai and ending all conflict with Israel.   To commemorate this day here are some facts that you may or may not have known about the war.   Tap the link to read the full article: https://egyptianstreets.com/2023/10/06/50-years-to-the-6th-of-october-war-remembering-a-historic-clash-between-israel-egypt-and-syria/  #egypt #6thofoctoberwar #yomkippurwar #6october

I'm wondering, what war in the history of Battletech would have the most space battles? Better yet, is there any conflict that was fought almost ***entirely*** in the void, as in the major battles were won in space and the ground combat was a smaller, less important part of the conflict? I literally can't get enough of space battles in sci-fi. Rogue One is my favourite Star Wars movie and the space part of the Battle of Scarif is the best part of the film imo, Homeworld 1 and Homeworld Emergence/Cataclysm are some of my most played video games, Battlefleet Gothic is my most played tabletop game by far (closely followed by BattleTech), so on and so forth, I'm sure you get the picture. Now I know BattleTech is a game about big, stompy, awesome robots and I'm aware of the kinda dumb piece of the lore that says everyone "forgot" how to make WarShips since ROM killed all the people that knew how to build 'em, but I'm still curious about this part of the lore. If I had to take a guess, I would assume the war with the most space battles would be either the Reunification War or the Amaris Civil War. During the Jihad there were ***a lot*** of space battles and it's said that a great number of these were won by boarding actions that saw numerous ships captured by all sides of the conflict, but no navy in that era even came close matching the size of the truly massive SLDF navy of the Star League era. Would I be right in assuming that the Star League Civil War or Reunification War had the most ship battles? I am not asking about a single battle, like the liberation of Terra, I mean like a full war fought almost entirely in the void of space/a conflict filled with space battles :)

It is with heavy hearts that we share the passing of Yogi, the male Brown Bear. He was a wild born bear who came to the Zoo in 1994 from Yellowstone National Park. He was brought here due to repeated human area conflict and would have been euthanized if no suitable placement was found.

Born in 1992, Yogi far exceeded his life expectancy and over the years, he developed arthritis. The John Ball Zoo vet team prescribed him medications to ease the pain. As time passed, Yogi began experiencing severe mobility issues and was recently immobilized to examine the extremity of his arthritis. The ability to regain control of Yogi's discomfort was no longer a realistic solution.

Yogi was a gentle giant. Keepers Jackie explains Yogi as an absolute joy to work with. "Yogi's favorite day of the week was bone day. He would pass up his dinner and any sweet snack we had for him, and he would be busy chewing until all the meat was gone."

In honor of Yogi, we will be hosting a, "Teddy Bear," drive. Animal care supervisor, Jaime, worked with Yogi for 13 years. "With such a large impact on our community, and especially on his animal care team, I really wanted to find a meaningful way to celebrate such a special bear."

Jaime wanted to create a way to carry on Yogi's lasting connection he made with guests. "A "Teddy Bear" drive would be the perfect way to remember him and provide for kids who need a buddy! Please help us gather a small army of Yogi bears over the next two weeks to bring to the kids at Helen Devos Children's Hospital."

The details are:  

Dates: October 5 through October 19
Drop off location: John Ball Zoo Guest Services office, 10am ‚Äì 4pm, daily.
Requirements:  All stuffed animal donations must be new with tags still attached
All donation will be provided to Helen DeVos Children's Hospital

text: We're on a mission to inspire the protection of Africa's wildlife and wild spaces! ‚úäüåç Our belief that people and wildlife can only survive and thrive together is what drives us to spread this message far and wide. From wildlife crime to habitat loss, Africa's wildlife is under significant threat. But with your support, we can make a real difference. Together, we can protect our endangered species and preserve natural habitats; we can find solutions to human-wildlife conflict and help local economies benefit from wildlife tourism. Let‚Äôs rewrite the narrative of conservation for this generation and the next! üíö Join us in amplifying the voices of our ambassadors and sharing the importance of our rich natural heritage with your friends, family and network! #JoinTheHerd and be part of a movement that's creating meaningful change. üêòü¶èü¶ç #JoinTheHerd #WildAfricaFund #Wildlife #WildlifeConservation #Conservation #ThreatenedWildlife #Community #AnimalLovers #Passion

We would like to issue a statement about the drama that happened earlier this week. When we originally posted the contest photos for our Friday the 13th Flash, we included several images found on Pinterest that were titled "Friday the 13th flash tattoos" among the photos. Friday the 13th is a tattoo industry holiday where spooky images, often including the numbers 13 and 31, and flash is circulated all over the internet. Any shop you find having these sales is using similar if not identical images for this popular holiday. A particular artist, in another state, saw our 28 pages of flash and immediately started accusing us of "Stealing" her artwork. Before the post had even been up for 10 minutes she had rallied people to trash talk us and leave us bad reviews. Then we removed the entire post to avoid conflict but she continued to harass us. At this point we still didn't know which sheet was "stolen" so we were unable to investigate properly, without proper investigation to determine if we were really in the wrong, we explained that we would continue sell any flash posted, as none of it was copyrighted or trademarked with watermarks prohibiting us from doing so. After several hours of harassment we finally discovered the flash sheet in question. It was a lucky rabbits foot sheet that we found online, like many others. This artist was upset that she had not been tagged in the post giving her credit for her $13 flash. If the sheet in question was actually her artwork, Her feelings were valid but her behavior was not necessary, especially since we removed it immediately. Upon investigating the artist's social media pages, we discovered that most of the flash she used is copyright images and images found to be circulated all over the internet. A simple reverse google search pointed out that NONE of it was original, all of it was the same flash sheets that we've all been using for years. She has never tagged the original artists, which was her main complaint about us, nor has she said the her posts "not my art, would like to duplicate this" she claims it all as her own. After all of you came together for us, leaving reviews and comments, as she had done, the artist saw that she was in the wrong and issued a public apology. The owner of the shop addressed it as well and admitted that it was not her original ideas. These apologies have since been taken down but we have them saved as screenshots. Thank you to our followers for understanding that "Theft" was never the intention, we used several sheets we found on Pinterest, that are coincidentally the same sheets the shop in another state had posted. They were not watermarked images, and they were amongst other circulated Friday 13th flash sheets. In the tattoo industry, Friday the 13th flash gets circulated world wide. Tattoo flash is meant to be duplicated, any flash that is custom has watermarks to avoid being "stolen". This particular shop did exactly what we were accused of doing, which was sharing flash and tattoos that were not original. In fact, we avoid posting our original artwork because our flash has been taken in the past, rather than being upset and rallying against them we felt flattered that they liked our work and that we reached so far for them to duplicate it! The highest compliment you can get, is someone duplicating your job well done. Many people do not agree with us reusing flash. Many of those who said we "lost" a paying customer over this are those who have personally brought in Pinterest images and wanted them tattooed on themselves or w people who only come in when we have $13 tattoos! Much of the flash you have tattooed on you is duplicated stuff you found on the internet. Very rarely are we given the opportunity to produce "original" tattoos. But when we do, our artists knock it out of the park! So remember, if you really want to support an artist, getting their personal custom artwork is a great way to start, rather than bringing in stuff you found on the Internet. ü§∑ we will tattoo it regardless, it's what you want after all. Since the drama is over and the artist has apologized for her inappropriate behavior, we have reposted our flash. We only included the sheets put together by the artists in our shop with popular images we know to be Friday the 13th favorites. We will be tattooing from over 30 sheets of flash this year, including several industry favorites, but only the contest sheets are up to be voted on as we held a contest for the apprentices and need accurate voting results to determine a winner. Cant wait to see everyone next week!

Torah Portion for the Sabbath SHEMINI ATZERET (YIZKOR) 22 Tishrei 5784. [6th/7th October 2023]. The Torah - Deuteronomy 14:22-27. The Prophets - 1st Kings 8:54-61. 613 Codified Laws - PC: 181-185; PR: 254-260. Sunset Time: High Tabernacle Nnobi 6:21p.m. Enugu: 6:19p.m. Abuja: 6:18p.m. Lagos: 6:35p.m. Jerusalem: 6:18p.m. Los Angeles: 6:30p.m. Baltimore: 6:41p.m. Atlanta: 7:15p.m. London: 6:27p.m. Douala: 6:11p.m. Yaound√©: 6:03p.m. Banjul: 6:52p.m. Accra: 5:50p.m. Libreville: 6:13p.m. Johannesburg: 6:09p.m. Nairobi: 6:24p.m. Cotonou: 6:39p.m. Abidjan: 6:05p.m. Freetown: 6:41p.m. Dallas: 7:05p.m. Calgary: 7:03p.m. Every day gives us an opportunity to begin anew, to correct and repair, to grow and become better, to heal and to achieve. The Sabbath is much more so than any other day because it holds in its fold immense blessings and opportunities for reborn. So, this is our prayer this Sabbath: ‚ÄúO HaShem, Thou art our God, we will exalt Thee, we will praise Thy name, for Thou hast done wonderful things; even counsels of old, in faithfulness and truth.‚Äù (Isaiah 25:1). As we keep the Shabbat, we mustn‚Äôt fail to recount His enduring goodness, for keeping us safe, alive, and well in these very turbulent and virus beleaguered times. We also include the fervent prayer that God will, in His compassionate mercy, heal the world and bring an end to every pestilence, pandemic, conflict and war. Let us therefore keep from defiling the Shabbat and remember that more than we have kept the Shabbat, the SHABBAT has kept us as a people, together, and safe from annihilation. May HASHEM, the Eternal One, blessed is He, grant that we experience the limitless joy of the holy Shabbat and through it, bring peace to our borders and shower His blessings upon our leaders that they may lead the nation(s) in righteousness, with equity and justice. Amen. #shabbatblessingsüôèüèæüïäüòá ‚ÄúBaruch atah, Adonai Eloheinu, Melech haolam, shehecheyanu v'kiy'manu v'higianu laz'man hazeh.‚Äù ("Praise to You, Adonai our God, Sovereign of the universe, for giving us life, for sustaining us, and for enabling us to reach this season.") Chag Sameach! - Happy holiday!

Apoi, articolul relata cƒÉ omul de »ôtiin»õƒÉ ‚Äûs-a √ÆmbogƒÉ»õit gƒÉsind modalitƒÉ»õi de a ucide mai mul»õi oameni mai repede dec√¢t oric√¢nd √Ænainte‚Äù. P√¢nƒÉ √Æn 2014, 864 de oameni »ôi 25 de organiza»õii primiserƒÉ Nobelul. Dintre laurea»õi, doar 47 erau femei, de aceea comitetul de acordare a premiilor a fost acuzat cƒÉ ignorƒÉ femeile. Una dintre cele mai cunoscute scƒÉpƒÉri ale comisiei o are √Æn centru pe Jocelyn Bell Burnell. Bell Burnell este cea care a descoperit pulsarii, √Æn 1967, »ôi a publicat o lucrare √ÆmpreunƒÉ cu √ÆndrumƒÉtorul ei, Antony Hewish. Numai cƒÉ pentru descoperire au fost premia»õi doar Hewish »ôi un alt coleg de-al femeii, Martin Ryle. Practic, lui Jocelya Bell Burnell i-au fost ‚Äûfurate‚Äù meritele acestei descoperiri. Cel mai controversat premiu Nobel este, probabil, cel pentru pace. Mul»õi dintre cei care l-au primit au fost critica»õi pentru comportamente care nu promoveazƒÉ pacea, dimpotrivƒÉ. Printre cele mai notabile exemple se numƒÉrƒÉ liderul Organiza»õiei de Eliberare a Palestinei (OLP), Yasser Arafat. √én 1994, acesta a √ÆmpƒÉr»õit premiul cu israelienii Yitzhak Rabin »ôi Shimon Peres pentru munca lor legatƒÉ de Acordul de la Oslo, parte integrantƒÉ a procesului de pace dintre Palestina »ôi Israel. √énsƒÉ mul»õi critici au atras aten»õia asupra faptului cƒÉ, √Æn timp ce Arafat era liderul Fatah, OLP a comis numeroase acte de terorism. Cine-i acolo? Adolf Hitler »ôi Iosif Stalin. Care Hitler »ôi Stalin? Nominaliza»õii la Premiul Nobel pentru Pace, bine√Æn»õeles. Nu »õi se pare amuzant? Nu a fost nici c√¢nd Hitler a fost propus pentru premiu, √Æn 1939. Un politician suedez l-a nominalizat pe Hitler √Æn spirit de glumƒÉ‚Äù (sau poate influen»õat de nazi»ôti), √ÆnsƒÉ nimƒÉnui nu i s-a pƒÉrut amuzant. Nominalizarea a creat un scandal uria»ô »ôi a fost retrasƒÉ imediat. √énsƒÉ nominalizƒÉrile din 1945 »ôi 1948 ale liderului sovietic Iosif Stalin au fost c√¢t se poate de serioase. Cei mai mul»õi considerƒÉ cƒÉ Premiul Nobel este o onoare importantƒÉ. √énsƒÉ doi oameni au refuzat premiul. Scriitorul francez Jean-Paul Sartre a refuzat premiul pentru literaturƒÉ, care i-a fost decernat √Æn 1964. √én 1974, i s-a alƒÉturat Le Duc Tho, care, alƒÉturi de Henry Kissinger, a primit premiul pentru eforturile de a pune capƒÉt RƒÉzboiului din Vietnam. √énsƒÉ Tho a refuzat distinc»õia, spun√¢nd cƒÉ ‚Äûpacea nu a fost √ÆncƒÉ instauratƒÉ‚Äù. Hitler reapare pe lista noastrƒÉ, de data aceasta pentru faptul cƒÉ avea o aversiune fa»õƒÉ de premiile Nobel. Aceasta a pornit de la faptul cƒÉ jurnalistul german Carl von Ossietzky, un critic vehement al lui Hitler, a primit Premiul Nobel pentru Pace √Æn 1935. Ulterior, Hitler le-a interzis germanilor sƒÉ accepte Premiul Nobel »ôi a creat o alternativƒÉ: Premiul Na»õional German pentru ArtƒÉ »ôi »òtiin»õƒÉ. Richard Kuhn (1938, chimie), Adolf Butenandt (1939, chimie) »ôi Gerhard Domagk (1939, fiziologie »ôi medicinƒÉ) au fost obliga»õi sƒÉ refuze distinc»õia. Ace»ôtia au intrat √Æn posesia diplomelor »ôi medaliilor mai t√¢rziu. √én 2008, Harald zur Hausen a primit Premiul Nobel pentru Fiziologie sau MedicinƒÉ, pentru descoperirea virusului papilloma (HPV) »ôi a legƒÉturii acestuia cu cancerul de col uterin. Problema? AstraZeneca, producƒÉtorul vaccinurilor √Æmpotriva HPV, sponsoriza site-ul web al comitetului Nobel. √én plus, doi membri ai comisiei care l-au ales pe zur Hausen aveau legƒÉturi cu AstraZeneca. De»ôi nu a ie»ôit la ivealƒÉ vreo √ÆncƒÉlcare a regulilor, acest conflict de interese a atras multe critici.

P R E S S R E L E A S E For Immediate Release: October 06, 2023 Contact: CPT GERALD M PANGANIBAN (SC) PA CMO Officer, 802Bde, 8ID, PA 0936-339-1762 Eastern Samar launches FReE Families Project BORONGAN CITY, Eastern Samar ‚Äì The local government of Eastern Samar in coordination with national government agencies, local police and 802nd Infantry (Peerless) Brigade under the leadership of Brigadier General Noel A Vestuir, successfully launched the Friends Rescued Engagement through their Families (FReE Families) project on October 4, 2023 at Harayupan Covered Court, Brgy. Campesao, Borongan City, Eastern Samar. This initiative is a showcase of partnership among member agencies of the Provincial Task Force- ELCAC Eastern Samar headed by Gov. Ben P. Evardone who was represented by Engr. Joselito Mutia, PTF-ELCAC, Focal Person. The activity was attended by 29 family members of 19 active NPAs who are residents of Eastern Samar. The FReE Families project aims to help the families of active NPA members in the 802nd Brigade‚Äôs area of operation in Eastern Samar from the anxiety caused by the continued membership of their relatives in the NPA. It has been observed that these family members are also pressured by the Communist Terrorist Group‚Äôs leadership to join or support the armed struggle through disinformation such as instilling hate and fear of the government. The launching event was also a venue to know the families‚Äô concerns on having loved ones involved in the communist armed movement. These family members and relatives of active NPA members were also accompanied by their respective Barangay Chairpersons and/or Councilors during the activity to show their endless support in bringing their misguided loved ones to return to the mainstream society and live a peaceful life. Present in the launching who gladly assured to support the project and directly answered their concerns are Hon. Jose Ivan Dayan C. Agda, Mayor of Borongan City and Hon. Gilbert Go, Municipal Mayor of Giporlos. Significant partner agencies from the Situational Awareness and Knowledge Management (SAKM) Cluster of the Eastern Visayas RFT-ELCAC represented by Mr. Ariel Soliman, Assistant Regional Director for Operations; DILG Eastern Samar represented by Ms. Dionesa Marie Apura, E-CLIP Alternate Provincial Focal Person; and Eastern Samar Provincial Police Office represented by PLTCOL Dexter V. Edillo, Chief, Provincial Operation Unit Officer were also present in said event. The representatives of the different agencies highlighted the significance of family members and relatives of the remaining active NPA members, to include the barangay officials, in encouraging their loved ones to abandon the armed struggle in order to live a normal and peaceful life. With the different programs aimed in ending the local communist armed conflict, the representatives of the different government units and agencies assured the families of active NPA member- surrenderee‚Äôs safety and full benefits to be provided for reunion with their families and reintegration into their communities. Gov. Evardone wholeheartedly extends his support to the initiatives for the betterment of every family, not only to the former rebels but also to the families of those who are still in the armed struggle. The governor also assured that once their loved one‚Äôs surrender, they will be protected and be given necessary assistance for their eventual return to normal life. BGen Vestuir concluded the activity with a heart-felt message to the participants. He wholeheartedly expressed: ‚ÄúLet's show them that love can defeat the anger planted by the CPP-NPA in the hearts of your relatives. As the Army Commander here in the southern part of Samar, I assure you that they will be treated well once they surrender. Contrary to the propaganda of the CTG‚Äôs leadership, the 802nd Brigade will help them in their claims of the different programs of the LGUs and our government agencies for Former Rebels (FRs) and we fully commit our support with all available resources, foot soldiers and attention for this noble endeavor of reuniting families with their loved ones that were lost because of crooked and deceptive ideology imposed upon them by the Communist Party of the Philippines (CPP). With the families united and living harmoniously peaceful, we are optimistic to have communities that are conflict-resilient, development-receptive and NPA-inhospitable. -30- #panawaganparasakapayapaan #freefamilies #802BdeLovesYou #KapayapaanParaSaLahat Kalinaw News 14th Infantry "Avenger" Battalion, Philippine Army Philippine Army 8th Civil-Military Operations Battalion - Home of Dangpanan 100.1FM 63rd Innovator Battalion 63rd Infantry "Innovator" Battalion, 8ID, Philippine Army 78th Infantry "Warrior" Battalion 78th Infantry "Warrior" Battalion, 8ID, Philippine Army 8th Infantry "Stormtroopers" Division, Philippine Army 46th Infantry "Peacemakers" Battalion, 8ID, Philippine Army 93rd Infantry "Bantay Kapayapaan" (truncated)

üì¢ Media Officer In accordance with the indicated need for a position in our Departments, as 6th October 2023, the Representative office of the foreign Humanitarian Organization "Islamic Relief WW" England, Sarajevo announces: ADVERTISEMENT Job Title: Media officer Location: Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina Reporting to: Fundraising manager, Programm manager and Director About Islamic Relief WW: Islamic Relief Worldwide is a faith-inspired, independent humanitarian and development organization that responds to the needs of vulnerable and marginalized people particularly in, but not limited to, armed conflict areas.We are United Kingdom-based with active presence over 40 countries across the globe. Islamic Relief has been operating since 1984. Islamic Relief Worldwide has been present in Bosnia and Herzegovina since 1992 and through its work continuously provides assistance and support to the population of Bosnia and Herzegovina, and seeks to mitigate the negative socio-economic impacts. Currently, Islamic Relief Bosnia and Herzegovina (IR&BIH) has its main office in Sarajevo and a sub-office in Tuzla. IR B&H operates many projects in different programs such as Child Welfare, Projects of psychosocial support, Agriculture, Fundraising, Emergency and Seasonal Projects. We operate across Bosnia and Herzegovina and work closely with Muslims and Non-Muslims, regardless of race, political affiliation, gender and belief. üìåJob Summary: The Recruitment of IT&Media Officer will be as a support, mainly for projects of IR B&H. üìåJob description: Follows the media guidelines and other policies of the IRW Headquarters and applies them in the office for BIH In coordination with the project department, works on the creation of media material for social networks with media support (photography and video clips). Media covers all projects of the Representative Office. Creating a case study of project beneficiaries (case study of beneficiaries) for all projects. At the request of the directorate, IRWW England delivers photos, reports and video material For all correspondence and requests to the IRWW headquarters, the director should be consulted. When making contacts and correspondence, submit a cc copy to the director. Ensures media coverage for all office activities/important events, including field activities. Creates and produces internal newsletters for the organization. Writes, edits, distributes various types of content, including social media materials, marketing materials and other types of content that send a message to the public. Edits videos, photos, etc. Essential: üìåQualifications,Knowledge, Experience, Skills Completed secondary school, work experience at least 1 year, computer skills, proficiency in English passed the B category driving test (active driver) Special conditions: high general and work morale, discipline, seriousness in work, diligence, patience. ‚ÄºÔ∏èNote: This job position is corresponded to the level of secondary education. Committed to Islamic Relief Worldwide values and Code of conduct. Pre-employment Checks Any employment with Islamic Relief will be subject to the following checks: screening clearance /criminal check receipt of satisfactory references Islamic Relief promotes equality and meritocracy, and seeks individuals who agree with the IR values together with our policy standards on Anti-Bribery, Child Protection, Safeguarding and Code of Conduct. üìåPLEASE NOTE: The candidate must have Bosnian citizenship. Please submit your CV with a Cover Letter only in English, with contact details of two references and your relationship with them via link: https://www.mojposao.ba/#!job;id=626133;p=1 The advertisement remains open for 7 days (until 13th October 2023). Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. üìçLokacija: Sarajevo (Rad iz firme) üìåBroj izvr≈°ilaca: 1 üìåDatum objave: 06.10.2023. üóìÔ∏èTrajanje oglasa: 7 dana (istiƒçe 13.10.2023.)

Sometimes, we know we‚Äôre growing: we practice a new skill, try a new approach, or respond in a different way. We may choose to change parts of our lives, like switching careers or trying to cook healthier meals. This type of growth often happens when we feel we have the capacity to expand, but we can often grow during periods of challenge, too. A difficult boss requires you to manage up, a conflict with a family member causes you to revisit an old, painful narrative, a health crisis throws your whole worldview off-kilter: hard, uncomfortable situations can prompt our growth in a myriad of ways. We meet challenging times with the best of ourselves when we intentionally choose to grow, giving ourselves space to learn, practice, and make adjustments as we go. I teach key skills for this kind of growth in Emotional Agility for Wellbeing at Work, a learning journey beginning this October. Learn more and register to join me. https://buytickets.at/susandavid/979103:=:https://www.tickettailor.com/events/susandavid/979103

The ranch‚Äôs chairperson Ms Phidelis Wangari says Juja Sisal Farm Limited was the original name of the ranch, before Mzee Kenyatta took it over as part of the land consolidation after independence. She adds that there are no records of how the then-president took it over in partnership with Kiambu politician Mr Njenga Karume and Nairobi politician Mr Muhuri Muchiri. There are further claims that the total acreage of the ranch, consolidated with other lands that Mzee Kenyatta and his cronies amassed to form Embakasi, was more than 30,000 acres. The ranch‚Äôs lawyer Mr Timothy Kariuki says the takeover of Juja Sisal Farm by Embakasi Ranching and its eventual registration as a new private company rendered the former entity null and void, adding that those claiming to be owners of part or whole of the private company must prove it by showing their allotment letters or share register. The ranch has been sued 86 times in ownership tussles and all the cases involve splinter groups, all identifying themselves as Embakasi Ranching shareholders. According to Mr. Mboci Njehu, a researcher at the ranch, there is no will that Sir Wigum left behind indicating that he was bequeathing his employees or family members part or whole of the farm. The ranch in its current form is known as Embakasi Ranching at the Ministry of Lands, at the Kenya Revenue Authority and at the Registrar of Companies and not by any other official name. Besides Juja Sisal Farm, there are some other 12 entities that claim ownership of the ranch. Those calling themselves Juja Sisal Farm are in three camps; Juja Sisal employees, Juja Sisal Trustees and Former Juja Sisal Ranch Welfare. There are others calling themselves Juja Residents Self-help group and Kenyatta Juja Legacy Self-help group. All of them claim a piece of the ranch and it defines the general conflict that is deliberately sponsored by those in the multifaceted cartels that have been seeking to grab this land.

Brilliant picture of a Harley and a P-39 The P-39 Airacobra is a fighter produced by Bell Aircraft for the United States Army Air Forces during World War II. It was one of the principal American fighters in service when the United States entered combat. The P-39 was used by the Soviet Air Force, and enabled individual Soviet pilots to collect the highest number of kills attributed to any U.S. fighter type flown by any air force in any conflict. Other major users of the type included the Free French, the Royal Air Force, and the Italian Co-Belligerent Air Force.

Erigios was a Macedonian officer in the army of Alexander the Great, originally from Lesvos, from where his father had come and settled in Amphipolis.During the conflict between Philip II and Alexander, Philip exiled him along with other close friends of Alexander. He returned to Macedonia with his brother Laomedon, when Alexander became the new king in 336 BC. A few years later, at the Battle of Gaugamela in 331 BC he was the commander of the cavalry of the allies, just as later, when Alexander started from Ecvatana in pursuit of Darius III in 330 BC. "When Alexander was in Arachosia, in the region that is in the heart of today's Afghanistan, he learned about an uprising of the Arians, who lived to the west, on the border of Afghanistan with Iran. He immediately sends the Mytlinaian general Erigios with his horsemen as well as other forces to suppress it. The contribution of the brave Erigius was decisive because he managed to kill in single combat the leader of the Arians, Sativarzani, "a man of strategic and manly distinction" according to Diodorus the Siculus, to occupy the area and subjugate the Arians to the power of Alexander. In 329 BC, together with Crateros and Hephaestion, and with the help of the seer Arisander, he tried to prevent Alexander from crossing the Jaxarti River with his troops against the Scythians. He died in 328 BC, when he was killed in battle against a group of Bactrian fugitives. Sources: Arrianos, Alexandrou Anavasis

text: ‚ÄúAll I heard were the sounds of an explosion, followed by the cries of my granddaughter, 'Grandpa, my leg.‚Äô‚Äù Over a decade of war in Syria has left behind a lethal legacy of mines and explosives. Among one of the most severely affected areas is Ariha, located in the Idleb governorate in northwest Syria. The conflict forced many local families to flee. When they finally returned home, they were faced with a new danger‚Äîthe mines and explosives that now contaminated their land. Abu Zeyad was on his farmland with his young granddaughter when, unaware of the danger, they crossed into a minefield. There was a catastrophic explosion, seriously injuring the little girl. In August 2022, HALO Syria identified large amounts of explosives, as well as two minefields and began work to make the community safe. Our explosive ordnance disposal (EOD) teams have since safely destroyed 133 hazardous items and earlier this year, our first-ever Mechanical Clearance Team in the region began work. Learn more about the impact of landmines in Ariha and the steps HALO is taking to help prevent further devastating accidents and build a safer, more secure future for all ‚§µÔ∏è

text:
Why is the FEAST of the OUR LADY OF THE ROSARY, on every October 7th? 
..... The story of the  VICTORY OF OUR LADY OF THE ROSARY at the Battle of Lepanto, on OCTOBER  7, 1571.

IN TIMES OF ACUTE DANGER AND HARDSHIP, WE MUST ALWAYS FLY INTO THE ARMS OF THE MOST POWERFUL MOTHER OF GOD AND TURN TO THE RECITATION OF HER HOLY ROSARY. The Battle of Lepanto is a great lesson of confidence for us today. 

When Saint Pius V became Pope, Christendom faced the perils perhaps unequaled in its history of continual conflict with the violent followers of Mohammed. All the information and intelligence that Pope Pius V had been gathering indicated that the Ottoman juggernaut was about to roll across the Mediterranean and adjacent lands, spearheaded by the Turkish fleet, with Italy and Rome as one of its target. (The Ottoman Empire is also historically known in Western Europe as the Turkish Empire)

Only Spain and Venice had the resources to resist, and they hated each other along with deep mistrust. Yet Saint Pius ‚Äî calling down divine grace as only a man of prayer could ‚Äî forged an alliance with them as the core of an organized fleet of over 200 galleys. With his considerable tact and diplomatic skills, he not only kept them unified, but he convinced them to attack the enveloping menace.

The Archbishop of Mexico had an exact copy of the HOLY IMAGE OF THE LADY OF GUADALUPE sent to King Philip II, who in turn gave it to Andrea Doria, one of the three principal admirals of the fleet, who placed it in his cabin. When the Armada went from file to line abreast and attacked on the morning of OCTOBER 7, 1571 the blue standard of OUR LADY OF GUADALUPE was also flying from the masthead of Don Juan‚Äôs flagship. 

Pope Pius V, a Dominican prelate before becoming a Pope, did what Catholics have always done in times of acute danger: FLY INTO THE ARMS OF THE MOST POWERFUL MOTHER OF GOD. As a follower of Saint Dominic, HE KNEW THE MOST EFFECTIVE MEANS OF IMPLORING HER HELP WAS THROUGH THE RECITATION OF THE HOLY ROSARY. He ordered all monasteries and convents in Rome to increase their prayers for the impending battle and organized ROSARY PROCESSIONS in which he, as sick as he was, participated. OUR LADY‚ÄôS PRESENCE THAT DAY WAS MORE ACUTELY FELT THROUGH THE HOLY ROSARY.

As the Christian fleet sailed toward the great clash, MASS WAS CELEBRATED AND THE ROSARY RECITED DAILY ON EACH VESSEL‚Ä¶.. THIS HEARTFELT REQUEST FOR DIVINE ASSISTANCE RESULTED IN A CRUSHING DEFEAT OF THE OTTOMANS AT LEPANTO THAT ENDED THEIR DOMINANCE AND CRUELTY IN THE MEDITERRANEAN. OCTOBER 7, 1571, WAS THE VICTORY OF OUR LADY OF THE MOST HOLY ROSARY, EVEN IF THE CHRISTIAN FLEET WAS GREATLY OUTNUMBERED BY THE OTTOMAN FLEET.

TO CELEBRATE OUR LADY‚ÄôS INTERCESSION AND VICTORY, THE CHURCH HAS DESIGNATED OCTOBER 7 AS THE FEAST OF OUR LADY OF THE MOST HOLY ROSARY. Similar acknowledgement to the Blessed Virgin‚Äôs intercession through the Rosary were made when John Sobieski forced the Turks to lift the Siege of Vienna in 1683 and after the victory of Prince Eugene of Savoy at Temesvar in his successful campaign to remove the Ottomans from Europe in the next century.

During a visit to the villagers of Mahera to conduct their revered Friday prayers in a historic act that will likely be etched into the history of Sierra Leone, the respected leader of the All People's Congress (APC) and Ambassador Osman Foday Yansaneh, were able to be in attendance as they took part in their revered Friday prayers, according to Dr. Samura M. W. Kamara, the respected leader of the APC party. It is worth noting that the trip of the political powerhouse was not simply a public relations campaign; it also served to celebrate the renowned Bai Bureh, the man who spearheaded the Hut Tax War, and his enduring legacy. The reason why Dr. Kamara visited Mahera wasn't just to make political points; it was also an opportunity to pay a thoughtful tribute to Bai Bureh, a great fighter whose spirit, in many ways, best defines the values of the APC, which are empowerment and resistance. During his spiritual pilgrimage to Mahera, Bai Bureh's birthplace, Dr Kamara made sure that he made a clear connection between the past and the present by picking the site of Bai Bureh's birth as the site of his pilgrimage. During his speech, he made the connection between the struggle against colonial control and the current struggle for social justice and development in our nation today. In a display of harmony that defies the division frequently seen in modern politics, today's prayer gathering drew Muslims and Christians of all ages. Dr. Kamara's visit to the Mahera mosque was a clear indication of a leader prepared to look beyond established boundaries in order to advance society. The media hysteria surrounding Dr. Kamara's travel to Mahera is probably going to die down, but the significance of this pilgrimage symbolically will definitely endure. The APC leader's acts provide a ray of hope in a time of uncertainty and conflict by serving as a reminder to Sierra Leoneans that tradition and unity may still prevail in the contemporary era.

Friday House Fellowship on the Radio: With Pee Dave üåπ üåπ üåπ üåπ üåπ Topic: Handling Conflicts in a Christian Marriage. Text:Amos 3:3, Proverbs 27:5, Col 3:16, Eph 5:19, James 5:13, James 4:7, Romans 12:18, James 1:19-20 . Marital conflict is an inevitable part of any marriage and can arise from various sources. Differences in personality, values, and expectations are just a few examples of issues that can lead to occasional conflict. However, how couples handle these conflicts is crucial in maintaining a healthy and happy relationship. As Christians, we benefit from Christian guidance on approaching conflicts constructively. The Bible offers valuable insights on handling conflicts,. Thus the following and more are ways in which we can handle conflicts in Christian marriages. Seek God‚Äôs Guidance Seeking God‚Äôs guidance is paramount. Praying together and asking for His help can provide a foundation of humility and a desire for reconciliation. It is important to remember that we are not alone in our struggles and that God is always ready to guide us toward the right path. Listen Actively Active listening is an essential skill when it comes to resolving conflict. Taking turns listening without interrupting or getting defensive can create an environment of mutual respect and understanding. Repeating what you hear can ensure that both parties fully understand each other‚Äôs perspectives. Use ‚ÄúI‚Äù Statements Using ‚ÄúI‚Äù statements instead of blaming or accusing can help express how the conflict affects you personally. This approach avoids blaming the other person and focuses on how their actions have impacted. Find Common Ground Finding common ground can be a powerful tool in resolving conflicts. Instead of focusing solely on differences, look for areas of agreement and work together towards finding a solution that benefits both parties. This approach creates a sense of teamwork and collaboration rather than opposition. Forgive Each Other Forgiveness is crucial in resolving conflicts within Christian marriage. Remembering that forgiveness does not mean forgetting, but letting go of resentment and bitterness can lead to healing within the relationship. Forgiveness allows us to move forward with love, grace, and compassion toward one another. Seek Counseling If Needed If the conflict proves too challenging to resolve on your own, seeking counseling from a Christian counselor who provides guidance and support may be necessary. Seeking outside help does not indicate weakness but rather shows a willingness to work towards resolution within the relationship. Communication Communication is integral to any healthy relationship, especially within Christian marriages where open and honest communication is paramount. Communication can help bridge the gap between two parties and facilitate understanding. The Power of Apologies Apologizing can be a powerful tool in resolving conflicts within Christian marriages. A sincere apology acknowledges any wrongdoing on our part and expresses remorse for any hurt or pain caused. It can create an environment of humility, grace, and forgiveness within the relationship. Question. What other practical steps can be applied in resolving Christian marital conflicts.?? Drop your Contributions, Prayer Request and Questions. Dolly reassures Sarab of Harleen's love and pleads with him not to let their family break apart.

Meher asks the cook what to prepare for dinner, but Harleen confronts her and demands that she choose between her brother and her unborn child.

Harleen accuses Meher of breaking her trust and tries to give back jewelry and money, but Meher insists she won't take them back unless she regains Harleen's trust.

Sarab is torn between his sister and wife, questioning the impact of his decision on their sibling relationship.

Harleen decides to leave the house, and Sarab offers to leave instead, but Dolly intervenes, urging them to talk and find a solution.
Harleen suggests dividing everything between them, causing shock and tension among the family members.

Sarab agrees to divide their assets to keep his sister happy, even though Meher pleads with Harleen not to break their family.

Kulwant discusses the possibility of dividing their assets among her children, while Sarab, Harleen, and Meher are still in conflict.

Rovi informs Sarab that the auction papers are ready, and Harleen prepares for the division, while Meher resigns herself to the situation.

Our beloved Prophet PBUH had such an affinity for Yemen and its people he was reported saying: ‚ÄúThe people of Yemen are on the verge of ascending upon you as if they are clouds. They are the best (people) on Earth.‚Äù And today much of the world has turned their back on Yemen. It has been struck by war, conflict, famine and drought. Govt ready to combat organised crime The Government admits crime rates, including instances of violence, theft and drug-related offences have risen alarmingly in recent years, posing a significant threat to the safety and security of our citizens. Additionally, the presence of organised crime groups and the illicit trade they engage in further exacerbates the situation, undermining our efforts towards progress and development. Furthermore, the Government cannot ignore the issue of tribal conflicts that persist in certain regions of our country. Internal Security Minister Peter Tsiamalili Jr, however, presented in Parliament in his ministerial address that the government is fully committed to addressing these pressing issues. ‚ÄúIn light of these challenges, I assure you that the government is fully committed to ensuring the internal security of PNG. We recognise that a multifaceted approach is necessary to effectively tackle these issues and protect our citizens. Therefore, we will focus on several key areas of action,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThese conflicts, fueled by historical grievances, land disputes, and socioeconomic disparities, continue to disrupt communities, displace families, and hinder the establishment of lasting peace and stability. ‚ÄúIt is our duty to address the root cause of these conflicts and work towards their resolution through dialogue, mediation, and equitable development initiatives. We will prioritise law enforcement and enhance the capacity of our police force. This includes strengthening training programs, equipping police officers with necessary resources, and ensuring that personnel are adequately distributed across the country. ‚ÄúWe will work towards increasing the number of police officers, improving their skills in investigation and crime prevention, and fostering better coordination with relevant government agencies. ‚ÄúWe will also take decisive steps to combat organised crime and reduce the influence of illicit activities in our society. This will involve bolstering our intelligence capabilities, enhancing border control measures, and working closely with international partners to address transnational crime networks. ‚ÄúWe will enact stricter legislation and enforce stronger penalties for those involved in organised criminal activities we will also prioritise community engagement and empowerment. We understand that sustainable security cannot be achieved solely through law enforcement measures. ‚ÄúWe will promote community-oriented initiatives that encourage dialogue, foster trust, and empower local communities to take ownership of their security. ‚ÄúBy addressing the underlying social, economic, and political factors contributing to crime and conflict, we can build resilient communities that are more resistant to violence and criminal activities,‚Äù he said. Elder's Meditation of the Day - October 6 "Lots of people hardly ever feel real soil under their feet, see plants grow except in flower pots, or get far enough beyond the street light to catch the enchantment of a night sky studded with stars. When people live far from scenes of the Great Spirit's making, it's easy for them to forget His laws." -- Tatanga Mani (Walking Buffalo), STONEY Nature is life's greatest teacher. The natural laws are hidden in nature. Hidden are solutions to everyday problems such as; conflict resolution, how to forgive, lessons about differences, how to manage organizations, how to think. Hidden are feelings. You can look at something and you will feel it. At night, have you ever looked at the sky when there are no clouds? As you look at all the stars, your heart will become very joyful. You will walk away feeling joyful and peaceful. We need to visit nature so we can see and feel these things. My Creator, let me learn nature's lessons. The meditations are copyright of Coyhis Publishing and can also be found in the book, Meditations with Native American Elders: The Four Seasons

text: Thought for the day: Sometimes taking a long time to teach something is not in the horses best interests. There are some things that should not be half taught because by half teaching it we have not really made a change. The problem is that by half teaching it we have set the horse up to learn more ways of not achieving something. Im not talking about progressive things like manoeuvres but life skills. How to not run over us or pull away cannot be half taught. "Taking the time it takes" is a good policy when bringing a horse along but often it can be an excuse for not making progress with important starting places. If you're not making progress with some of these things you are probably in need of some help. "Take the time it takes to take away the conflict in the horses life in one session." (You do not have to run a horse or fight with it to do this) The next most important thing after that is maintaining the change by being consistent. A trainer can help make a change in your horse but what takes time is forming a habit. The phenomenal and cool thing about making these changes (sometimes getting a change in the types of behaviour I am talking about is quite a job) is that if you do it well a horse will not hold it against you. I find that once I have worked through it the horse actually relaxes and likes me more. Its like someone has helped him by taking the conflict out of his life. Until this is achieved we really can't effectively teach the things that they learn over time.

Sermon Outline October 6, 2023 Title: Rules For Relevant Living Text: 1 Thessalonians 5:11-28 Introduction: Paul sets forth several rules to experience the fullness of life in righteous kind of living. 1. Be RESPECTFUL *verses 11-12, (without church leaders, we will become HARASSED and HELPLESS again) "Therefore encourage one another and build each other up, just as in fact you are doing. Now we ask you, brothers, to respect those who work hard among you, who are over you in the Lord and who admonish you." 2. Be GRATEFUL *verse 13a, (always consider their SACRIFICES instead of their SHORTCOMINGS) "Hold them in the highest regard in love because of their work." 3. Be PEACEFUL *verse 13b, (peace isn't in the absence of CONFLICT but in the craving of this) "Live in peace with each other." 4. Be HELPFUL *verse 14a, (helping others makes us HAPPIER and HEALTHIER) "And we urge you, brothers, warn those who are idle, encourage the timid, help the weak." 5. Be GRACEFUL *verse 14b, (CALMLY endure things without COMPLAINING) "Be patient with everyone." 6. Be MERCIFUL *verse 15a, (to FORGIVE for the restoration of broken FELLOWSHIPS) "Make sure that nobody pays back wrong for wrong." 7. Be THOUGHTFUL *verse 15b, (WITHSTAND evil and WILLFULLY reciprocate with kindness) "But always try to be kind to each other and to everyone else." Application: To really experience fullness of life, be like J-O-Y-C-E M-A-G-P-I-L-E. J-OYFUL living *verse 16, "Be joyful always." O-VERCOME things in prayer *verse 17, "Pray continually." Y-EARN to be thankful *verse 18, "Give thanks in all circumstances, for this is God‚Äôs will for you in Christ Jesus." C-OMMUNE with the Holy Spirit *verse 19 "Do not put out the Spirit‚Äôs fire." E-STEEM the Word of God *verse 20, "Do not treat prophecies with contempt." M-EASURE all things *verse 21a, "Test everything." A-DHERE what is good *verse 21b, "Hold on to the good." G-IVING UP evilish *verse 22, "Avoid every kind of evil." P-ERMIT sanctification process *verses 23-24, "May God himself, the God of peace, sanctify you through and through. May your whole spirit, soul and body be kept blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. The one who calls you is faithful and he will do it." I-NTERCEDE for others *verse 25, "Brothers, pray for us." L-OVE others *verses 26-27, "Greet all the brothers with a holy kiss. I charge you before the Lord to have this letter read to all the brothers." E-NJOY the grace of God *verse 28, "The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you." Conclusion: Fullness of life is not in its LENGTH or in its LARGENESS, but in how we LIVE each day that God has LENT us.

On this date in 1927, "The Jazz Singer" premiered. As the first feature-length motion picture with not only a synchronized recorded music score, but also lip-synchronous singing and speech in several isolated sequences, its release heralded the commercial ascendance of sound films and ended the silent film era. Directed by Alan Crosland and produced by Warner Bros. with its Vitaphone sound-on-disc system, the film, featuring six songs performed by Al Jolson, is based on a play of the same name by Samson Raphaelson, adapted from one of his short stories, "The Day of Atonement." The film depicts the fictional story of Jakie Rabinowitz, a young man who defies the traditions of his devout Jewish family. After singing popular tunes in a beer garden he is punished by his father, a hazzan (cantor), prompting Jakie to run away from home. Some years later, now calling himself Jack Robin, he has become a talented jazz singer. He attempts to build a career as an entertainer but his professional ambitions ultimately come into conflict with the demands of his home and heritage. Darryl F. Zanuck won an Honorary Academy Award for producing the film; Alfred A. Cohn was nominated for Best Writing (Adaptation) at the 1st Academy Awards. In 1996, "The Jazz Singer" was selected for preservation in the National Film Registry of "culturally, historically or aesthetically significant" motion pictures. In 1998, the film was chosen in voting conducted by the American Film Institute as one of the best American films of all time, ranking at number ninety. (Wikipedia)

5th October, 2023 THE CHIEF JUSTICE OF NIGERIA AND CHAIRMAN, NATIONAL JUDICIAL COUNCIL THREE ARMS ZONE FCT, ABUJA SIR, RE: PETITION AGAINST HON. JUSTICE B.M TUKUR, HON. JUSTICE OMEKA ELEKWA AND HON. JUSTICE O.A ADETUJOYE FOR DELIBERATE PERVERSION OF JUSTICE AND CONSPIRACY TO REMOVE CANDIDATES OF OUR PARTY ELECTED TO PARLIAMENT The above refers. Our attention has been drawn to a purported Petition with the above caption written by the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) dated 15th September, 2023 and signed by the Chairman and Secretary of the Plateau State Chapter of the PDP. As interested parties who also sponsored candidates in the 2023 General Election in Plateau State, we are obligated to put the records straight as it is very shocking and surprising to us. This is also very clear from the content of the Petition written by the PDP against the Learned Judges of the Election Petition Tribunal in Plateau State as can be seen, no exact action of the jurists capable of perverting Justice was pointed out by the PDP aside the fact that the Judges delivered Judgments. No procedural error was pointed out to show bias, lack of fair hearing or descending into the arena of conflict. PUTTING THE RECORDS STRAIGHT The Judgments delivered by HON. JUSTICE B.M TUKUR, HON. JUSTICE OMEKA ELEKWA AND HON. JUSTICE O.A ADETUJOYE is in line with cautions and warnings that were in the public domain before the 2023 general elections, about the inescapable disaster or peril that would eventually befall the PDP in Plateau State for disrespect, continuous violation and disobedience to the Judgments and Orders of Court. Well, like it is said, "time reveals". But it is worrisome that the PDP are making storms at the outcome of the decisions under review. For the avoidance of doubt, it is important to note that the General Elections where members of the public go out to vote, is actually the concluding part of the electoral process. Election is a process and defect in any of the processes, renders the outcome of the secondary election, a nullity no matter how well conducted it might otherwise be regarded. The process inter alia, includes Registration of Political Parties, Congresses to elect EXCO for the Party at all levels, Conduct of Primary Elections and Qualification of both the Political Party to sponsor candidates and that of the Candidates to contest an Election. All these processes are regulated by Law and must be adhered to, stricto senso. Thankfully, the Court is the last part of the Electoral Process and that is where we are presently. The Tribunal at all levels in Plateau State have been inundated with one potent Ground of Petition by both the Labour Party (LP), Peoples Redemption Party (PRP) and the All Progressives Congress (APC) aside the general irregularities in the Conduct of Elections. This Ground challenges the Qualification of PDP to field in candidates to contest for elections in Plateau State while living in flagrant disobedience to Court Orders. In proving Ground One, the Petitioners relied and tendered avalanche of cases decided against the PDP as follows: 1. Certified True Copies of the Judgment in Suit No. PLD/J/304/2020- Between: Bitrus Kaze and Others Vs. PDP and Others. This is the genesis of the misfortunes of PDP. Here, the Court ordered PDP to conduct Ward, LGA and State Congresses to elect their leaders. In other words, the Court ordered PDP to form their "structure". Mind you, forming Political Structure is part of the Electoral Process a Political Party must fulfil. 2. Certified True Copies of Judgment Between: PDP v Plateau State Independent Electoral Commission (PLASIEC) in Suit No. PLD/J/250/2021. Since PDP failed to obey the Order in the first case, the PLASIEC excluded PDP from participating in the Local Government Elections for not complying with the Orders of Court. The PDP filed the above case against PLASIEC and lost. PDP appealed this case to the Court of Appeal and lost on the ground that they are in disobedience to Court Order and when the PDP further appealed to the Supreme Court, they abandoned the Appeal and the Supreme Court dismissed the Appeal on the 7th December, 2022 for want of diligent prosecution. 3. Certified True Copies of the Judgement of the High Court of Plateau State in Suit No. PLD/J276CV/2020 dated 24/6/2021 Between: Ishaku Adamu Izang Vs. Markus Husseini Nyam (AKA Kaunde). In this case, the High Court granted the reliefs claimed by the Claimants and set aside the Local Government Congresses conducted by PDP and PDP is yet to conduct congresses for the purpose of constituting its Wards, Local Government and State organs of the Party. 4. Certified True Copies of the Ruling of the High Court of Plateau State in Suit No. PLD/J276CV/2020 dated 24/2/2022 Between: Ishaku Adamu Izang Vs. Markus Husseini Nyam (AKA Kaunde Without conducting special congresses to constitute the various organs of the Party in Plateau State, PDP filed a Motion seeking to set aside the (truncated)

On a Day Like Today ~ October 6, 2022. HRH Sophie, The Countess of Wessex, currently known as HRH The Duchess of Edinburgh, continued her state visit to the Democratic Republic of Congo. HRH first met with Minister for Justice Rose Mutombo and other Congolese ministers regarding the urgent need to address conflict related sexual violence at the British High Commissioner's Residence in Kinshasa. HRH then attended a reception at the British High Commissioner's Residence where she joined campaigners working across the country to uphold and protect women's rights. The group discussed ways to empower women and girls. The Countess also met with Prof Nshuti Manasseh, the Minister of State for Foreign Affairs and Jeannette Bayisenge, the Minister for Gender and Family Promotion - amid other leading figures. HRH was then received by the First Lady Democratic Republic of Congo, Denise Nyak√©ru Tshisekedi. This was then followed by a meeting with the President of the Democratic Republic of the Congo Felix Tshisekedi at the Cite De L'Union Africaine in Kinshasa. JUSTICE O.A ADETUJOYE FOR DELIBERATE PERVERSION OF JUSTICE AND CONSPIRACY TO REMOVE CANDIDATES OF OUR PARTY ELECTED TO PARLIAMENT The above refers. Our attention has been drawn to a purported Petition with the above caption written by the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) dated 15th September, 2023 and signed by the Chairman and Secretary of the Plateau State Chapter of the PDP. As interested parties who also sponsored candidates in the 2023 General Election in Plateau State, we are obligated to put the records straight as it is very shocking and surprising to us. This is also very clear from the content of the Petition written by the PDP against the Learned Judges of the Election Petition Tribunal in Plateau State as can be seen, no exact action of the jurists capable of perverting Justice was pointed out by the PDP aside the fact that the Judges delivered Judgments. No procedural error was pointed out to show bias, lack of fair hearing or descending into the arena of conflict. PUTTING THE RECORDS STRAIGHT The Judgments delivered by HON. JUSTICE B.M TUKUR, HON. JUSTICE OMEKA ELEKWA AND HON. JUSTICE O.A ADETUJOYE is in line with cautions and warnings that were in the public domain before the 2023 general elections, about the inescapable disaster or peril that would eventually befall the PDP in Plateau State for disrespect, continuous violation and disobedience to the Judgments and Orders of Court. Well, like it is said, "time reveals". But it is worrisome that the PDP are making storms at the outcome of the decisions under review. For the avoidance of doubt, it is important to note that the General Elections where members of the public go out to vote, is actually the concluding part of the electoral process. Election is a process and defect in any of the processes, renders the outcome of the secondary election, a nullity no matter how well conducted it might otherwise be regarded. The process inter alia, includes Registration of Political Parties, Congresses to elect EXCO for the Party at all levels, Conduct of Primary Elections and Qualification of both the Political Party to sponsor candidates and that of the Candidates to contest an Election. All these processes are regulated by Law and must be adhered to, stricto senso. Thankfully, the Court is the last part of the Electoral Process and that is where we are presently. The Tribunal at all levels in Plateau State have been inundated with one potent Ground of Petition by both the Labour Party (LP), Peoples Redemption Party (PRP) and the All Progressives Congress (APC) aside the general irregularities in the Conduct of Elections. This Ground challenges the Qualification of PDP to field in candidates to contest for elections in Plateau State while living in flagrant disobedience to Court Orders. In proving Ground One, the Petitioners relied and tendered avalanche of cases decided against the PDP as follows: 1. Certified True Copies of the Judgment in Suit No. PLD/J/304/2020- Between: Bitrus Kaze and Others Vs. PDP and Others. This is the genesis of the misfortunes of PDP. Here, the Court ordered PDP to conduct Ward, LGA and State Congresses to elect their leaders. In other words, the Court ordered PDP to form their "structure". Mind you, forming Political Structure is part of the Electoral Process a Political Party must fulfil. 2. Certified True Copies of Judgment Between: PDP v Plateau State Independent Electoral Commission (PLASIEC) in Suit No. PLD/J/250/2021. Since PDP failed to obey the Order in the first case, the PLASIEC excluded PDP from participating in the Local Government Elections for not complying with the Orders of Court. The PDP filed the above case against PLASIEC and lost. PDP appealed this case to the Court of Appeal and lost on the ground that they are in disobedience to Court Order and when the PDP further appealed to the Supreme Court, they abandoned the Appeal and the Supreme Court dismissed the Appeal on the 7th December, 2022 for want of diligent prosecution. 3. Certified True Copies of the Judgement of the High Court of Plateau State in Suit No. PLD/J276CV/2020 dated 24/6/2021 Between: Ishaku Adamu Izang Vs. Markus Husseini Nyam (AKA Kaunde). In this case, the High Court granted the reliefs claimed by the Claimants and set aside the Local Government Congresses conducted by PDP and PDP is yet to conduct congresses for the purpose of constituting its Wards, Local Government and State organs of the Party. 4. Certified True Copies of the Ruling of the High Court of Plateau State in Suit No. PLD/J276CV/2020 dated 24/2/2022 Between: Ishaku Adamu Izang Vs. Markus Husseini Nyam (AKA Kaunde Without conducting special congresses to constitute the various organs of the Party in Plateau State, PDP filed a Motion seeking to set aside the (truncated)

Callie Eh, Malaysian / Swiss Photographer, born 1972 The Journey, (Morocco), 2022 Fine Art Photography "A sunset in Sahara displays some of the most spectacular sand dunes, representing the colors of nature with an orange glow and shadow reflection." Born and raised in Malaysia, currently based in Switzerland. Her travels have inspired her to capture life with photography. What started off as a hobby, capturing special moments of her time around new cities and environments eventually evolved into a career she never foresaw coming. This very passion drove her to use the camera to express and deliver narratives previously unseen and untold. For her, photography became more than a way of creating memories. ‚ÄãPhotography has been a tremendous support for Callie and It has been a refuge for Callie during difficult times and a safe space to explore a multitude of emotions concerning love, conflict, and hope. Callie‚Äôs works mostly refer to life ‚ÄúIn the moment‚Äù. She captures people to reveal honesty and express the authenticity of their individuality, heritage, and life. The raw power of her images makes us want to know more about the subjects, their life, and their personal stories. ‚ÄãARTIST STATEMENT For me photography was a life-saver. It picked me up at a difficult time in my life and I have not let it go ever since. Originally from Malaysia, I have lived in various countries and I am now based in Switzerland. Photography has changed my view of the world and has made me see things differently. I like to mix genres but my greatest photographic passion right now is documentary photography, inspired by my travels, the people I meet, the different cultures and the different ways of life.
The older I get, the more I realize I do NOT want to be around drama, conflict or stress. I WILL stop coming around those that do. I just want a cozy home, and to be surrounded by good people

‚ÄúCaptain Jack‚Äù, Kintpuash (c. 1837-1873) Modoc Tribe, Oregon and California Kintpuash was born near Tule Lake, an area that now straddles the Oregon-California border. The ancestral homeland of the Modoc Peoples consisted of 5,000 acres until 1864 when they were forcibly removed by the federal government to the lands of their neighbors on the newly-created Klamath Reservation. The Klamath was a much larger tribe than the Modoc, and conflict was inevitable. Now casually referred to as ‚ÄúCaptain Jack‚Äù by white colonizers, Kintpuash stood firm. In 1865 he led a band of Modoc from the reservation back to their lands in California. Four years went by before the United States army rounded them up again and back to Klamath territory, but Kintpuash was undaunted. In 1870 he marched back home again with 180 of his Modoc kinsmen. The government‚Äôs outright refusal to allow the Modoc back into their homelands led to the outbreak of the Modoc War from 1872 to 1873. Kintpuash fled with his band into the area now protected as the Lava Beds National Monument, and they settled into this natural fortress. His warriors made use of its many caves and trenches in the lava beds for defensive fighting, and women and children could be sheltered there. When the Modoc were finally located, the Army launched an attack on January 17, 1873. The US Army was beaten in this conflict but they weren‚Äôt retreating either. Kintpuash‚Äôs advisers suggested that the Army would leave if their warriors killed its leader General Edward Canby, (the future namesake of the town of Canby, Oregon) but Kintpuash hoped for a peaceful solution that would allow his people to stay in their territory. It wasn‚Äôt to be. During the next meeting of the peace commission on April 11, Kintpuash and several other Modoc broke down and drew pistols at a prearranged signal; he shot General Canby twice in the head. For this, he was executed on October 3, 1873. The area of the Lava Beds National Monument where Captain Jack and his men held out against the United States Army is now known as Captain Jack‚Äôs Stronghold. It took until 1984 for Kintpuash‚Äôs skull to be returned for proper reburial by his Modoc descendants. He is buried at Fort Klamath Park, Oregon.

He feared that sin was so offensive in the sight of his Father that their separation was eternal. The temptation that his own Father had forever left Him, caused that fearful cry from the cross, "My God, My God, why hast Thou forsaken Me?" BEcho September 15,  1892, par. 2

Though all was enshrouded in gloom, yet amid the awful darkness, which was felt even by sympathizing nature, the Redeemer drained the mysterious cup to the dregs. Though He realizes but dimly that He shall triumph over death, He cries with a loud voice, "Father, into thy hands I commend my spirit." He is acquainted with the character of his Father; He understands his justice, his mercy, and his great love; in submission He commends Himself to God. Amid the convulsions of nature, the amazed spectators hear the dying words of the Man of Calvary, "It is finished!" BEcho September 15,  1892, par. 3

The heaving earth, the rent rocks, and the terrific darkness, proclaimed that it was the Son of God who died. There was a mighty earthquake. The vail of the temple was rent in twain.  BEcho September 15,  1892, par. 4

Jesus did not yield up his life until He had accomplished the work which He came to do, and exclaimed with his expiring breath, "It is finished." Angels rejoiced as the words were uttered. They knew that Satan was defeated, his kingdom lost. The great plan of redemption, which was dependent upon the death of Christ, had been thus far carried out, and there was joy in heaven that through faith in Christ the sons of Adam could finally be exalted to the throne of God. BEcho September 15,  1892, par. 5

. O, what love! what amazing love! that the Son of God should come to earth to be made sin for us, in order that we might be reconciled to God, and exalted to a place with Him in the mansions of glory. And O, what is man that such a price should be paid for his redemption! BEcho September 15,  1892, par. 7

Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God!" Here is love that no language can express. BEcho September 15,  1892, par. 9

Friday House Fellowship on the Radio: With Pee Dave üåπ üåπ üåπ üåπ üåπ Topic: Handling Conflicts in a Christian Marriage. Text:Amos 3:3, Proverbs 27:5, Col 3:16, Eph 5:19, James 5:13, James 4:7, Romans 12:18, James 1:19-20 . Marital conflict is an inevitable part of any marriage and can arise from various sources. Differences in personality, values, and expectations are just a few examples of issues that can lead to occasional conflict. However, how couples handle these conflicts is crucial in maintaining a healthy and happy relationship. As Christians, we benefit from Christian guidance on approaching conflicts constructively. The Bible offers valuable insights on handling conflicts,. Thus the following and more are ways in which we can handle conflicts in Christian marriages. Seek God‚Äôs Guidance Seeking God‚Äôs guidance is paramount. Praying together and asking for His help can provide a foundation of humility and a desire for reconciliation. It is important to remember that we are not alone in our struggles and that God is always ready to guide us toward the right path. Listen Actively Active listening is an essential skill when it comes to resolving conflict. Taking turns listening without interrupting or getting defensive can create an environment of mutual respect and understanding. Repeating what you hear can ensure that both parties fully understand each other‚Äôs perspectives. Use ‚ÄúI‚Äù Statements Using ‚ÄúI‚Äù statements instead of blaming or accusing can help express how the conflict affects you personally. This approach avoids blaming the other person and focuses on how their actions have impacted. Find Common Ground Finding common ground can be a powerful tool in resolving conflicts. Instead of focusing solely on differences, look for areas of agreement and work together towards finding a solution that benefits both parties. This approach creates a sense of teamwork and collaboration rather than opposition. Forgive Each Other Forgiveness is crucial in resolving conflicts within Christian marriage. Remembering that forgiveness does not mean forgetting, but letting go of resentment and bitterness can lead to healing within the relationship. Forgiveness allows us to move forward with love, grace, and compassion toward one another. Seek Counseling If Needed If the conflict proves too challenging to resolve on your own, seeking counseling from a Christian counselor who provides guidance and support may be necessary. Seeking outside help does not indicate weakness but rather shows a willingness to work towards resolution within the relationship. Communication Communication is integral to any healthy relationship, especially within Christian marriages where open and honest communication is paramount. Communication can help bridge the gap between two parties and facilitate understanding. The Power of Apologies Apologizing can be a powerful tool in resolving conflicts within Christian marriages. A sincere apology acknowledges any wrongdoing on our part and expresses remorse for any hurt or pain caused. It can create an environment of humility, grace, and forgiveness within the relationship. Question. What other practical steps can be applied in resolving Christian marital conflicts.?? Drop your Contributions, Prayer Request and Questions.
