üìå LATEST: ABC News Covers Exodus of Armenians from Nagorno-Karabakh GORIS: ABC News Middle East Correspondent Tom Joyner produced a 5-minute long segment on the latest developments in the Republic of Artsakh (Nagorno-Karabakh) and the Republic of Armenia following Azerbaijan's military assault against the 120,000 indigenous Armenians, reported the Armenian National Committee of Australia. The segment included interviews with indigenous Armenians, including those who recount all they have lost, including loved ones and property, as generations of Armenians flee their homes. Joyner, who was on the ground in Goris, whilst the humanitarian crisis was unfolding, interviewed a group of young Armenian-Australian youth, including Salbi Dilanchian, Saro Tahinian, and Natalie Marcarian, who are volunteering in the region to "take care of Armenian people", said Dilanchian. In addition, Joyner interviewed human rights lawyer Anoush Baghdassarian, who was on the ground in Goris and said, "This is ethnic cleansing, so it's important to demonstrate the forced displacement of these people, to understand that this isn't a voluntary exodus." Tom Joyner and Orly Halpern have also written an online piece titled "Nagorno-Karabakh conflict in Russia‚Äôs backyard has exposed Vladimir Putin‚Äôs growing weakness", discussing the unique geopolitical interests that have perpetuated fierce Azerbaijani aggression against the local Armenian population. THE FULL ARTICLE CAN BE READ HERE https://www.abc.net.au/news/2023-10-04/inside-nagorno-karabakh-conflict-in-russia-s-backyard/102923922

Why sƒ´la-visuddhi, purity of virtue, is one of the factors for stream-entry. When your virtue is pure, it‚Äôs easy to get the mind into concentration. And what does that mean? There have been people who have reached stream-entry while standing putting food in a monk‚Äôs bowl. Some have reached stream-entry while fixing food in the kitchen. Some have reached stream-entry while gathering flowers in the garden. What does that come from? Purity of virtue. That‚Äôs when it‚Äôs not hard to get into concentration‚Äîwhen the mind is at ease. 1. When we get up and fix food, there‚Äôs no conflict among us. 2. We get the plates in which to serve the food that we‚Äôve gained in a pure way. 3. We see the monks coming for alms, and they‚Äôre pure in their virtue. Our hearts feel cheerful when we put food in their bowls. The cheerfulness of a heart when it feels at ease gives rise to purity of virtue and purity of mind. Purity of virtue is a sot‚Äôa·πÖga, one of the factors for stream-entry. It‚Äôs not all that difficult. You can reach the paths and their fruitions while putting food in a monk‚Äôs bowl‚Äîif your virtue is pure. But if your virtue isn‚Äôt pure, then no matter how much you sit with your eyes closed in concentration, all that settles down are your eyelids. Your mind is jumping out through the skin in front of your eyes and running all over the place. This is the power of defilement when the heart isn‚Äôt clean and bright. It keeps pushing the mind around so that it can‚Äôt find any peace. ~ Ajaan Lee Dhammadharo Starting Out Small: A Collection of Talks for Beginning Meditators trans. by Thanissaro Bhikkhu https://www.dhammatalks.org/ebook_index.html#StartingOutSmall

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's recent comments, which recognize that the concerns over parental rights are not hate or intolerance, are a positive clarification. Following our previous statements, MAC has shared the perspectives of Muslim parents and challenges faced by Muslim children with the Government and welcomes the ongoing dialogue surrounding this national issue. MAC will not compromise the Islamic faith and we have consistently stood by the community to ensure the rights of Canadian Muslims are protected. Our stance is clear: Children should not be coerced into activities that conflict with their religious beliefs, and parents have a right to protect their children's rights. Parents have the responsibility and right to guide the social and moral development of their children. Parents maintain a primary role in guiding their children's education, especially when it intersects with deeply held religious beliefs. It is imperative that children can choose to opt-out of activities that do not align with their faith, without repercussions. We call on elected officials across all levels of government to engage with Muslim parents in their constituencies to understand the daily realities and challenges faced by Muslim children.

Attention all quilt lovers! The Heritage Center is  celebrating the late Nancy Roan (1932-2023) with an exhibit of her handmade quilts titled "A Loving Tribute to a Quiltie Lady: The Quilts of Nancy Roan" on view now until April 14 in the Putera Meeting Room on the first floor. Nancy made many quilts, including bed-sized quilts and wall hangings, over her many decades as a quilter‚Äîsome based on traditional designs while others were more contemporary and whimsical. Her quilts were definitely a product of her extraordinary creativity and sense of humor. Nancy worked hard to preserve Pennsylvania Dutch culture through recording the ‚Äúold ways‚Äù of cooking and quilting and as a stalwart member of the Goschenhoppen Historians. Join us for this delightful journey through Nancy‚Äôs quilting life!üëâPLEASE NOTE: the reception scheduled for the exhibit on Sunday, October 8 is postponed due to a scheduling conflict. Image: WPA Coxcomb bed-sized quilt made by Nancy Roan, Heritage Center Collection.

text: There is perhaps no voice more qualified to discuss the migration crisis than Michael Yon. He has dedicated his life to investigating the "flashpoints" of global conflict and joins today's #SaraCarterShow on the ground in Panama, near the Darien Gap. In vivid detail, Yon shares the horrors of this passage and catalogs the massive loss of life happening each day as thousands of migrants make their way to our border. He also shares his role in breaking open the Colony Ridge story.

U.S. Civil War - U.S. Army JAMES GARDINER ALSO KNOWN AS: GARDNER, JAMES DANIEL RANK: PRIVATE CONFLICT/ERA: U.S. CIVIL WAR UNIT/COMMAND: COMPANY I, 36TH U.S. COLORED INFANTRY MILITARY SERVICE BRANCH: U.S. ARMY MEDAL OF HONOR ACTION DATE: SEPTEMBER 29, 1864 MEDAL OF HONOR ACTION PLACE: CHAPIN'S FARM, VIRGINIA, USA CITATION Rushed in advance of his brigade, shot a rebel officer who was on the parapet rallying his men, and then ran him through with his bayonet.

15 lessons from Tribal Leadership: Leveraging Natural Groups to Build a Thriving Organization by Dave Logan, John King, and Halee Fischer-Wright: 1. Organizations are made up of tribes. Tribes are natural groups of people who are connected to each other by a shared purpose and culture. 2. There are five levels of tribal culture. The levels are: o Life Sucks o My Life Sucks Less o Your Life Sucks o Your Life Sucks Less o Life is Good 3. Leaders can influence the level of tribal culture. By understanding the five levels of tribal culture and taking steps to move their tribe to a higher level, leaders can create a more thriving organization. 4. The first step to moving to a higher level of tribal culture is to understand the current level of culture. Leaders can do this by asking their team members questions about their purpose, values, and beliefs. 5. Once leaders understand the current level of culture, they can begin to take steps to move the tribe to a higher level. This may involve changing the tribe's purpose, values, beliefs, or behaviors. 6. It is important to be patient when moving to a higher level of tribal culture. It takes time and effort to change the culture of an organization. 7. Leaders need to be role models for the desired culture. If leaders want to create a culture of collaboration, they need to collaborate with others. If leaders want to create a culture of innovation, they need to be innovative. 8. Leaders need to celebrate successes. When the tribe achieves a goal, it is important to celebrate the success. This will help to reinforce the desired culture. 9. Leaders need to be willing to deal with conflict. Conflict is a natural part of any organization. Leaders need to be willing to address conflict in a constructive way. 10. Leaders need to be persistent. Moving to a higher level of tribal culture is an ongoing process. Leaders need to be persistent in their efforts to create a more thriving organization. 11. Tribal Leadership is not a one-size-fits-all approach. The best way to lead a tribe will vary depending on the level of culture and the specific situation. 12. Tribal Leadership is not about magic bullets or quick fixes. It takes time and effort to create a thriving organization. 13. Tribal Leadership is about building relationships and creating a culture of trust and respect. When people feel valued and respected, they are more likely to be engaged and productive. 14. Tribal Leadership is about creating a culture of continuous learning. Tribes that are constantly learning and growing are more likely to be successful. 15. Tribal Leadership is about creating a culture of empowerment. When people feel empowered to make decisions and take action, they are more likely to be engaged and productive. I hope these 15 lessons from Tribal Leadership help you to build a more thriving organization. How can we advance women‚Äôs meaningful participation in the security sector? What can security institutions do to ensure greater representation and leadership of women in peace and security-building efforts? On 5 October, ODIHR and the OSCE Conflict Prevention Centre organized a side event at the margins of the Warsaw Human Dimension Conference to discuss good practices and challenges in addressing all forms of discrimination and intolerance in the security sector, with a particular emphasis on gender equality. text: Choti Sarrdaarni Written Update, Saturday 7 Oct 2023 Kulwant says, "What does Harleen want?" She's concerned about what might happen if Harleen talks to Sarab. She feels the need to show Sarab that she's always there for his family. Harleen recalls a conversation with Sarab, where she expresses her frustration with his changing behavior. Dolly reassures Sarab of Harleen's love and pleads with him not to let their family break apart. Meher asks the cook what to prepare for dinner, but Harleen confronts her and demands that she choose between her brother and her unborn child. Harleen accuses Meher of breaking her trust and tries to give back jewelry and money, but Meher insists she won't take them back unless she regains Harleen's trust. Sarab is torn between his sister and wife, questioning the impact of his decision on their sibling relationship. Harleen decides to leave the house, and Sarab offers to leave instead, but Dolly intervenes, urging them to talk and find a solution. Harleen suggests dividing everything between them, causing shock and tension among the family members. Sarab agrees to divide their assets to keep his sister happy, even though Meher pleads with Harleen not to break their family. Kulwant discusses the possibility of dividing their assets among her children, while Sarab, Harleen, and Meher are still in conflict. Rovi informs Sarab that the auction papers are ready, and Harleen prepares for the division, while Meher resigns herself to the situation. Follow Ochooze Kenyan Rapper

Today 7/10/2023. Happy Feast To One and all Our Lady of the Holy Rosary PRAYER TO OUR LADY OF THE MOST HOLY ROSARY O Queen of the Most Holy Rosary, in these times of such impertinent impiety, manifest thy power with the signs of thine ancient victories. From thy throne, whence thou dispense pardon and grace, mercifully regard the Church of thy Son, His Vicar on Earth, and every clergy, religious, and laity, who are oppressed in this mighty conflict. Thou who art powerful, the vanquisher of all heresies, hasten the hour of mercy, even though the hour of God‚Äôs justice is every day provoked by the countless sins of humanity. Obtain for us, praying before thee in supplication, the grace we need to live righteously on earth, in order to be numbered among the just in heaven.. In the company of all faithful Christians throughout the world, we salute thee and acclaim thee as Queen of the Most Holy Rosary. Amen! Oh Queen of the Most Holy Rosary, pray for us and the whole world. Amen!

PHC disposes of petitions against MDCAT PESHAWAR: A division bench of the Peshawar High Court (PHC) on Tuesday disposed of different petitions against the Medical and Dental Colleges Admission Test (MDCAT) after the government announced to re-conduct the exam. The division bench comprising Justice Abdul Shakoor and Justice Arshad Ali had earlier reserved the judgment in the case. The advocate general told the court the government after a cabinet meeting had already announced to hold the test afresh and the Khyber Medical University had been contacted in this regard. He argued that a Joint Investigation Team (JIT) had taken up a number of issues in the MDCAT that needed to be addressed. The counsel of one of the petitioners told the court that some students had scored high marks. He added that there should be a system to ensure that such students do not suffer while re-conducting the test. The court later disposed of the case citing the decision of the government to hold another test in a transparent manner. The detailed judgment will be released later. Earlier, in what appeared to be a case of conflict of interest, a key member of the JIT probing the use of Bluetooth devices and other unfair means in recently held MDCAT in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa was found to be the father of a low-scoring candidate in the same test. On the basis of the JIT report, the caretaker provincial government also went ahead of its constitutional role and mandate to announce reconduct of the MDCAT test. According to sources, one candidate named Moeed Hassan, who was the son of an additional secretary in the provincial Home Department and a key member of the JIT, Maqsood Hassan, could obtain only 136 out of the total 200 marks in the test. These marks are insufficient for admission into any public or private medical and dental colleges. As per the law pertaining to the conflict of interest, this officer should not have been made a member of the important investigation team, a senior officer at the Civil Secretariat told The News. When reached for comments, Maqsood Hassan admitted that his son had appeared in the test. ‚ÄúBut, the result of the test has not yet been declared and my son has already chosen another direction for himself,‚Äù he said. The officer claimed that it was not a conflict of interest if he was made a member of the committee probing the use of unfair means in a test in which his own son had appeared. He said the JIT was about the whole process and if the government had asked him to be a part of the probe committee, it was not something unethical. The officer said the JIT had not recommended reconduct of the test but only identified loopholes and gaps in the process. A senior official in ETEA, however, said that they had already finalized the result, declared the top position holders and submitted the same to the PMDC, which would declare it along with other provinces. ‚ÄúETEA has also uploaded the solved key on the internet and every student was able to easily calculate his result from there‚Äù, he added. It is important to mention here that the JIT formed by the chief secretary had been tasked to unearth the elements involved in the unfair means, arrest them and recommend suggestions for averting use of unfair practices in future. It was none of its (JIT‚Äôs) mandate to suggest reconduct of the test, which it did in violation of its mandate. Also, the JIT was led by a police officer which is why the lapses committed by the police got no mention in the report as it was their duty to check and prevent entry of any objectionable devices into the centre. The caretaker government also asked KMU to conduct the test. Again, it was a violation of the law as under section 4 (a) of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Educational Testing and Evaluation Agency Ordinance, 2001 it was the duty of ETEA to conduct admission tests to the educational institutions of the province. ETEA was the only testing agency in the whole country which busted the Bluetooth racket and conducted the test in a much transparent manner for which it should be awarded instead of being subjected to media trial. Dr Yasir Imran, ETEA director, told The News that the staff of the agency caught 219 candidates red-handed who were using Bluetooth and other electronic devices and handed them over to the police. He said that 470 top scorers of the test were having brilliant academic records in the Secondary and Higher Secondary School Certificates. The topper of ETEA MDCAT, who scored 198 marks in the test, has also clinched the top position in the FSc from Kohat Board in FSc too. The topper of Mardan board in FSc also scored good marks in the MDCAT. It is unfair to blame and discourage the brilliant students for the use of unfair means and force them to reappear in the test. The director ETEA said that they had identified only 168 candidates who had not done the required level of rough work on their question papers. These candidates were being investigated further. ‚ÄúThough not (truncated)

5th October, 2023 THE CHIEF JUSTICE OF NIGERIA AND CHAIRMAN, NATIONAL JUDICIAL COUNCIL THREE ARMS ZONE FCT, ABUJA SIR, RE: PETITION AGAINST HON. JUSTICE B.M TUKUR, HON. JUSTICE OMEKA ELEKWA AND HON. JUSTICE O.A ADETUJOYE FOR DELIBERATE PERVERSION OF JUSTICE AND CONSPIRACY TO REMOVE CANDIDATES OF OUR PARTY ELECTED TO PARLIAMENT The above refers. Our attention has been drawn to a purported Petition with the above caption written by the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) dated 15th September, 2023 and signed by the Chairman and Secretary of the Plateau State Chapter of the PDP. As interested parties who also sponsored candidates in the 2023 General Election in Plateau State, we are obligated to put the records straight as it is very shocking and surprising to us. This is also very clear from the content of the Petition written by the PDP against the Learned Judges of the Election Petition Tribunal in Plateau State as can be seen, no exact action of the jurists capable of perverting Justice was pointed out by the PDP aside the fact that the Judges delivered Judgments. No procedural error was pointed out to show bias, lack of fair hearing or descending into the arena of conflict. PUTTING THE RECORDS STRAIGHT The Judgments delivered by HON. JUSTICE B.M TUKUR, HON. JUSTICE OMEKA ELEKWA AND HON. JUSTICE O.A ADETUJOYE is in line with cautions and warnings that were in the public domain before the 2023 general elections, about the inescapable disaster or peril that would eventually befall the PDP in Plateau State for disrespect, continuous violation and disobedience to the Judgments and Orders of Court. Well, like it is said, "time reveals". But it is worrisome that the PDP are making storms at the outcome of the decisions under review. For the avoidance of doubt, it is important to note that the General Elections where members of the public go out to vote, is actually the concluding part of the electoral process. Election is a process and defect in any of the processes, renders the outcome of the secondary election, a nullity no matter how well conducted it might otherwise be regarded. The process inter alia, includes Registration of Political Parties, Congresses to elect EXCO for the Party at all levels, Conduct of Primary Elections and Qualification of both the Political Party to sponsor candidates and that of the Candidates to contest an Election. All these processes are regulated by Law and must be adhered to, stricto senso. Thankfully, the Court is the last part of the Electoral Process and that is where we are presently. The Tribunal at all levels in Plateau State have been inundated with one potent Ground of Petition by both the Labour Party (LP), Peoples Redemption Party (PRP) and the All Progressives Congress (APC) aside the general irregularities in the Conduct of Elections. This Ground challenges the Qualification of PDP to field in candidates to contest for elections in Plateau State while living in flagrant disobedience to Court Orders. In proving Ground One, the Petitioners relied and tendered avalanche of cases decided against the PDP as follows: 1. Certified True Copies of the Judgment in Suit No. PLD/J/304/2020- Between: Bitrus Kaze and Others Vs. PDP and Others. This is the genesis of the misfortunes of PDP. Here, the Court ordered PDP to conduct Ward, LGA and State Congresses to elect their leaders. In other words, the Court ordered PDP to form their "structure". Mind you, forming Political Structure is part of the Electoral Process a Political Party must fulfil. 2. Certified True Copies of Judgment Between: PDP v Plateau State Independent Electoral Commission (PLASIEC) in Suit No. PLD/J/250/2021. Since PDP failed to obey the Order in the first case, the PLASIEC excluded PDP from participating in the Local Government Elections for not complying with the Orders of Court. The PDP filed the above case against PLASIEC and lost. PDP appealed this case to the Court of Appeal and lost on the ground that they are in disobedience to Court Order and when the PDP further appealed to the Supreme Court, they abandoned the Appeal and the Supreme Court dismissed the Appeal on the 7th December, 2022 for want of diligent prosecution. 3. Certified True Copies of the Judgement of the High Court of Plateau State in Suit No. PLD/J276CV/2020 dated 24/6/2021 Between: Ishaku Adamu Izang Vs. Markus Husseini Nyam (AKA Kaunde). In this case, the High Court granted the reliefs claimed by the Claimants and set aside the Local Government Congresses conducted by PDP and PDP is yet to conduct congresses for the purpose of constituting its Wards, Local Government and State organs of the Party. 4. Certified True Copies of the Ruling of the High Court of Plateau State in Suit No. PLD/J276CV/2020 dated 24/2/2022 Between: Ishaku Adamu Izang Vs. Markus Husseini Nyam (AKA Kaunde Without conducting special congresses to constitute the various organs of the Party in Plateau State, PDP filed a Motion seeking to set aside the (truncated)

The Task Force Dagger Special Operations Foundation proudly announces the appointment of Sergeant Major (Retired) Matt Parrish as its new Executive Director. A testament to the values we uphold, Matt's decades of dedication to special operations and unwavering service to the nation perfectly align with our mission. President of the Executive Board, Mark Stephens said: "We don‚Äôt always have the opportunity to work with people who share the same passion and investment in a real purpose. I am personally and professionally honored Matt has chosen to join our amazing team who are truly dedicated to serving the needs of our Special Operations members and their Families. We are looking forward to working with Matt as we continue to push the boundaries and increase the levels of support we provide, along with continuing to provide education on the ongoing challenges our SOF members and their Families continue to face from decades of conflict." Sgt. Major Parrish isn't new to leadership, nor to challenges. Throughout his illustrious 20-year career in Special Operations, Matt served 13 years on Army Special Forces operational teams, completing multiple combat tours in Iraq and Afghanistan and operational stints across Central and South America. Beyond combat, Matt's accolades include numerous leadership awards, service medals, and certifications in some of the world's most demanding disciplines. Elevating to the apex of the U.S. Army's enlisted ranks, Matt's commitment culminated as the Senior Enlisted Leader for the USSOCOM Preservation of the Force and Family program. In this capacity, he oversaw the human performance and wellness of over 70,000 special ops individuals worldwide. But Matt's contributions don't end there. Many have seen him perform at college and professional sporting events with the SOCOM Para-Commando parachute demonstration team. He's the voice behind SOCOM's first official podcast, SOFcast, and recently unveiled his new podcast, "Prep For Impact." Off the microphone, he's leveraged his military humor on Instagram's Another_SF_meme_page to champion veteran and military causes, marking him as a luminary in the veteran community. A frequent guest on various platforms, Matt's commitment to service extends beyond his professional endeavors. A loving husband and father of three, his passion for golf is only paralleled by his faith in Philippians 4:13. Join us in welcoming Matt to the Task Force Dagger family. His wealth of experience and a heart dedicated to service heralds a bright future for our foundation and the heroes we serve. #NextChapter #BigRevealSoon #Staytuned #BigNews #TFDSOF #TFD #SOF #HEAL #MISSION #PURPOSE #FOCUS #MILITARY #ACTIVEDUTY #VETERAN #SERVE #FAMILY #warfighter

text: CHAOS BOMBING by a Narcissist! Chaos is the 'go to' tool that toxic individuals use to create diversion, and confusion with their victims. it is a major form of 'supply' for them because it is power and control over individuals that they desperately need to make their desperate agenda work. From my Book: Greg Zaffuto - Author - From Charm to Harm and Everything Else in Between with a Narcissist https://www.amazon.com/Charm-Harm-Everything-Between-Narcissist-ebook/dp/B01CSR72IA/ref=sr_1_1?crid=1O2XF81O2IDV&keywords=from+charm+to+harm&qid=1691683117&s=digital-text&sprefix=from+charm+to+%2Cdigital-text%2C115&sr=1-1:=:https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01CSR72IA/ref=tsm_1_fb_lk Think of the many situations where you are taken from a normal day to being completely thrown off balance by one of their 'out of the blue' chaotic attacks. There is no rhyme or reason to their logic - just a 'hit and run' situation that leaves you shaking your head, shocked, silenced, withdrawing, isolated, stuck in your own head trying to reason through this, and once again diminished and managed down for no reason whatsoever. Each time you lose a little bit more of yourself and become more and more VULNERABLE because you know that any attempt to work through one of their chaotic outbursts is just futile, so you only withdraw from the situation completely. The thing we must understand is that the Narcissist is looking for this exact reaction and why they act out as they do. That VULNERABILITY of a target/victim is just an OPPORTUNITY for the Narcissist to suppress their target to inflict more of their poison, but ONLY if there are no witnesses -- so consider it as premeditated because it is. Narcissists are not inconsiderate of your feelings, to the contrary, they are extremely considerate of your feelings and they are monitoring them to see just WHERE your weaknesses are so they can inflict chaos/harm. Your feelings are exactly what they are trying to affect. They closely observe how you react every time they do something to hurt you and then they build it into their arsenal of tools to use against you in the future. Cause and effect is cognitive thinking so they know exactly what they are doing - getting the best of you to push you as close to the edge as they can! We tried to function as a normal person the best we could ‚Äì but it was a situation that was personalized and created just for us with ‚Äúdoom and destruction‚Äù in mind. YES, we tried to fix it because our lives are loaded and impacted by empathy and love ‚Äì but is that a punishable offense. Any way you look at it the target/victim somehow gets the label and the blame because the Narcissist is VERY motivated to hide their acts of chaos, crazy making, and psychological terrorism. The only way to end this type of chaos is to disallow it by disengaging completely. Greg

During the American Civil War, Virginia resident William Terrill Bradby was one of an estimated 20,000 Native Americans who served with Union military forces in the fight against the Confederacy. A large part of Bradby‚Äôs own contributions to the Union cause involved maritime transportation. A member of the Pamunkey Tribe, Bradby was born in Virginia in 1833. After the Civil War broke out in 1861, Bradby remained loyal to the Union even though Virginia joined the Confederacy. Bradby‚Äôs unwavering decision to side with the North resulted in his church expelling him from its congregation. Even more significantly, his military service on behalf of the Union often placed him at high risk and in harm‚Äôs way. Bradby‚Äôs initial activities with the Union forces included serving as a land guide and scout for the Army of the Potomac during the Peninsula Campaign in southeastern Virginia in 1862. The following year, however, Bradby exchanged those land-based assignments for ‚Äúwater duty‚Äù when he joined the Union Navy. Throughout the remainder of the war, Bradby served on a variety of military ships and boats and even piloted several of those vessels. For a good part of 1863-64, for example, he was a pilot second class for vessels that were part of a Union flotilla on the James River in Virginia. While serving on the steamship USS Shokokon on that river, Bradby was shot in the leg by a Confederate shell. This injury turned out to be only a flesh wound, but it brought about rheumatism that would plague Bradby for the remainder of his days. Other vessels on which Bradby served were the gunboats USS Onondaga and USS Huron; the tugboat USS Epsilon; the steamship USS Daylight; and the torpedo boat USS Spuyten Duyvil. There were several other Native Americans from Virginia who likewise served the Union as guides and pilots during the war. They included Bradby‚Äôs brother Sterling as well as Thornton Allmond, John Langston, William Sampson, and Powhatan Weisiger. William Terrill Bradby‚Äôs own military record, however, is one of the most detailed and best documented of that group. After the Civil War ended, Bradby returned to where he had lived prior to the conflict: the Pamunkey reservation on the western shore of the Chesapeake Bay in Virginia. Bradby remained there for the rest of his life, becoming one the most respected members of the community. He died sometime around 1905

#ManipurViolence | Need PM Modi for five minutes to set the system right, says CoTU Protests erupted in Kangpokpi, Manipur, as hundreds of people gathered along National Highway-2 to denounce the recent attack at New Keithelmanbi and the alleged torching of houses by armed Meitei militants. The protest, organized by the Committee on Tribal Unity Sadar Hills Kangpokpi District (CoTU), took place at Bongmol village, and the participants made an impassioned appeal to Prime Minister Narendra Modi to visit the region for just five minutes, purely on humanitarian grounds, setting aside political considerations. The CoTU's General Secretary, Lamminlun Singsit, revealed that the Meitei armed groups orchestrated the attack to create a false narrative. He stated that on the evening of October 4, around 10:30 p.m., armed Meitei groups, disguised in security uniforms, set fire to their own Meitei farmhouses at Moidangpok. This was done to make it appear as though the attack was carried out by the Kukis. Later, they indiscriminately attacked New Keithelmanbi areas in the buffer zone, but the central forces resisted their advances. Singsit clarified that the conflict that followed was between the Meitei armed groups and the central security forces, not between the Kuki Village Volunteers and the Meitei armed groups as claimed by the Meitei community. Additionally, CoTU Women Wing's Convenor, Neinu, expressed her dismay at the continuous terror perpetrated by Meitei terrorists against the Kuki-Zo community. She stated that such acts, including the recent attacks on houses at New Keithelmanbi and L. Jangnomphai village, were unacceptable and reflected the superiority complex of the majority Meitei community. CoTU's Media Cell Coordinator, Ng. Lun Kipgen, condemned the false narrative presented by the Meitei community. He emphasized that the Kuki-Zo community had remained law-abiding citizens and trusted in the legal system, even in the face of severe provocations. The protesters demanded justice, a separate administration, an end to false allegations and narratives, and swift action by the central government to restore peace in Manipur. They chanted slogans such as "We want Justice," "We want Separate Administration," "Stop false allegations," and "Stop false narratives." The protesters stated the urgent need for the Prime Minister to visit Manipur and address the escalating tensions and violence in the state.

I see so many people arguing when people become adults. 25 was the standard. Now people are saying it‚Äôs actually 30. All of this is based on brain development. The truth is many adults are children in adult bodies. It‚Äôs an epidemic in our culture. We don‚Äôt fully go through developmental phases. We don‚Äôt get healthy modeling. We don‚Äôt learn what it is to be an adult, emotionally. In my 30‚Äôs I sat on my couch and realized: I‚Äôm a 10 year old emotionally. I can‚Äôt directly solve (or even address) conflict. I can‚Äôt speak honestly about what I feel. I don‚Äôt even know what my needs are. Im still developing that maturity. Being an adult is really a process. It takes intentional work. It takes being uncomfortable. And of course humility to say: I need to grow here. What do you think? The Holistic Psychologist

text: Conflict has forced these people to seek shelter in a disaster zone. As fighting rages in neighboring Sudan, hundreds of thousands have fled to parts of South Sudan already struggling to contain alarming rates of extreme hunger with limited resources. Most making this desperate journey are originally from South Sudan but were living as refugees across the border when war broke out. Returning to the country they fled years ago is not a straightforward affair. Some families arrive at crowded transit centers with children who are fighting for their lives due to severe malnutrition. They then have to make multi-day treks by boat and overland transport just to reach temporary shelters. To help people reeling from the impact of these overlapping crises, we‚Äôre helping the UN World Food Programme deliver emergency food assistance and administer treatment for malnutrition at transit centers and locations where returnees finally arrive. With support from USAID - US Agency for International Development and other donors, the UN agency has already reached 265,000 vulnerable people with life-saving aid, with more help on the way. üì∏: WFP U.S. Embassy Juba, South Sudan USAID South Sudan U.S. Embassy Khartoum @WFP South Sudan
For every step we took, The shoes of the final have always fitted us.

Here's a picture of my Grandad Alec Brown, he must have sent this photograph home from the front. Like many men my grandad had to join the army twice to take part in the Great War. He joined up the first time and lied about his age but was eventually found out and then had to join again when he was old enough. Thankfully, he was one of the ones who survived the conflict. As a young kid, ( my grandad died when I was seven or eight ) I can just about recall him telling me a little bit about his experiences. He told me how in the trenches, he'd get the lice out of the seams of his uniform and then crackle them in a tobacco tin over a candle. On a more sombre note, he also described witnessing British soldiers coming under heavy machine gun fire and how they sheltered behind a small wooden chicken shed, even though the bullets were passing through it as though it wasn't there. The soldiers froze there without a vestige of protection in vain hope. They didn't survive. When the second world war came around grandad was too old but instead, as a council worker went from Stretford in Manchester to London to help dig for survivors from the Blitz.

So some one had a post up asking if space marine's ever ran out of ammunition. I was typing up a reply when they deleted it. Not upset at them or anything but I put a little effort into the reply and don't want to waste it so I'm taking over the discussion! Here's my reply, finished. In lore, yes a space marine can run out of ammo. Even their backpack power generators can run out and shut down leaving the marine in a very bad situation. MOST marines cannot move in their power armor with out it being powered. The thing a lot of people don't understand about marines is their shock troops. Their suppose to suddenly and unexpectedly hit an enemy REALLY REALLY HARD and break their lines for Imperial Guard to come in and take over a majority of the fighting. When marines are on "extended" deployments, they are never far from base or a convoy of resupply vehicles such as Rhino's carrying spare ammunition. With Thunder hawks and Drop pods, resupplying marines even in the most grueling battlefields like on Armaggedon is easier then you might expect as well. For those of you familiar with Halo, something like an Ordinance pod wouldn't be too far out of the question. We even see a mechanic similar to this in Space marine the game with the "shipping containers" full of weapons and ammunition, and the "vaults" where you can pick up a new weapon for the first time. Either one can very easily be dropped by a Thunder hawk where ever its needed. Since we only really have to go off is the games... Space Marine depicts a marine carrying 330 rounds of ammunition when full. This is 30 rounds in the gun itself, and 10 spare magazines. US Riflemen serving in the Army carry 7 magazines as spares + 1 in their weapon for a total of 240 rounds of ammunition. So not drastically unrealistic to have a few extra magazines. Many armies also have a member of the squad dedicated to carrying more ammunition for the unit. Typically this is for Light and Heavy machine gunners who carry a few belts of ammo for their weapon, and a "Assistant gunner" will carry extra ammunition for the gun along side their own gear. With Auxiliary Roles such as Chaplains, Apothecaries, Librarians, ect.... Its not hard to imagine such a thing might exist for space marines as well. Take the Heavy Bolters backpack attachment, modify it a bit to carry say, 50 spare mags of ammo. Done deal. Attaches to any backpack, extends field deployments for the marines in area's of expected heavy conflict. Some old lore even suggested that Bolters would have a belt ammunition feed and backpack supply, though I think this has been retconned now. The point to note how ever is US soldiers are trained primarily for accuracy over volume of fire from everything I have been told. Space marines.... are always depicted as firing on Fully Automatic. Looking to the Space Marine Movie... as terrible as it was.... a marine would run out ammunition VERY VERY quickly by comparison. Going back to the Video Game, Space Marine taking place on a forge world, with an Imperial Guard regiment, there is tons of ammunition laying around because the Guard do use Bolters, Typically heavy, for gun emplacements. So its not hard to argue that a space marine can "scavenge" for ammunition If friendly forces are in the area and orbital resupply is unavailable. How ever I feel the more realistic depiction of how Space marines would fight comes from the fan videos, "The Raptor" and "Astartes" where their shown as firing short, controlled bursts if not single shots to devastating effect. Much like US soldiers, this would make their ammunition supplies last MUCH longer then "spray and pray" full auto fire as shown by official sources. Add onto the this that every marine in lore carries at least a combat knife if not a Chain sword. They may choose to use a melee weapon over expending ammunition, especially when they are against a foe with melee only, or they have a change to surprise their foe by dropping on them from above or from around a corner. Tactical marines might not charge into gun fire, but if they got around a fortification and into a bunker where the soldiers operating a heavy machine gun only have pistols if anything for a weapon outside of that machine gun, it would be a prime opportunity for the marine to use his melee over his ammunition. What makes this worse though than RL... Soldiers in RL can pick up weapons and use their enemies equipment in dire situations. If a space marine did this, he would likely be killed by his fellow marines, either during the act or afterwards, as we have seen even numerous times. ESPECIALLY when fighting Chaos and even the ammunition can cause corruption or lead to possessions. The only time you might see this behavior is if Space marines are fighting each other or the Guard, which has also happened in lore. Going onto energy weapons, as Id be remissed not too. They are said to draw from the suits power supply, at least from what I remember. If this is (truncated)

Long before Europeans came up the Kennebec River to the "head of the tide" Algonquian-speaking Indians, considered Wabanaki or "People of the Dawn" were already here. As early as 1607 the area was explored by English settlers from the short-lived Sagadahoc or Popham Colony at the river‚Äôs mouth. Representatives of Plymouth Colony were the first English to actually live here. In 1625, on a river expedition to find a place to trade agricultural products for Indian furs, Plymouth pilgrims chose the east shore for their "House at Kennebeck". The post, probably built in 1628, was operated by the original traders and, later, by Plymouth Company with varying degrees of success, until it was abandoned some time between 1669 and 1676. There were French as well as English influences here in the 17th and 18th centuries. In 1646, a Jesuit priest, Gabriel Dreuillettes, visited "an English settlement named Kinibeki" and established a mission nearby for the Kennebec natives. It was then that the term "Cushnoc" ("Coussinoc" or "Kouissnoc") first appeared in reference to the Plymouth trading post. (Cushnoc means "Head of Tide") After years of conflict involving the French, Indians, and English and several decades during which Kennebec settlements were deserted, the Kennebec Proprietors, successors to the Plymouth Company, erected Fort Western near the Cushnoc site. Located below the falls at the head of navigation, the fort was intended as a supply depot for Fort Halifax, 17 miles upriver. The proprietors also initiated efforts to settle the region. When military staffing was no longer needed, Captain James Howard, who had commanded the fort, stayed on as the first permanent settler. The fort‚Äôs main building served as a residence and a store. The village called "the Fort" was the upriver part of the town incorporated as Hallowell in 1771. In February, 1796, the Fort residents petitioned the Massachusetts Legislature for permission to build the first Kennebec bridge. Although "the Hook," as the lower Hallowell village was called, wanted the bridge on its shore, the Fort request was granted. The following February, in 1797, the legislature approved separation of the Fort from Hallowell. Incorporated first as Harrington, the new town changed its name to Augusta on June 9, 1797. In 1799, Augusta became the shire town of the newly formed Kennebec County. In 1827, the town was designated the capital of Maine, which had entered the union in 1820 as the 23rd state. The Maine Legislature met here for the first time in January, 1832. Augusta was chartered as a city in 1849. I've always been sad and upset what we and the whole country did to the Natives!

It is said that a Jacobella, a loving wheaten, ventured far from the plains to bring her  journey to see Blowing Rock and the care of a squaw mother. One day the wheaten Jacobella , daydreaming on the craggy cliff, spied a Cherokee brave wandering in the wilderness far below and playfully shot an arrow in her direction. The flirtation worked because soon he appeared before her wigwam, courted her with songs of his land and they became lovers, wandering the pathless woodlands and along the crystal streams. One day a strange reddening of the sky brought the brave and the maiden Jacobella to The Blowing Rock. To him it was a sign of trouble commanding his return to his tribe in the plains. With the maiden‚Äôs entreaties not to leave her, the brave, torn by conflict of duty and heart, leaped from The Rock into the wilderness far below. The grief-stricken maiden Jacobella prayed daily to the Great Spirit until one evening with a reddening sky, a gust of wind blew his lover back onto The Rock and into his arms. From that day a perpetual wind has blown up onto The Rock from the valley below. For people of other days, at least, this was explanation enough for The Blowing Rock‚Äôs mysterious winds causing even the snow to fall upside down.

SAINT BRUNO OF COLOGNE October 6, 2023 Saint Bruno is believed to have been born into the wealthy and influential Hardeb√ºst family in the city of Cologne, in modern-day Germany. His family‚Äôs status would have ensured him a good education and a successful career. As a teenager, he was sent to the prestigious Cathedral School of Rheims, in the Kingdom of France, about 200 miles from his hometown. After completing his studies, he returned to Cologne where he was made a canon at Saint Cunibert Church. It is most likely at that time that he was ordained a priest. In 1056, when Canon Bruno was about twenty-six years old, he was called back to Rheims by the bishop, given a canonry at the Cathedral, taught at the School of Rheims, and was later made rector of the school. These distinctions speak to his character, holiness, and intelligence. Canon Bruno spent the next twenty-plus years in this capacity, after which time he was made chancellor of the Archdiocese of Rheims. While he was chancellor, a corrupt and worldly man named Manass√®s of Gournay was made Archbishop of Rheims. The honest canons firmly opposed the archbishop‚Äôs ways, and Canon Bruno led the way. The archbishop was deposed by a local council, but he appealed to the pope and became violent toward his opposition. Around this time, Bruno left Rheims, probably for Rome, until the matter was resolved. Finally in 1080, the pope deposed the archbishop, and there was a cry from the clergy and laity to appoint Bruno as the next archbishop. Bruno, however, had other plans. He resigned from his prestigious positions in Rheims and set out to answer God‚Äôs call to a new life. Bruno is believed to have first traveled about 100 miles south to Molesme where he met with a monk and future founder of the Cistercian order, Saint Robert. After a short stay, he decided to travel farther south with six companions to found a new order under the authority of Bishop Hugh of Ch√¢teauneuf, Bishop of Grenoble. Bishop Hugh welcomed Bruno and his companions and told them about a dream he had in which he saw God build a house in the desert for His glory with seven stars showing the way. The bishop believed the seven men were the stars in his dream, so he enthusiastically supported their new mission. With the bishop‚Äôs support, Bruno and his companions traveled into the mountain country called Chartreuse, where they built hermitages and embraced a radical life of prayer, study, and manual labor. Peter the Venerable, an abbot of Cluny, later described their early life this way: ‚ÄúThere, they continue to dwell in silence, reading, praying, and also undertaking manual work, especially in the copying of books. Within their cells, at the signal given by the church bell, they perform part of the canonical prayer. For Vespers and Matins, they all gather in church. On certain days of celebration they depart from this pace of life‚Ä¶They then have two meals, they sing in church all the regular hours and all, without exception, take their meal in the refectory.‚Äù Bruno enjoyed about six years of solitude in Chartreuse when, in 1090, he was called to Rome by the pope. Pope Urban II, who was elected pope in 1088, found himself in serious conflict with the Holy Roman Emperor and Antipope Clement III. Pope Urban was Bruno‚Äôs former student and called on him to become a counselor to assist with the chaos. Bruno obediently went to the aid of Pope Urban, serving him quietly and personally within the Lateran Palace in Rome. Shortly after his arrival, however, the Holy Roman Emperor took Rome by force, and Bruno and Pope Urban had to flee. Around the year 1091, Pope Urban wanted to make Bruno the Archbishop of Reggio, but Bruno once again opposed the idea and the pope chose another. After pleading to return to his hermitage in Chartreuse, the pope agreed to allow him to found a new hermitage in Italy so he was closer and could be called upon if needed. He and some companions settled in the wilderness of Calabria where they built a hermitage named Sainte-Marie-de-la-Tour. Of this new life, Bruno wrote in a letter, ‚ÄúI am living in the wilderness of Calabria far removed from habitation. There are some brethren with me, some of whom are very well educated and they are keeping an assiduous watch for their Lord, so as to open to him at once when he knocks.‚Äù Bruno died in this hermitage a decade later. Though Bruno never formally wrote a rule for his newly-founded order, he did leave them a way of life. Twenty-six years after his death, statutes were written down that guided their monastic-heremitical vocation. Bruno was quickly considered a saint, but in keeping with their hidden vocation, the order never formally petitioned the pope to canonize him. Over the next five hundred years, the Carthusians grew to 198 monasteries with about 5,600 members. In 1514, during a general chapter of the order, a request was made to Pope Leo X to confirm Bruno‚Äôs merits and authorize a liturgical feast for the order. (truncated)

The forests of the Goualougo Triangle in Nouabal√©-Ndoki National Park are among the most remote in the world. Here, in the Congo Sangha Trinational region‚ÄîA UNESCO World Heritage site that encompasses part of the Republic of Congo, the Central African Republic, and Cameroon‚Äîpristine green landscapes feature old-growth trees, plus important waterways and swamps that are associated with the Ndoki and Goualougo Rivers. Many of the animals hadn‚Äôt had much exposure to humans when GTAP began. This allowed researchers to do some important research about ‚Äúfirst contact‚Äù with chimpanzees. It also lets us learn more about how apes operate when there‚Äôs no human-animal conflict to be concerned about, like how they use tools, how they use space, and their group dynamics. This type of research allows us to determine what an untouched environment provides for wildlife, and it also helps us make a case for protecting places like Goualougo so more species may thrive. Additionally, it helps us figure out how to be as un-invasive as possible when encroaching on space that animals have been using, free of humans, for a very long time. Having a long-term research camp in this area also means being able to make change in a positive way for both local human and animal communities that will last over generations. But the importance of this place is so much more than just ‚Äúthe facts.‚Äù David Morgan, Ph.D., the current GTAP director and Lincoln Park zoo research fellow, says that when Dr. Jane Goodall visited back in 2002, she understood. He remembers her saying that it was the forest she dreamed about as a kid‚Äìthat seeing the big trees, large buttresses and the African forest with chimps and gorillas was eye-opening for her. Head over to the blog to learn more: https://www.lpzoo.org/a-dream-of-goualougo-the-importance-of-place/

üá≤üá´ üá≥üá± Orange (principality) country The Principality of Orange (French: principaut√© d'Orange, Dutch often also principality), is a small former principality of the Holy Roman Empire, currently located in Provence, a region in southeastern France. In Dutch it was historically referred to as Oranghien and later further Dutchified as Oranje. It was initially a county and after 1163 a principality that remained independent until 1713. To the west it was joined by the Rhone River separated from France; on all other sides it was enclosed by the Comtat Venaissin. It was officially declared a French territory at the Treaty of Utrecht in 1713. From 1731 it belonged to the French province of Dauphin√©, until it was abolished in 1789. Comt√© d'Orange Principaut√© d'Orange 8th century ‚Äì 1713 Kingdom of France (1589‚Äì1792) ‚Üí The principality is named after the place Orange, a town in the Vaucluse, on the left bank of the Rh√¥ne, twenty kilometers north of Avignon. The territory of the principality measured approximately 19.31 by 14.48 km, or 279.71 km¬≤. It was therefore almost the same size as the island of Bonaire, or about one and a half times the size of the island of Texel. The current municipality of Orange covers approximately a quarter of this area. History Orange has a history dating back to Roman times . History of Orange House Orange According to tradition, the first Count of Orange is William with the Horn, a courtier of Charlemagne, who is said to have conquered the city of Orange from the Saracens in 793. As the only part of the ancient Kingdom of Burgundy, the county had belonged to the Holy Roman Empire since 1032. The house of counts split into two lines in 1150, one of which was elevated to the royal position by Emperor Frederick Barbarossa in 1163. House Les Baux After the death of Raimbaud III of Orange, the area of this last branch belonged to her husband Bertrand I of Les Baux via his sister Tirburge III of Orange. The area of the count's branch was initially ceded to the Order of Saint John, but Bertrand III of Les Baux reunited the whole of Orange in 1308. House Chalon After the death of Raymond V of Les Baux, Prince of Orange, his daughter Maria inherited the principality. Through her husband John III of Chalon it passed to the house of Chalon and, with the death of the last member of this family, Philibert, to his nephew Ren√© of Chalon, the son of his sister Claudia and Hendrik III of Nassau-Breda. Under Ren√© of Chalon, Orange was occupied several times by France as a bone of contention between Emperor Charles V of the Holy Roman Empire and King Francis I of France. Because he also remained childless, he appointed his cousin William of Nassau with the approval of Emperor Charles V as successor. This decision contradicted the contents of the will of Mary of Baux, who had brought the principality of Orange into the House of Chalon. In the absence of male heirs, the principality would have to go to the heirs of her daughter Alix of Chalon. Alix's daughter Margarita married Rudolf of Baden-Hochberg (1427-1487) in 1449. Their only surviving granddaughter Johanna of Neuch√¢tel (d. 1543) of son Philip (1452-1503) married Louis I of Longueville (1480-1516) in 1504. Their descendants were pretenders to Orange until this family became extinct in the male line in 1694. This family protested against the hereditary law after 1544 and immediately took it to court. Given the important position of William the Silent as leader of the revolt against Spain, the French kings decided that the court's decisions would not be followed through and left the principality to the Nassaus (1580-1713). Orange William the Silent, later stadtholder in various Dutch regions, became Prince of Oranghien in 1544 and founded the Orange-Nassau dynasty - but was only able to exercise real power over the principality since 1559. Orange was also occupied several times under his rule. After his death, it fell to his sons, Philip Willem, Maurits and Frederik Hendrik. The latter's heir was William II, who was succeeded by William III in 1650. After the outbreak of the Dutch War (1672), Louis XIV occupied the principality. Willem got it at the Peace of Nijmegen (1678) returned, but it was taken again in 1685 when the Edict of Nantes was revoked. The Peace of Rijswijk (1697) definitively restored him to princely dignity. After the death of William III in 1702, a succession conflict broke out between Johan Willem Friso of Nassau-Dietz and Frederick I of Prussia. The former - as grandson of Frederik Hendrik's daughter Albertine Agnes - was designated as successor by will. However, Frederik I, as the son of Frederik Hendrik's eldest daughter Louise Henri√´tte, also laid claim to the principality under Frederik Hendrik's will. Meanwhile, Louis XIV declared the principality of Orange abdicated to the French throne. The Parliament of Paris assigned the principality to Louis's pretender, Francis Louis of Bourbon-Conti. 15 lessons from Tribal Leadership: Leveraging Natural Groups to Build a Thriving Organization by Dave Logan, John King, and Halee Fischer-Wright: 1. Organizations are made up of tribes. Tribes are natural groups of people who are connected to each other by a shared purpose and culture. 2. There are five levels of tribal culture. The levels are: o Life Sucks o My Life Sucks Less o Your Life Sucks o Your Life Sucks Less o Life is Good 3. Leaders can influence the level of tribal culture. By understanding the five levels of tribal culture and taking steps to move their tribe to a higher level, leaders can create a more thriving organization. 4. The first step to moving to a higher level of tribal culture is to understand the current level of culture. Leaders can do this by asking their team members questions about their purpose, values, and beliefs. 5. Once leaders understand the current level of culture, they can begin to take steps to move the tribe to a higher level. This may involve changing the tribe's purpose, values, beliefs, or behaviors. 6. It is important to be patient when moving to a higher level of tribal culture. It takes time and effort to change the culture of an organization. 7. Leaders need to be role models for the desired culture. If leaders want to create a culture of collaboration, they need to collaborate with others. If leaders want to create a culture of innovation, they need to be innovative. 8. Leaders need to celebrate successes. When the tribe achieves a goal, it is important to celebrate the success. This will help to reinforce the desired culture. 9. Leaders need to be willing to deal with conflict. Conflict is a natural part of any organization. Leaders need to be willing to address conflict in a constructive way. 10. Leaders need to be persistent. Moving to a higher level of tribal culture is an ongoing process. Leaders need to be persistent in their efforts to create a more thriving organization. 11. Tribal Leadership is not a one-size-fits-all approach. The best way to lead a tribe will vary depending on the level of culture and the specific situation. 12. Tribal Leadership is not about magic bullets or quick fixes. It takes time and effort to create a thriving organization. 13. Tribal Leadership is about building relationships and creating a culture of trust and respect. When people feel valued and respected, they are more likely to be engaged and productive. 14. Tribal Leadership is about creating a culture of continuous learning. Tribes that are constantly learning and growing are more likely to be successful. 15. Tribal Leadership is about creating a culture of empowerment. When people feel empowered to make decisions and take action, they are more likely to be engaged and productive. I hope these 15 lessons from Tribal Leadership help you to build a more thriving organization. Why is the FEAST of the OUR LADY OF THE ROSARY, on every October 7th? 
..... The story of the  VICTORY OF OUR LADY OF THE ROSARY at the Battle of Lepanto, on OCTOBER  7, 1571.

IN TIMES OF ACUTE DANGER AND HARDSHIP, WE MUST ALWAYS FLY INTO THE ARMS OF THE MOST POWERFUL MOTHER OF GOD AND TURN TO THE RECITATION OF HER HOLY ROSARY. The Battle of Lepanto is a great lesson of confidence for us today. 

When Saint Pius V became Pope, Christendom faced the perils perhaps unequaled in its history of continual conflict with the violent followers of Mohammed. All the information and intelligence that Pope Pius V had been gathering indicated that the Ottoman juggernaut was about to roll across the Mediterranean and adjacent lands, spearheaded by the Turkish fleet, with Italy and Rome as one of its target. (The Ottoman Empire is also historically known in Western Europe as the Turkish Empire)

Only Spain and Venice had the resources to resist, and they hated each other along with deep mistrust. Yet Saint Pius ‚Äî calling down divine grace as only a man of prayer could ‚Äî forged an alliance with them as the core of an organized fleet of over 200 galleys. With his considerable tact and diplomatic skills, he not only kept them unified, but he convinced them to attack the enveloping menace.

The Archbishop of Mexico had an exact copy of the HOLY IMAGE OF THE LADY OF GUADALUPE sent to King Philip II, who in turn gave it to Andrea Doria, one of the three principal admirals of the fleet, who placed it in his cabin. When the Armada went from file to line abreast and attacked on the morning of OCTOBER 7, 1571 the blue standard of OUR LADY OF GUADALUPE was also flying from the masthead of Don Juan‚Äôs flagship. 

Pope Pius V, a Dominican prelate before becoming a Pope, did what Catholics have always done in times of acute danger: FLY INTO THE ARMS OF THE MOST POWERFUL MOTHER OF GOD. As a follower of Saint Dominic, HE KNEW THE MOST EFFECTIVE MEANS OF IMPLORING HER HELP WAS THROUGH THE RECITATION OF THE HOLY ROSARY. He ordered all monasteries and convents in Rome to increase their prayers for the impending battle and organized ROSARY PROCESSIONS in which he, as sick as he was, participated. OUR LADY‚ÄôS PRESENCE THAT DAY WAS MORE ACUTELY FELT THROUGH THE HOLY ROSARY.

As the Christian fleet sailed toward the great clash, MASS WAS CELEBRATED AND THE ROSARY RECITED DAILY ON EACH VESSEL‚Ä¶.. THIS HEARTFELT REQUEST FOR DIVINE ASSISTANCE RESULTED IN A CRUSHING DEFEAT OF THE OTTOMANS AT LEPANTO THAT ENDED THEIR DOMINANCE AND CRUELTY IN THE MEDITERRANEAN. OCTOBER 7, 1571, WAS THE VICTORY OF OUR LADY OF THE MOST HOLY ROSARY, EVEN IF THE CHRISTIAN FLEET WAS GREATLY OUTNUMBERED BY THE OTTOMAN FLEET.

TO CELEBRATE OUR LADY‚ÄôS INTERCESSION AND VICTORY, THE CHURCH HAS DESIGNATED OCTOBER 7 AS THE FEAST OF OUR LADY OF THE MOST HOLY ROSARY. Similar acknowledgement to the Blessed Virgin‚Äôs intercession through the Rosary were made when John Sobieski forced the Turks to lift the Siege of Vienna in 1683 and after the victory of Prince Eugene of Savoy at Temesvar in his successful campaign to remove the Ottomans from Europe in the next century.

Raise of hands üôãüèªif smartphones have ever been a topic of worry and/or conflict between you and your teen. The teen years are a time of developing identity and independence üí™. Even if we don‚Äôt like it, it‚Äôs totally normal for teens to push back against boundaries and resist parental influence. But they still need their parents!! Especially when it comes to things like learning to use technology üì± in ways that enrich, rather than hinder, their life. Asking questions‚ùîlike these from Brooke Romney Writes can be a great place to start. They (1) show our teens we‚Äôre on their side and (2) help them consider their phone usage for themselves! üëâAs you find natural ways to bring up these questions (not all at once!), you set the stage for offering support and guidance while helping your teen take charge of their own screen time. Bonus tip: Teens are often more willing to open up about things like this if it‚Äôs not a direct, face-to-face conversation. Try going for a drive or going out for ice cream for some casual but quality together time. What else has helped *you* navigate smartphone usage with your teens? üëá #parents #parenting #parentingteens #smartphone

Zoutleeuw. Het systeem op de Kleine Gete werkte in de glorietijd maar werd letterlijk een pest in de moeilijke jaren. In 1573 brengt een overstroming niet alleen de pest in de stad maar veroorzaakt ook veel schade aan de gebouwen. Sinds 1578 krijgt de bevolking het zwaar te verduren van een groot Spaans garnizoen dat in de stad wordt gelegerd. De Spanjaarden zetten grote delen van het landschap onder water met armoede en ziekte als gevolg door het verlies van weiden en pachthoven. In de 17de eeuw komen daar nog eens een drietal grote stadsbranden bovenop. Ondanks de in 1671 gebouwde citadel wordt het stadje in 1678 en 1701 door de troepen van Lodewijk XIV bezet en geplunderd. De geschiedenis van Zoutleeuw is een goed voorbeeld hoe een klein stadje en zijn burgers lijden kunnen onder de veroveringsgrillen van grote Europese machten. Na de stad bezet en geplunderd te hebben in 1678 moeten de Fransen nog datzelfde jaar de macht weer aan Spanje overdragen als gevolg van de ‚ÄòVrede van Nijmegen‚Äô die een einde maakt het conflict tussen Frankrijk en de Republiek der Zeven Verenigde Provinci√´n. Maar zeven jaar later, in 1705 wordt de stad met zware beschietingen opnieuw veroverd, ditmaal door de geallieerde Engels-Hollandse troepen onder bevel van John Churchill, hertog van Marlborough. Vanaf 1715 brengt het einde van de Spaanse Successieoorlog de stad onder Oostenrijks-Habsburger bewind samen met de rest van de zuidelijke Nederlanden. Dat brengt tijdelijk rust en zelfs weer wat welvaart tot aan de Franse revolutie maar betekent onder het bewind van Keizer Joseph II wel het einde van talrijke plaatselijke kloosterorden. Tot aan die Revolutie blijft de stad strategisch belangrijk als grens met het prinsbisdom Luik maar als de Fransen Brabant en Luik annexeren valt dat belang weg. Dat heeft de stad na de revolutie goed gedaan want onder Koning Willem I kan er opnieuw gehandeld en ge√Ønvesteerd worden in burgerlijke goederen en diensten en niet alleen in het militaire. Het verzoek om de verzande Gete opnieuw bevaarbaar te maken wilde de koning echter niet inwilligen. Bij de onafhankelijkheid van Belgi√´ moet de stad wel zijn stadstitel inleveren en die hebben de Zoutleeuwers pas in 1985 teruggekregen. +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++ [https://ernstguelcher.blogspot.com/2021/09/op-stap-in-zoutleeuw.html](https://ernstguelcher.blogspot.com/2021/09/op-stap-in-zoutleeuw.html)

It has become my constant companion, etched into my very being like the trials that mark my flesh. Darkness enveloped me as I sat in the dimly lit room, my body shivering from both tension and cold. For years, I had endured the relentless cruelty of Alpha Fenrir, my mate. I was nothing more than his human captive, a pawn in his twisted game of power. The collar around my neck was proof of his claim over me. Fenrir returned after leaving me alone all day, and his arrival brought an air of impending doom. As he grabbed the chain leash that adorned my neck, pulling it with force, I fell to my knees to the floor. I hissed in anger at being treated this way, which he ignored. "Follow me," he commanded, his voice laced with malice. "Try to keep up and don't be a burden on me, Lyla." My spirit refused to be broken, even in the face of a truly horrible beast as himself. "The only burden in this room is you to me," I mustered the strength to retort, but my defiance only earned me a harsh response. He yanked me back to my feet and pulled the leash, leading me through the cold stone corridors to a makeshift hospital within the pack's stronghold. Inside, injured warriors from the recent battle were tended to, their wounds telling the tales of the conflict they endured. In the center of the room stood a well, a lifeline to my elemental powers. This well, built directly into the building, was a source of both strength and despair for me. Fenrir's voice echoed coldly as he demanded I heal his warriors, preparing them for the next battle in the ongoing war with a rival pack. My heart cried out in protest. I loathed using my water elemental powers; they had brought me nothing but terror throughout my life. Many different kinds of people, both human and supernatural, sought me out for these very powers, seeking to exploit me for their own gain. I glanced down at the necklace around my neck, the Moon's Tear, my most cherished possession. It was an intricate piece, bestowed upon me by my mother, who had loved me dearly before fate took her away. The necklace served as a reminder of the strength and resilience I once possessed. With a heavy heart, I agreed to Fenrir's command, knowing that if I refused, the consequences for myself and the pack would be dire. Drawing upon my abilities, I called forth a substantial amount of water from the well, and with precision, I manipulated it to rest gently on the warriors' wounds, coaxing them to heal. Each healing was a draining task, both physically and emotionally, but I pushed through, fueled by the hope that my actions might save these lives. -‚éΩ__‚éΩ-‚éª‚é∫‚é∫‚éª-‚éΩ__‚éΩ--‚éª‚é∫‚é∫‚éª- [#fantasyfiction](https://www.facebook.com/hashtag/fantasyfiction?__eep__=6&__cft__[0]=AZVKvlnfHMaoPeaAHKg2jQHrjiaI1KfxZJsWH2L-uiz2XpUBejqLYPamk1PgBVJzuANnrN2YuvYQvl3Ni9TagRCvGX6ZroATx78XGCSFD4kjsLucb7P54GB31FczsOMEfhPyfdyFkCXjXrYU9oZhOAC4&__cft__[1]=AZVKvlnfHMaoPeaAHKg2jQHrjiaI1KfxZJsWH2L-uiz2XpUBejqLYPamk1PgBVJzuANnrN2YuvYQvl3Ni9TagRCvGX6ZroATx78XGCSFD4kjsLucb7P54GB31FczsOMEfhPyfdyFkCXjXrYU9oZhOAC4&__tn__=*NK-R]-R) (truncated)

Our event with Alistair Moffat originally scheduled for tonight has now been put back to Friday 20th October. If you have already bought tickets for tonight's event, they will be valid for the new date. If you would like tickets for the new date, please contact the shop Alistair will be joining us to talk about War Paths: Walking in the Shadows of the Clans. In thirteen journeys Alistair's book explores places of conflict, recreating as he walks the tumult of battle. As he recounts the military prowess of the clans ‚Äì surely the most feared fighting men in western Europe ‚Äì he also speaks of their lives, their language and culture before it was all swept away. The disaster at Culloden in 1746 represented not just the defeat of the Jacobite dream but also the unleashing of merciless retribution from the British government which dealt the Highland clans a blow from which they would never recover. From the colonisers who attempted to ‚Äòcivilise‚Äô the islanders of Lewis in the sixteenth century through the great battles of the eighteenth century ‚Äì Killiekrankie, Dunkeld, Sheriffmuir, Falkirk and Culloden ‚Äì this is a unique exploration of many of the places and events which define a country‚Äôs history.

TINGNAN | KAGAMITANG PANDIGMA NG NPA NASAMSAM NG 80IB SA ISANG ENGKWENTRO SA QUEZON

BARAS, RIZAL ‚Äì Umabot sa 30 minuto ang sagupaan sa pagitan ng mga elemento ng 80th Infantry (STEADFAST) Battalion, 2nd Infantry (Jungle Fighter) Division, Philippine Army at ang humigit kumulang na 20 miyembro ng New People‚Äôs Army o NPA na mga miyembro ng KLG NARCISO, Sub-Regional Military Area 4A ng Southern Tagalog Regional Party Committee sa pamumuno ni Janice Javier alyas Yayo, Secretary ng KLG Narciso at Jordan Mopon alyas Boyong, Platun leader habang nagsasagawa ng focus military operations sa Sitio Imawang, Barangay Lumutan, General Nakar, Quezon Setyembre 27, 2023.

Malaking tulong sa hanay ng kasundaluhan ang mga impormasyon mula sa mga mamamayan upang masubaybayan at tuluyan nang mawakasan ang armadong rebolusyon ng CPP-NPA-NDF sa probinsya ng Rizal, Bulacan, at Quezon. Ito ay nagresulta sa isang engkwentro sa pagitan ng mga kasundaluhan at armadong grupo ng NPA at pagkakarekober ng mga kagamitang pandigma ng armadong grupo tulad ng rifle grenade, M16 short magazine, mga bala, mga subersibong dokumento at personal na kagamitan.

Matatandaan sa mga nakalipas na taon, sinimulan ng mga kasundaluhan ng 80IB sa tulong ng iba‚Äôt ibang ahensya ng gobyerno ang programa o ang pagsasagawa ng malawakang Local Peace Engagement (LPE) o pagbabalik-loob ng mga dating miyembro at sumusuporta sa teroristang  CPP-NPA-NDF at pagbubuo ng people‚Äôs organization. Isa na rito ang Barangay Lumutan na sinuportahan ng Pamahalaang Bayan ng General Nakar, Quezon at netong buwan lang isinakatuparan ang pagkakaroon ng livelihood project, ang Eco-Tourism Park & Campsite sa naturang Barangay. Ito ay nagpapakita lamang na ang mga mamamayan ng Rizal, Bulacan at Quezon lalung lalo na sa Barangay Lumutan ay mulat na sa mga maling idelolohiyang ipinapakalat ng mga makakaliwang grupo at nais na nilang matamasa ang isang tunay na mapayapa at maunlad  na pamayanan na malayo sa presyensya  ng CPP-NPA-NDF.

Muli, patuloy parin ang panawagan ng pamahalaan sa mga natitira pang mga miyembro ng NPA na bumaba, isuko ang kanilang mga armas at talikuran ang mga maling idelolohiyang pinaglalaban na nagdudulot lamang ng kapahamakan. Ang gobyerno ay palaging bukas palad at nakahandang tumanggap sa lahat ng gustong magbalik-loob upang makasama nilang muli ang kanilang mga mahal sa buhay. 

Kung sino man ang may impormasyon ukol sa pinagtataguan ng mga teroristang grupo, wag mag-atubiling magkontak sa aming himpilan sa mga numerong ito:

Malignant meaning, evil in nature or effect, being around narcissists often has many negative effects on you, from emotional, mental, physical, financial, psychological and spiritual. As far as I‚Äôm aware, The malignant Narcissist isn‚Äôt an official diagnosis. The term was coined by psychologist Erich Fromm, who was a German Jew and fled the Nazi regime and settled in the USA he describes the malignant as. ‚ÄúThe most severe pathology and the root of the most vicious destructiveness and inhumanity‚Äù. Signs of a malignant narcissist. Evil in nature or effect. Superficial charm. Relentlessly aggressive. Pathological liar. Sadism. Deliberately causing suffering to others. Antisocial behaviour. Little to no empathy. Zero responsibility. No remorse. Extreme envy. Abrupt mood swings. Superior. Arrogant. The most pathological and, hurtful of all narcissists, they have no sense of their inner worth, meaning they are full of rage and extremely vindictive, they are extremely dangerous and will stop at nothing to harm others, they are extremely unstable and often unstoppable, they will encourage others to fight on their behalf, they are incredibly impulsive, they have no empathy or guilt, taking lots of rash hurtful actions towards others, they have an excessive rage within themselves. They have the ability to change reality for millions of people, their crazy internal reality, makes those around them believe the narcissist‚Äôs crazy reality, in the millions if allowed to do so. They have no limits, and there is nothing they will not do to serve themselves. The malignant narcissist is extremely arrogant and self-centred. They have a very fragile, super-sensitive ego. They need to convince all others just how special they are, in order to feel better about themselves, they might not be aware of their sensitive ego, often they feel threatened in some way real or perceived. Hence, they just believe others are against them and do all they can to seek revenge on those the narcissist perceives to have turned against them. The malignant narcissist is extremely envious and are pathological at holding grudges against others. They hate seeing others with something they haven‚Äôt got, or something they want, most often assuming it‚Äôs down to pure luck that others have achieved, the malignant narcissist can be pathological in trying to destroy someone they themselves are envious of. The malignant narcissist has that sense of entitlement like most narcissists. They believe they are superior to others; not only do they expect to be treated as superior they often demand to be treated as superior. They believe they are entitled to do what they want, whenever they want, with whoever they want and whatever they want, as they believe they are above all others. The malignant narcissist often has no empathy. Many actually get pleasure out of harming others, a complete lack of genuine compassion. They can act empathetically if they have Cognitive Empathy. They will show fake empathy to others, to deceive those around them in order to protect themselves, to get enablers and flying monkeys to protect them. People either love and respect them or genuinely fear them both will carry out their demands. The malignant narcissist will exploit all others to get their needs met, with no thoughts or feelings to how it affects those around them. They need power and control and achieve this by coming across as a great saviour to people in the beginning. They will go all out to protect their enablers, not to protect their enablers in order to protects themselves, by getting enablers to feel obligated into defending and protecting the narcissist. The malignant can show signs of antisocial behaviour. These are pathological liars. They have an unprovoked hostility and aggression towards others that they will blame on others. They can look for trouble, even pre-planning it. They will set others up for a fall, they will create drama and could conflict in those around them. They have volatile mood swings, they cheat, steal and lie, they believe they are above the law and are extremely dangerous and toxic. The malignant narcissist can show signs of Paranoia. It‚Äôs not that they don‚Äôt trust those around them, because of how they think, they are extremely suspicious of all those around them, and believe all others are out to get them. The malignant narcissist is extremely manipulative. These don‚Äôt wait to see an opportunity to manipulate others, although they will use an opportunity. They actively create opportunities, they genuinely go around looking for those they can take advantage of, they plan, and they plot to win at any and all costs to those around them. The malignant can show signs of sadism they will deliberately cause, harm, suffering, pain and distress to others, often showing hatred. They enjoy seeing people, animal, anything suffers. They will knowingly inflict pain and suffering on those around, to gain control of others, or to just feel (truncated)

Luste, Asst. MCAD under the supervision of PLTCOL NATHANIEL P AGATEP, OIC conducted Barangay visitation, dialogue, Pulong-Pulong, and information dissemination about the current peace and order situation in the community. Also discussed were the 28-day Campaign of the BIDA Program, Security measures/preparations for the upcoming BSKE 2023, COMELEC Guidelines, some salient provisions of R.A 9262 (Anti-Violence Against Women and their Children Act of 2004) also known as VAWC to address violence committed against women and Children, and the National Taskforce to End Local Communist Armed Conflict (NTF-ELCAC). Further, OPLAN BANDILLO was conducted to disseminate information regarding other crime prevention tips such as Anti Robbery and Theft (Akyat-Bahay safety awareness tips). The personnel also distributed and posted the PNP local Hotline numbers during house and establishment visitations. The said activities aim to establish a strong and sustainable community defense system against lawlessness and criminality and, strengthen the partnership and working relationship between the PNP and the community. The activity ended at about 12:15 p.m. on the same date. This activity is in line with the PNP P.A.T.R.O.L. Plan 2030, the Transformation Program of the Organization.
