Callie Eh, Malaysian / Swiss Photographer, born 1972 Color of Life: Blue Series, Handprint (Morocco) Fine Art Photography Born and raised in Malaysia, currently based in Switzerland. Her travels have inspired her to capture life with photography. What started off as a hobby, capturing special moments of her time around new cities and environments eventually evolved into a career she never foresaw coming. This very passion drove her to use the camera to express and deliver narratives previously unseen and untold. For her, photography became more than a way of creating memories. ‚ÄãPhotography has been a tremendous support for Callie and It has been a refuge for Callie during difficult times and a safe space to explore a multitude of emotions concerning love, conflict, and hope. Callie‚Äôs works mostly refer to life ‚ÄúIn the moment‚Äù. She captures people to reveal honesty and express the authenticity of their individuality, heritage, and life. The raw power of her images makes us want to know more about the subjects, their life, and their personal stories. ‚ÄãARTIST STATEMENT For me photography was a life-saver. It picked me up at a difficult time in my life and I have not let it go ever since. Originally from Malaysia, I have lived in various countries and I am now based in Switzerland. Photography has changed my view of the world and has made me see things differently. I like to mix genres but my greatest photographic passion right now is documentary photography, inspired by my travels, the people I meet, the different cultures and the different ways of life

Kenojuak Ashevak (Inuk, 1927‚Äì2013)
Floral Passage, 2007
Stonecut and stencil
62.2 x 73.7 cm. (24.5 x 29 in.)
Private collection 

Kenojuak Ashevak, CC ONu RCA (October 3, 1927 ‚Äì January 8, 2013) is celebrated as a leading figure of modern Inuit art. 

Kenojuak Ashevak was born in an igloo in an Inuit camp, Ikirasaq, at the southern coast of Baffin Island. Her father, Ushuakjuk, an Inuit hunter and fur trader, and her mother, Silaqqi, named Kenojuak after Silaqqi's deceased father.

Kenojuak remembered Ushuakjuk as "a kind and benevolent man." Her father, a respected angakkuq (shaman), "had more knowledge than average mortals, and he would help all the Inuit people.‚Äù  According to Kenojuak, her father believed he could predict weather, predict good hunting seasons and even turn into a walrus. Her father came into conflict with Christian converts, and some enemies assassinated him in a hunting camp in 1933, when she was only six.

After her father's murder, Kenojuak moved with her widowed mother Silaqqi and family to the home of Silaqqi's mother, Koweesa, who taught her traditional crafts, including the repair of sealskins for trade with the Hudson's Bay Company and how to make waterproof clothes sewn with caribou sinew.

When she was 19, her mother, Silaqqi, and stepfather, Takpaugni, arranged for her to marry Johnniebo Ashevak, a local Inuit hunter. Kenojuak was reluctant, but in time, she came to love him for his kindness and gentleness, a man who developed artistic talents in his own right. 

In 1950 a public health nurse arrived in her Arctic village; Kenojuak, having tested positive in a tuberculosis screening, was sent against her will to Parc Savard hospital in Quebec City, where she stayed for over three years, from early 1952 to the summer of 1955. She had just given birth when she was forcibly transferred; the baby was adopted by a neighbouring family. Several of Kenojuak's children died while she was confined in hospital.

In 1966, Kenojuak and Johnniebo moved to Cape Dorset. Many of their children and grandchildren succumbed to disease, as did her husband after 26 years of marriage. Three daughters of Kenojuak, Mary, Elisapee Qiqituk, and Aggeok, died in childhood, and four sons, Jamasie, her adopted son Ashevak, and Kadlarjuk and Qiqituk. The latter two were adopted at birth by another family.

The year after Johnniebo died in 1972, Kenojuak remarried, to Etyguyakjua Pee; he died in 1977. In 1978 she married Joanassie Igiu. She had 11 children by her first husband and adopted five more; seven of her children died in childhood. At the time of her death from lung cancer, she was living in a wood-frame house in Kinngait (Cape Dorset).

Kenojuak Ashevak became one of the first Inuit women in Cape Dorset to begin drawing. She worked in graphite, coloured pencils and felt-tip pens, and occasionally used poster paints, watercolours or acrylics. She created many carvings from soapstone and thousands of drawings, etchings, stonecut prints and prints ‚Äî all sought after by museums and collectors. She designed several drawings for Canadian stamps and coins, and in 2004 she created the first Inuit-designed stained-glass window for the John Bell Chapel in Oakville, Ontario. In 2017, the $10 bill released in celebration of Canada's 150th birthday features Kenojuak's stone-cut and stencil printed work called "Owl‚Äôs Bouquet" in silver holographic foil.

During Ashevak's stay at Parc Savard hospital in Quebec City, 1952 to 1955, she learned to make dolls from Harold Pfeiffer and to do beadwork. These crafts later attracted the attention of civil administrator and pioneer Inuit art promoter James Archibald Houston and his wife Alma. Houston introduced print-making to Cape Dorset artists in the 1950s, and he and his wife began marketing Inuit arts and crafts, including an exhibit of Inuit art in 1959.

By 1959 Kenojuak and other Cape Dorset Inuit had formed the West Baffin Eskimo Co-operative as a senlavik (workshop) for aspiring Inuit artists, later known as Kinngait Studios.

In 1963 she was the subject of a National Film Board documentary: Eskimo Artist: Kenojuak, about Kenojuak, then 35, and her family, as well as traditional Inuit life on Baffin Island. The film showed a stonecutter carving her design into a relief block in stone, cutting away all the non-printing surfaces; she would then apply ink to the carved stone, usually in two or more colours, and carefully make 50 "shadow" prints for sale. With the money she earned from the film, Johnniebo was able to purchase his own canoe and become an independent hunter to help provide for the family, which now included a new daughter, Aggeo, and an adopted son, Ashevak.

The work of Ashevak Kenojuak can be found in the collections of Canada's National Gallery, the Art Gallery of Ontario, and the Burnaby Art Gallery.

Kenojuak became the first Inuit artist inducted into Canada's Walk of Fame in 2001, and traveled to Toronto with her (truncated)

Hello, My name is Dannie Garcia and I am the daughter of a police officer. Here is a link to my PhD research study, which include ANONYMOUS surveys: https://s.surveyplanet.com/nr0j28jx The details of the study are below: There is a new study to examine the impact, if any, of police officers' coping styles and occupational stressors on their adult offspring's self-regulation and explore work-family conflict as a mediator in that relationship. For this study, the law enforcement parent is invited to complete anonymous surveys that rate your experiences of stress, coping, and work-family conflict. The adult offspring is invited to complete anonymous surveys that rate their experiences of their law enforcement parents‚Äô work-family conflict, and their own self-regulation. About the study: * The law enforcement parent will be asked to complete demographic questions and four surveys, including: * The Police Stress Questionnaire- Operational- 8 minutes * The Police Stress Questionnaire- Organizational- 8 minutes * Brief COPE Inventory- 11 minutes * Work-Family Conflict Scale- 7 minutes * The adult offspring will be asked to complete two surveys, including: * Work-Family Conflict Scale (child version)- 7 minutes * Self-Regulation Questionnaire (SSRQ)- 20 minutes Volunteers must meet these requirements: * Parent-adult child dyad volunteers who are: ¬∑ A parent who is a current, former, or retired law enforcement officer from active commissions, from a municipality as a police officer, with a county government as a sheriff's deputy, with a state department as a state trooper, or for a federal agency that commissions people with arrest powers. ¬∑ An adult offspring, 18 years or older, of the law enforcement officer participant. This is part of the doctoral study for Dannie Garcia, a Ph.D. student at Walden University. Please follow this LINK: (https://s.surveyplanet.com/nr0j28jx)to complete the surveys. Please share this link and invitation with your law enforcement parent or your adult child to complete their portion of the study. Please email dannie.garcia@waldenu.edu for any additional questions. Please read about consent before participating: Anonymous Survey Consent Form You are invited to complete an anonymous online questionnaire for a Walden University doctoral study. To provide your informed consent, please review the information below and continue on to the survey if you choose to proceed. Your role: is completely voluntary and can end at any time you wish is anonymous (your name will not be requested) involves completing a questionnaire involves little or no risk Privacy: To protect your privacy, the researcher will not collect, track, or store your identity or contact info. In place of a consent signature, your completion of the questionnaire would indicate that you consent to your responses being analyzed in the study. Data will be kept secure by using password-protected devices and platforms. Data will be kept for a period of at least 5 years, as required by the university. Once the doctoral student graduates, the study‚Äôs results will be posted online in Scholarworks (a searchable publication of Walden University research). Contacts and Questions: Questions about the study can be emailed to the student researcher via dannie.garcia@waldenu.edu. If you want to talk privately about your rights as a participant or any negative parts of the study, you can call Walden University‚Äôs Research Participant Advocate at 612-312-1210 or email IRB@mail.waldenu.edu. Walden University‚Äôs ethics approval number for this study is 10-03-23-0995443. You might wish to retain this consent form for your records. You may ask the researcher or Walden University for a copy at any time using the contact info above.

zojuist ontvangen in de mail ;-) Beste partijgenoot, Afgelopen weken heeft het dagelijks bestuur van de Partij voor de Dieren een zorgvuldige en intensieve procedure doorlopen, conform onze meldregeling, om tot een standpunt te komen ten aanzien van de meldingen van vermeende integriteitsschendingen die tegen Esther Ouwehand zijn gedaan. Mede op basis van advies van externe deskundigen, is het dagelijks bestuur tot de conclusie gekomen dat Esther Ouwehand geen integriteitsschendingen heeft begaan. We zullen deze conclusie nader toelichten. Allereerst merken we op dat meldingen van vermoedens van integriteitsschendingen normaliter in volledige vertrouwelijkheid moeten worden behandeld, zodat in alle rust uitvoerig onderzoek kan worden gedaan. We betreuren dat er beschuldigingen van integriteitsschendingen in de openbaarheid zijn geuit. Dit heeft de partij en Esther Ouwehand schade toegebracht. Ook was dit een inbreuk op het onschuldprincipe. Bovendien werd hierdoor de gehele procedure onder grote druk gezet. In het kader van de vertrouwelijkheid kunnen we niet op de exacte inhoud van de verschillende meldingen ingaan. We kunnen wel in algemene termen beschrijven wat er is gebeurd en welke procedures daarbij zijn gevolgd. Op 27 september heeft onze integriteitssecretaris negen meldingen tegen Esther Ouwehand overgedragen aan onze voorzitter. Deze meldingen waren alle afkomstig van leden van het voormalige partijbestuur. E√©n van deze meldingen was gedaan op 30 augustus, zeven van deze meldingen werden gedaan op 14 september en √©√©n melding werd gedaan op 27 september. Conform de meldregeling is het in de eerste plaats aan de voorzitter om een standpunt in te nemen over meldingen. Hij kan zich laten bijstaan door leden van ons dagelijks bestuur. Dat is in dit geval gebeurd. Zij kunnen zich verder laten bijstaan door externe deskundigen. Daar hebben zij in dit geval ook voor gekozen. De eerste stap in het beoordelen van de meldingen is de ontvankelijkheidstoets. De functie van deze toetsing is om te voorkomen dat ieder conflict in de vereniging via de meldregeling wordt uitgevochten. De meldregeling is bedoeld als een laatste redmiddel voor serieuze vermoedens van integriteitsschendingen die niet op een andere manier bespreekbaar gemaakt kunnen worden. Bij het formuleren van een standpunt heeft het dagelijks bestuur zich laten bijstaan door een externe deskundige die is gespecialiseerd in verenigingsrecht. Zij hebben gezamenlijk geconcludeerd dat acht van de negen meldingen niet-ontvankelijk waren en de negende deels niet-ontvankelijk was. Concreet wil dat zeggen dat deze meldingen volgens de meldregeling niet in behandeling kunnen worden genomen. Vaak was dit omdat een gedraging niet onder de reikwijdte van een gedragsregel viel of omdat de melder de beklaagde redelijkerwijs had kunnen, of nog kan, aanspreken. E√©n melding werd als gedeeltelijk ontvankelijk beoordeeld. Deze melding bleek echter niet gegrond. Dat wil zeggen dat, hoewel de melding binnen de reikwijdte van de regeling paste, er geen sprake bleek van een integriteitsschending. Uit oogpunt van zorgvuldigheid en gelet op de grote belangen heeft het bestuur daarna twee externe deskundigen op het gebied van integriteit om een second opinion gevraagd. Deze stap gaat verder dan de meldregeling voorschrijft. Zij hebben voor hun oordeel een triage uitgevoerd. Daarbij zijn zij uitgegaan van de (hypothetische) veronderstelling die maximaal recht doet aan de positie van de melder, door blind uit te gaan van het waarheidsgehalte en de ontvankelijkheid van de melding. In die context hebben ze de vraag beantwoord: als de door de melder beschreven handelingen precies zo hebben plaatsgevonden als beschreven, zou er dan inderdaad sprake zijn van een integriteitsschending? Zij concludeerden dat in geen van de meldingen sprake was van enige integriteitsschending. Dezelfde conclusies gelden voor de medewerker van de Tweede Kamerfractie tegen wie √©√©n van de meldingen ook was gericht. Het bestuur concludeert ook dat er door het voormalige bestuur op een oneigenlijke manier is omgegaan met de eigen meldprocedure. Zowel de bestuurlijke lijnen als de integriteitsregelingen zijn aan een stevige professionaliseringslag toe. Het bestuur heeft naar aanleiding van de recente gebeurtenissen ook besloten zo snel mogelijk een externe integriteitssecretaris aan te stellen. Al langere tijd bestond er een verschil van inzicht over de professionalisering van de Partij voor de Dieren tussen enerzijds het voormalige partijbestuur en anderzijds de partijleider en een groot deel van de lokale en regionale volksvertegenwoordigers en afdelingsbestuurders. De meldingen die tegen Ouwehand zijn gedaan zijn door hun timing en strekking onmiskenbaar een escalatie geweest om dit verschil van inzicht te beslechten. We willen en gaan nu verder vooruitkijken. Als bestuur zullen wij aan de slag gaan met de verdere professionalisering en democratisering van onze prachtige beweging. In dat (truncated)

President William Ruto has warned that the government will no longer tolerate acts of hooliganism on the clash-prone Sondu/Kericho border.He directed Cabinet Secretary for Interior Kithure Kindiki to deal with perpetrators of the cross-border conflict, which has so far claimed three innocent lives. #EmooFmNewsUpdates

BANAT BRIGADA ENGKUWENTRO October 7, 2023 TOPIC: ANO ANG INYONG REAKSYON SA PAHAYAG NI VP SARA DUTERTE NA KUNG SINUMAN ANG KUMOKONTRA SA CONFIDENTIAL FUNDS AY KALABAN NG BAYAN? Idinepensa ni Vice President at Department of Education (DepEd) Secretary Sara Duterte ang kontrobersyal na proposed confidential funds ng kanyang opisina. Sa nagdaang selebrasyon ng 122nd Police Service Anniversary ng Police Regional Office 13 na ginanap sa Butuan City nitong Miyerkules, October 4, iginiit ng bise presidente ang kahalagahan ng confidential funds para sa seguridad ng bansa. Binigyang diin ni VP Sara na kung sinuman ang kumokontra sa confidential funds ay kumokontra sa kapayapaan at kung sinong kumokontra sa kapayapaan ay kalaban ng bayan. Nabanggit rin ni VP Sara ang pagiging miyembro ng DepEd sa Anti-Terrorist Council pati na rin sa National Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict bilang patunay ng ‚Äúunwavering commitment‚Äù ng ahensya para maprotektahan ang mga mag-aaral, mga guro, at iba pang stakeholders nito. Pinalagan naman ng Bagong Alyansang Makabayan (Bayan) ang pahayag ni ito ng Pangalawang Pangulo. Binigyang diin ng Bayan na isang mapanganib na paraan ng pag-iisip ito ng Bise Presidente. Ayon kay Bayan secretary general Renato Reyes, ngayon lang sila nakarinig na ang paghingi ng transparency at pananagutan ay ituturing nang banta sa kapayapaan at seguridad. Ikinabahala ni Reyes ang takbo umano ng pag-iisip ni VP Sara dahil hindi naman aniya nangangahulugan na ang pagtutol sa confidential fund ay isa nang pagpapakita ng suporta sa isang maling gawain. Matatandaang kamakailan lang nang magdesisyon ang Kongreso na alisin ang pinagsamang P650-million confidential funds ng Office of the Vice President at DepEd na pinamumunuan ni VP Sara para sa 2024 at ilipat ito sa ahensyang nakatutok sa West Philippine Sea. Bago ito, nauna nang maging usap-usapan ang confidential funds nang aminin ni Marikina 2nd District Rep. Stella Quimbo na nagastos ng OVP ang P125-million confidential funds nito noong 2022 sa loob lamang ng 11 araw, taliwas sa naunang report na 19 araw. Kabrigada, Ano ang inyong reaksyon sa pahayag ni VP Sara Duterte na ang kung sinuman ang kumokontra sa confidential funds ay kalaban ng bayan?

PESHAWAR: A division bench of the Peshawar High Court (PHC) on Tuesday disposed of different petitions against the Medical and Dental Colleges Admission Test (MDCAT) after the government announced to re-conduct the exam. The division bench comprising Justice Abdul Shakoor and Justice Arshad Ali had earlier reserved the judgment in the case. The advocate general told the court the government after a cabinet meeting had already announced to hold the test afresh and the Khyber Medical University had been contacted in this regard. He argued that a Joint Investigation Team (JIT) had taken up a number of issues in the MDCAT that needed to be addressed. The counsel of one of the petitioners told the court that some students had scored high marks. He added that there should be a system to ensure that such students do not suffer while re-conducting the test. The court later disposed of the case citing the decision of the government to hold another test in a transparent manner. The detailed judgment will be released later. Earlier, in what appeared to be a case of conflict of interest, a key member of the JIT probing the use of Bluetooth devices and other unfair means in recently held MDCAT in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa was found to be the father of a low-scoring candidate in the same test. On the basis of the JIT report, the caretaker provincial government also went ahead of its constitutional role and mandate to announce reconduct of the MDCAT test. According to sources, one candidate named Moeed Hassan, who was the son of an additional secretary in the provincial Home Department and a key member of the JIT, Maqsood Hassan, could obtain only 136 out of the total 200 marks in the test. These marks are insufficient for admission into any public or private medical and dental colleges. As per the law pertaining to the conflict of interest, this officer should not have been made a member of the important investigation team, a senior officer at the Civil Secretariat told The News. When reached for comments, Maqsood Hassan admitted that his son had appeared in the test. ‚ÄúBut, the result of the test has not yet been declared and my son has already chosen another direction for himself,‚Äù he said. The officer claimed that it was not a conflict of interest if he was made a member of the committee probing the use of unfair means in a test in which his own son had appeared. He said the JIT was about the whole process and if the government had asked him to be a part of the probe committee, it was not something unethical. The officer said the JIT had not recommended reconduct of the test but only identified loopholes and gaps in the process. A senior official in ETEA, however, said that they had already finalized the result, declared the top position holders and submitted the same to the PMDC, which would declare it along with other provinces. ‚ÄúETEA has also uploaded the solved key on the internet and every student was able to easily calculate his result from there‚Äù, he added. It is important to mention here that the JIT formed by the chief secretary had been tasked to unearth the elements involved in the unfair means, arrest them and recommend suggestions for averting use of unfair practices in future. It was none of its (JIT‚Äôs) mandate to suggest reconduct of the test, which it did in violation of its mandate. Also, the JIT was led by a police officer which is why the lapses committed by the police got no mention in the report as it was their duty to check and prevent entry of any objectionable devices into the centre. The caretaker government also asked KMU to conduct the test. Again, it was a violation of the law as under section 4 (a) of Khyber Pakhtunkhwa Educational Testing and Evaluation Agency Ordinance, 2001 it was the duty of ETEA to conduct admission tests to the educational institutions of the province. ETEA was the only testing agency in the whole country which busted the Bluetooth racket and conducted the test in a much transparent manner for which it should be awarded instead of being subjected to media trial. Dr Yasir Imran, ETEA director, told The News that the staff of the agency caught 219 candidates red-handed who were using Bluetooth and other electronic devices and handed them over to the police. He said that 470 top scorers of the test were having brilliant academic records in the Secondary and Higher Secondary School Certificates. The topper of ETEA MDCAT, who scored 198 marks in the test, has also clinched the top position in the FSc from Kohat Board in FSc too. The topper of Mardan board in FSc also scored good marks in the MDCAT. It is unfair to blame and discourage the brilliant students for the use of unfair means and force them to reappear in the test. The director ETEA said that they had identified only 168 candidates who had not done the required level of rough work on their question papers. These candidates were being investigated further. ‚ÄúThough not proven yet, if they are for the time (truncated)

15 lessons from the book Becoming a Leader by Myles Munroe: 1. Leadership is the capacity to influence others through inspiration. 2. Everyone is a leader in some way. 3. Leadership is not about position or power, but about character. 4. The most important thing in leadership is to develop your own potential. 5. You must have a clear vision and purpose for your life in order to lead others. 6. Leaders must be willing to serve others. 7. Leaders must be humble. 8. Leaders must be honest and trustworthy. 9. Leaders must be courageous. 10. Leaders must be decisive. 11. Leaders must be persistent. 12. Leaders must be able to motivate and inspire others. 13. Leaders must be able to develop and empower others. 14. Leaders must be able to build and maintain relationships. 15. Leaders must be able to create and manage change. In addition to these general lessons, Munroe also teaches a number of specific lessons about leadership in his book, such as: ‚Ä¢ The importance of having a kingdom perspective. ‚Ä¢ The importance of understanding your identity and purpose. ‚Ä¢ The importance of developing your character. ‚Ä¢ The importance of building a strong team. ‚Ä¢ The importance of creating a culture of excellence. ‚Ä¢ The importance of communicating effectively. ‚Ä¢ The importance of resolving conflict. ‚Ä¢ The importance of making decisions that are in the best interests of your team and your organization. Munroe's book is a valuable resource for anyone who wants to become a more effective leader. He provides a clear and concise overview of the essential principles of leadership, and he offers practical advice on how to apply these principles in real life. Here is a bonus lesson from Munroe's book: ‚Ä¢ Leadership is a journey, not a destination. This means that there is always more to learn about leadership, and there is always room for improvement. The best leaders are those who are constantly striving to grow and develop. Thank you for reading üìö ‚ù§Ô∏è üôè

Friday evening we begin the holiday of Shemini Atzeres. Shemini means ‚Äúeighth,‚Äù and Atzeres means ‚Äústop.‚Äù On this eighth day and last day of the holiday of Sukkos, Hashem asks us to stop. The Sages teach that the holiday of Sukkos has been like a celebration that the King throws for His entire kingdom. At the very end of the festival, all of the guests say their goodbyes and head home. But the King detains His beloved children and says ‚Äú◊ß÷∏◊©◊Å÷∏◊î ◊¢÷∏◊ú÷∑◊ô ◊§÷º÷∞◊®÷µ◊ì÷∑◊™÷∞◊õ÷∂◊ù, ◊¢÷∑◊õ÷º÷∞◊ë◊ï÷º ◊¢◊ï÷π◊ì ◊ô◊ï÷π◊ù ◊ê÷∂◊ó÷∏◊ì/Your departure is difficult for me; stay one more day‚Äù (Rashi on Numbers 29:26). The Sages teach that from this we learn how precious we are to Hashem. But the Lubavitcher Rebbe takes the lesson further. It is not possible for us to depart from Hashem, the Rebbe notes, because He is One and everywhere. Therefore, wherever we go, He is there and thus there is never a departure. What does it mean, then, when He tells us that our departure is difficult for Him? What is difficult for Hashem, the Rebbe teaches, is that we BELIEVE that we are departing from Him. We are not conscious of His infinite Oneness, and therefore we suppose that it is possible to be distant from His presence. If so, then what good will one additional day do? If we have not come to understand Hashem‚Äôs unity by now, then how will one more day help? But this additional day of Shemini Atzeres is no ordinary day. It is a ‚Äú◊ô◊ï÷π◊ù ◊ê÷∂◊ó÷∏◊ì/yom echad/a day of Oneness‚Äù when we will stop and focus all of our energies on internalizing the reality of Hashem‚Äôs absolute unity. Afterwards, though we leave the palace and go on our way, there will be no departure because we will understand that there is nowhere we can go where He is not. To take it one step further, the Rebbe teaches that Hashem‚Äôs statement ‚Äúyour departure is difficult for me‚Äù refers not only to our departure from Him - for as we have seen, we cannot ever truly depart from Him. Rather, what is difficult for Hashem is our distance and separation from ONE ANOTHER. ‚Äú◊§÷º÷∞◊®÷µ◊ì÷∑◊™÷∞◊õ÷∂◊ù/pridaschem‚Äù means not only ‚Äúyour departure,‚Äù but your division, or divisiveness. The acrimony and conflict among His children pains Hashem deeply. He therefore implores us to remain together one more day in order to meditate on our inherent indivisibility. It is time for us to stop - to stop fighting with one another, to stop focusing on our differences, to stop and listen to one another and realize that though we may have diverse ideas, stories, and beliefs, we have far more in common than we imagine or admit. On Shemini Atzeres, we stop and contemplate our Universal singularity. Afterwards, we join hands and dance together on Simchas Torah in circles. We dance this way because the circle has no head and no tail, no leader and no follower. We dance as one because this is the ultimate lesson that the Torah was given to teach us: that G-d is One, that we are one, and that our very purpose is to go forth from the King‚Äôs palace and spread the awareness of this Oneness throughout the entire creation. - Derived from Pnei Hashem, an introduction to the deepest depths of the human experience based on the esoteric teachings of Torah. www.pneihashem.com

On this day on October 6, 1973, as Israel was observing what‚Äôs considered the holiest day on the Jewish calendar, Egypt and Syria jointly launched surprise attacks on Israel, igniting the Yom Kippur War. After suffering major losses in the first week of fighting, Israel would ultimately emerge victorious by the end of the 19-day conflict, but it came at a heavy price. The war claimed the lives of nearly 2,700 Israeli soldiers and proved a national trauma still felt to this day.

text: The very 1st prophecy in the Bible is at Genesis 3:15. ‚û• Genesis 3:15 " I will put enmity between you and the woman, and between your offspring and her offspring. He will bruise your head, and you will bruise his heel." This "enmity" between the serpent & the Woman plays out in Revelation 12." The serpent bruised Christ's heel by killing Him on His 1st Coming. The wound was temporary however with Christ's resurrection! Christ will bruise the serpent in the head when the serpent is cast into the Lake of Fire at the end of His 1,000 year reign at Revelation 20:10. Post Content Summary: (scriptures listed below) ‚û• Revelation 20:7-10 - Serpent bruised in the head by destruction in the lake of fire. ‚û• Ezekiel 39:11-13 - Serpent (Gog) bruised in the head by death and burial! ‚û• Revelation 12 - Serpents conflict with the Woman & her seed during Christ's 2nd Coming. ‚û• Genesis 3 - The 1st Prophecy! ---------------- Serpent bruised in the head by destruction in the lake of fire. ‚û• Revelation 20:7-10 7 And when the thousand years are ended, Satan will be released from his prison 8 and will come out to deceive the nations that are at the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them for battle; their number is like the sand of the sea. 9 And they marched up over the broad plain of the earth and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city, but fire came down from heaven and consumed them, 10 and the devil who had deceived them was thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur where the beast and the false prophet were, and they will be tormented day and night forever and ever. Same event described in Ezekiel 38-39. Gog (the Serpent) gets a burial! ‚û• Ezekiel 39:11-13 11 "On that day I will give to Gog a place for burial in Israel, the Valley of the Travelers, east of the sea. It will block the travelers, for there Gog and all his multitude will be buried. It will be called the Valley of Hamon-gog. 12 For seven months the house of Israel will be burying them, in order to cleanse the land. 13 All the people of the land will bury them, and it will bring them renown on the day that I show my glory, declares the Lord GOD. ---------------- Serpents conflict with the Woman & her seed during Christ's 2nd Coming. ‚û• Revelation 12 (ESV) 1 And a great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars. 2 She was pregnant and was crying out in birth pains and the agony of giving birth. 3 And another sign appeared in heaven: behold, a great red dragon, with seven heads and ten horns, and on his heads seven diadems. 4 His tail swept down a third of the stars of heaven and cast them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was about to give birth, so that when she bore her child he might devour it. 5 She gave birth to a male child, one who is to rule all the nations with a rod of iron, but her child was caught up to God and to his throne, 6 and the woman fled into the wilderness, where she has a place prepared by God, in which she is to be nourished for 1,260 days. Satan Thrown Down to Earth 7 Now war arose in heaven, Michael and his angels fighting against the dragon. And the dragon and his angels fought back, 8 but he was defeated, and there was no longer any place for them in heaven. 9 And the great dragon was thrown down, that ancient serpent, who is called the devil and Satan, the deceiver of the whole world--he was thrown down to the earth, and his angels were thrown down with him. 10 And I heard a loud voice in heaven, saying, "Now the salvation and the power and the kingdom of our God and the authority of his Christ have come, for the accuser of our brothers has been thrown down, who accuses them day and night before our God. 11 And they have conquered him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony, for they loved not their lives even unto death. 12 Therefore, rejoice, O heavens and you who dwell in them! But woe to you, O earth and sea, for the devil has come down to you in great wrath, because he knows that his time is short!" 13 And when the dragon saw that he had been thrown down to the earth, he pursued the woman who had given birth to the male child. 14 But the woman was given the two wings of the great eagle so that she might fly from the serpent into the wilderness, to the place where she is to be nourished for a time, and times, and half a time. 15 The serpent poured water like a river out of his mouth after the woman, to sweep her away with a flood. 16 But the earth came to the help of the woman, and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed the river that the dragon had poured from his mouth. 17 Then the dragon became furious with the woman and went off to make war on the rest of her offspring, on those who keep the commandments of God and hold to the testimony of Jesus. And he stood on the sand of the sea. ---------------- The 1st Prophecy! ‚û• Genesis 3 (WEB) 1 Now the serpent was more (truncated)

As people-pleasers, kissing butt, conforming to their peers, never allowing themselves to conflict with others, refusing to question or critique, not once daring to be "different", going with the dumbed-down flow, smiling while stifling their true selves -- they desperately wanted to fit in. MY EX, MY PAST (I MARRIED MY EX) By Adebowale Olaoye. 1B Fola's love for Christ was unwavering, but she also yearned for a husband. She had attended countless Christian singles' events, relationship group meetings, grasped the principles of healthy relationships, fasted, and prayed diligently. Yet, no man seemed willing to commit to her. She felt the weight of her age, especially when her mother called and questioned when she would bring a man home. The pressure had led her to settle for Gbenga, a known womanizer who was now pressuring her for sex, as if their entire relationship hinged on it. Gbenga believed he had made significant efforts. He had followed her severally in name of attending church, but he lacked the commitment to a devout Christian life. He simply wasn't ready for the perceived monotony of a born-again lifestyle. Their relationship had become a battleground over the issue, and, as usual, Gbenga had prevailed. Fola had reluctantly allowed intimacy to enter their relationship, and he had left her feeling empty once more, emotionally and physically. In the wake of their encounter, Fola grappled with a mix of emotions. She still longed for a husband, but Gbenga's actions had left her questioning whether he was the right man to fulfill that desire. As she sat alone, tears welled up in her eyes, and she wondered if there was more to life than this tumultuous relationship. She pondered whether she should continue down this path or muster the strength to break free and find the love and commitment she truly deserved. The uncertainty weighed her down as days turned into weeks, and Fola found herself in a constant state of internal conflict. She knew she deserved better than the rollercoaster ride she was on with Gbenga. Her faith in God remained unshaken, but her faith in the future of their relationship had eroded. As she attended church services, she sought solace in her prayers, desperately seeking guidance and God's forgiveness. Fola had always believed in the power of prayers. Gbenga's thoughts were also in turmoil. He realized that he had paid a price for his actions, not just in the strained relationship with Fola, but also in his own inner turmoil. His desire for physical intimacy had driven a wedge between them, and he had begun to question the emptiness that followed each encounter. One evening, after a particularly heated argument with Fola, Gbenga found himself alone in his apartment. The echoes of their words still rang in his ears. He knew he had to confront his own demons and decide whether he wanted to continue down this destructive path. As for Fola, she found strength in her faith and the support of her church community. She decided to have a heart-to-heart conversation with Gbenga, one last attempt to salvage their relationship. She longed for a love that was built on trust, commitment, and mutual respect. Their future remained uncertain, but both Gbenga and Fola stood at a crossroads, each grappling with their own desires, doubts, and the possibility of redemption. TO BE CONTINUED! Don't be a silent reader, comment, like and share.

text: Akram and Joumana are Meadow Heights residents who came to Australia as a result of conflict and persecution in Syria and have made such a positive contribution to our community, including through organisations like Zenobia. They operate a fantastic business, Trio Pastry Sweets And Nuts, on Lygon St Carlton. It received such a great review in today‚Äôs Herald Sun, I had to pop in to collect some delicious Syrian sweets for the office on the way back to Greenvale from Parliament!

ùëæùíâùíÇùíï ùíäùíî ùë∑ùíÇùíìùíÜùíèùíïùíäùíáùíäùíÑùíÇùíïùíäùíêùíè?
Parentification is sometimes known as "growing up too fast." It typically occurs when a youngster assumes parental duty for their siblings or even their parents, physically, intellectually, or emotionally caring for a sibling or parent. This can harm a child's mental health and lead to long-term mental health issues like depression and anxiety. 

Parentification occurs when children provide physical and emotional care that exceeds their developmental abilities and capability.

ùòåùòÆùò∞ùòµùò™ùò∞ùòØùò¢ùò≠ ùòóùò¢ùò≥ùò¶ùòØùòµùò™ùòßùò™ùò§ùò¢ùòµùò™ùò∞ùòØ
When parents push their emotional demands on their children and seek emotional and mental support from them, this is referred to as emotional parentification. Emotional parentification is thought to be the more complex and difficult for the child of the two forms.

ùòóùò¢ùò≥ùò¶ùòØùòµùò¢ùò≠ ùòêùòØùò¥ùòµùò≥ùò∂ùòÆùò¶ùòØùòµùò¢ùòµùò™ùò∞ùòØ 
Instrumental parentification is comparable to emotional parentification and frequently occurs together. Instead of solely attending to their parents' emotional needs, children who engage in instrumental parentification are assigned jobs and obligations that are inappropriate for their age group. This could include food shopping, meal preparation, bill payment, caring for sick siblings or parents, and other activities.

ùôãùôñùôßùôöùô£ùô©ùô® ùôñùôßùôö ùô™ùô°ùô©ùôûùô¢ùôñùô©ùôöùô°ùôÆ ùôûùô£ ùôòùôùùôñùôßùôúùôö
While we wish to give our children more responsibilities, parents remain in charge. The children do not make the final decisions. Because parents have the final say, the weight of the decision and its implications falls on the adult, not the child, even if the child is a teenager. Children should be permitted to express their ideas and opinions, but they are not the head of the household.

ùôÜùôûùôôùô® ùôñùôßùôö ùô©ùôùùôöùôûùôß ùô§ùô¨ùô£ ùô•ùôöùôßùô®ùô§ùô£
We nurture our children to become adults. If parents build co-dependent connections with their children to the point where children are expected to never leave or accomplish everything required of them, they will be unable to be themselves. If children believe they cannot be themselves, they will undoubtedly take on the burden of other people's sentiments.

ùôãùôñùôßùôöùô£ùô©ùô® ùôñùôßùôö ùô•ùôñùôßùôöùô£ùô©ùô®, ùô£ùô§ùô© ùôõùôßùôûùôöùô£ùôôùô® 
A child's bond with his or her parents is unique. You may want them to disclose all of their secrets so you can help them, but that can't happen if you're disclosing stuff you shouldn't. There are a few issues you should probably avoid discussing with your child as if they were your best friend, such as a marital problem. This is not to say that parents should not be honest and vulnerable, but if a child does not believe their parent can take care of themselves emotionally, it will be difficult to believe they will be taken care of as a child.

Parentification, or children taking on parental roles and responsibilities, is a difficult topic to discuss because cultural standards vary even within the same country. Furthermore, some families have situations or just function in ways that need children to take on additional tasks. Parents and carers are sometimes simply doing what they know or need to do to survive.

Parentification trauma refers to the detrimental impact that parentification can have on a child. It most commonly arises when a youngster is expected to take on the job of a parent without the appropriate assistance or resources to do so effectively.

ùôãùôñùôßùôöùô£ùô©ùôûùôõùôûùôòùôñùô©ùôûùô§ùô£ ùôéùôÆùô¢ùô•ùô©ùô§ùô¢ùô®
Symptoms differ depending on the situation. The symptoms will be more severe if the case of parentification is severe. Among the most common symptoms are:
‚Ä¢  Stress and anxiety 
‚Ä¢  Stomachaches or headaches 
‚Ä¢  Aggression 
‚Ä¢  Academic troubles 
‚Ä¢  Social difficulties 
‚Ä¢  Trouble maintaining friendships 
‚Ä¢  Inability to enjoy age-appropriate activities 
‚Ä¢  Neglect of their own needs and feelings 
‚Ä¢  Feelings of self-blame and self-doubt 
‚Ä¢  Anger and depression over the loss of childhood in teenagers and adults 
‚Ä¢  Substance abuse 

Other indicators of parentification include serving as a mediator between parents, receiving compliments from strangers on being mature or responsible, hesitating to express emotions owing to fear of a parent's reaction, and feeling emotionally mature than a parent.

ùôãùôñùôßùôöùô£ùô©ùôûùôõùôûùôòùôñùô©ùô§ùô£ ùòæùôñùô™ùô®ùôöùô®
A child is typically parentified when a parent is unable to fulfil their own function as a parental figure for a variety of reasons. Among these causes are:
‚Ä¢  Divorce 
‚Ä¢  Chronic illness, disability, or a death in the family 
‚Ä¢  Alcoholism or drug addiction 
‚Ä¢  Physical or mental abuse by a partner 
‚Ä¢  Sexually predatory tendencies (sometimes directed at the child) 
‚Ä¢  Immaturity, emotional unavailability, or (truncated)

I searched previous posts in our group before posting this. I would like to get some advice, and/ or perspectives in case this happens to me. - A friend of mine got hit by a car, he flew off onto the car window. - The driver was very sorry, said that he is also a cyclist, etc. so they could exchange driving licenses and contacted ICBC about that and told my friend not to worry. - 2 other cyclists and 1 pedestrian stopped to check on my friend and offered witnessing. My friend who was dazed at that moment did the worst thing - he told witnesses that he would be fine and he didn't take their contact info. My friend said the driver seemed like a good man so he thought it's unnecessary. - My friend reported to ICBC in case of injury. He felt the pain but powered through and tried to move on cause he said nothing broken. - My friend received the bill from ICBC of $3k++ with the reason that he suddenly cut into the car lane with no shoulders check and cause the broken windshield of the car. - My friend said it's not the case: he did check the behind - the car was far behind, made hand signal, finished the merging, stopped in the lane waiting as previous cars cause the red light was on; it's the driver that was speedy and didnt stopped on time. - ICBC said my friend was getting into the car lane so he had to make sure it's safe to do so - by default he was seen as cutting in front of the car improperly. Unless he can prove he did turn back to check. The fact that my friend waived witnesses was so ignorant. But I struggle to understand ICBC conclusion and how it can be the verdict. Is it conflict of interest when ICBC makes decision that is beneficial to them and force the other side to prove otherwise? If it were me, I don't have $3++k to give out. Especially if I were the victim, I would feel helpless, angry and depressed from the unjustice. What a cyclist can do in this case to help themselves? Or paying is the only choice? (My friend is also a driver having car insurance with ICBC, he believes ICBC would force him to pay in order to renew his insurance.) Thank you in advance for all your advices.

üì£OPEN CALL FOR YOUNG PEOPLE FROM SERBIA AND KOSOVOüì£ üóûÔ∏èLiving in countries where we see headlines full of hate speech, war mongering and division, especially after recent violent paramilitary activities in Kosovo, the program ‚ÄúFrom Conflict to Reconciliation - Stories of Young People from Serbia and Kosovo‚Äù provides a safe space where young people can work together towards a more peaceful future. The program ‚ÄúFrom Conflict to Reconciliation - Stories of Young People from Serbia and Kosovo‚Äù will give the opportunity to young people to share their experiences, perspectives and narratives they grew up with, and ones they are still fighting against in their own communities. The program will be held in Belgradeüìç, from October 27th to November 2nd, 2023. During those seven days, the participants will have the opportunity to learn more about storytelling, peacebuilding, and the concept of interculturalism, as well as to improve their presentation skills. Through intercultural dialogue, this program aims to empower young people to take a more active role in dealing with the past and reconciliation processes. ü§ùüèº üîóLearn more and apply here: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdtUz9ms4L3GDBWY7-oaqXR7CPWCge9STolBAovOt7l2N1Xew/viewform:=:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdtUz9ms4L3GDBWY7-oaqXR7CPWCge9STolBAovOt7l2N1Xew/viewform?usp=embed_facebook *Funded by the European Union

National Endowment for Democracy (NED). ___ ‚†Ä üí≠ ‚ÄúIn my books, people‚Äôs voices come alive. That was my primary mission when I went to Rwanda to collect stories. I had to hear each and every one of them,‚Äù said Polish reporter Wojciech Tochman. ‚†Ä Lviv, October 5. Together with the publishing house Choven and the Ye Bookstore we organized a presentation of the Ukrainian edition of Wojciech Tochman‚Äôs book Today We‚Äôll Draw Death, translated by Andrii Bondar. The event was moderated by Olena Sheremet, who translates Polish literary reportage into Ukrainian. ‚†Ä Rwanda, April 6, 1994. In the post-colonial African country where two nations with a complicated history coexist ‚Äì the Tutsis and Hutus ‚Äì the head of state dies in an airplane crash. This marked the beginning of a genocide in which millions of people perished. Wojciech Tochman returned to this African country many times to understand how, after what happened there, people could live together. He spoke with survivors, perpetrators, and witnesses. ‚†Ä During the presentation, the author was asked why he thought the conflict had started. Here‚Äôs what Tochman replied, ‚ÄúCommunities are forged by relationships. When these relationships become unhealthy, they are often left untreated. People do not wish to kill one another. However, when, under the influence of certain circumstances, a person views others as terrifying or wrong entities, they become ready to annihilate.‚Äù ‚†Ä After the genocide and civil war in Rwanda, yesterday‚Äôs perpetrators and their victims live side by side and seek common ground. You can ride a bus or stand in line for groceries, and the person next to you may be a killer. Is forgiveness possible? ‚†Ä ‚ÄúForgiveness is the most complex of human arts. It is very private. And I believe that no survivor is obligated to forgive,‚Äù said Wojciech Tochman. ‚†Ä During the presentation, attendees had the opportunity to talk with the reporter, purchase books, and get autographs. Thanks to Iryna Sereda for the photos. Syed Mohammad Altaf Bukhari pays obeisance at Asar-e-Sharif Dargah, offers Friday congregational prayer at the revered shrine Srinagar, October 6: Apni Party President Syed Mohammad Altaf Bukhari paid his obeisance at Asar-e-Sharif Hazratbal today to offer Friday prayers at the revered place. He was accompanied by the senior party leaders including party General Secretary Rafi Ahmad Mir, Provincial President Kashmir Mohammad Ashraf Mir, Spokesperson and State Secretary Muntazir Mohiuddin, Senior Leader and Chairman DDC Srinagar Malik Aftab. Apni Party President was warmly greeted by the shrine administration upon his arrival at the revered shrine. Besides offering Friday prayers, he took stock of the facilities provided to the devotees and worshippers at the holy shrine, a press note said. While engaging with the people at the dargah, Syed Mohammad Altaf Bukhari requested that they pray for sustained peace and prosperity in Jammu and Kashmir. He remarked, ‚ÄúThe people of Jammu and Kashmir have endured significant suffering over the past three decades due to the prolonged conflict. Even today, people continue to grapple with political uncertainty and economic challenges, including rising unemployment and inflation. It is our collective responsibility to work towards lasting peace in this region, as only enduring peace can pave the way for the prosperity and development of this land. I urge you to pray for peace, tranquillity, and harmony in Jammu and Kashmir.‚Äù

What is the main purpose of Executive Order No 70 NTF-ELCAC?
The National Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict (NTF-ELCAC) is a task force organized by the government of the Philippines to respond and raise awareness to the ongoing communist rebellion in the Philippines.

Attention all quilt lovers! The Heritage Center is celebrating the late Nancy Roan (1932-2023) with an exhibit of her handmade quilts titled "A Loving Tribute to a Quiltie Lady: The Quilts of Nancy Roan" on view now until April 14 in the Putera Meeting Room on the first floor. Nancy made many quilts, including bed-sized quilts and wall hangings, over her many decades as a quilter‚Äîsome based on traditional designs while others were more contemporary and whimsical. Her quilts were definitely a product of her extraordinary creativity and sense of humor. Nancy worked hard to preserve Pennsylvania Dutch culture through recording the ‚Äúold ways‚Äù of cooking and quilting and as a stalwart member of the Goschenhoppen Historians. Join us for this delightful journey through Nancy‚Äôs quilting life!üëâPLEASE NOTE: the reception scheduled for the exhibit on Sunday, October 8 is postponed due to a scheduling conflict. Image: WPA Coxcomb bed-sized quilt made by Nancy Roan, Heritage Center Collection.

text: Hey Gang! It's me! And have I got some EXCITING news. I am so fan-girling right now, I don't know if I can get it out. Joining the city as a brand new department director -- that's how important this job is -- I am proud to present: the former superintendent of Columbia Public Schools! Squee! "Thank you, Madam Mayor. I couldn't be more thrilled. Columbia is such a wonderful town!" I know you're all dying to know, what department will he direct? Utilities? No. Personnel? BORing. Nope. Police? Oh, hell no. Our new director will take charge of the most important city function of all: the newly-created Department of Niceness! He will review everyday activities, documenting their coefficient of nicety. Like: Was that City Council commenter NICE when she spoke against the huge electric rate hike we just passed? Was the police association NICE when it asked for ARPA money? And then got mad cuz no funds for them! Is it NICE for voters to challenge a Council member over a conflict of interest? And all these emails about robberies and shootings -- I mean, really people? -- are these emails NICE? I'm reading them now and -- well Director? What do you think? "Oh, dear. Oh dear. So sad, all that meanness. Reminds me of -- school board meetings during Covid." The Niceness Director will also be revising some of our city ordinances. Like changing "must stop at Stop Sign" to "SHOULD stop at Stop Sign." It's the new "stoptional" approach many cities are adopting to combat institutional oppression. Now onto your podcast plug! "Thank you, Mayor. As everyone knows, I host the 'Imperfect Leader' podcast. Because all leaders ARE imperfect." Hmm? What? I'm not imperfect. "Of course you are." I am NOT imperfect. "Are too." School superintendents might be imperfect. But Mayors, as I learned at Harvard, are certainly not. "Are too!" You wanna see imperfect? I'll show you imperfect! Just give me -- Hold it. What are you writing? What's that? "A citation for superintendent shaming. Ordering you to appear before the new Columbia Commission on the Creation of Safe Spaces for Management. I'm the city staff liaison." #FridayFunnies #columbiamo #cpsbest #como

Join the public paranormal investigation of the historic Murney Tower in Kingston, Ontario Canada from the comfort of home. Murney Tower was built in 1846 in response to the Oregon Crisis, a time when tension between the Crown and the USA was building, however once the Tower was completed the conflict was over. Prior to the Fort, there was a Fort from the War of 1812 in this land, post war, the barracks was used as a hospital. A lot of history here and many paranormal experiences, a white mist, a lady in white, a soldier guarding the passage to the cannon room. A great site to investigate! Watch, listen and tag any anomalies! #haunted #paranormal #history #military #ghosthunting

In line with the Celebration of Indigenous Peoples‚Äô Month, the Ministry of Indigenous Peoples‚Äô Affairs through the Special Public Assistance and Legal Aid Division (SPALAD) and in collaboration with the SUBATRA, successfully conducted a Paralegal Training Workshop on Basic Legal Process in the Regular Court and Capability Enhancement of Tribal Leaders Elders in the Traditional or Tribal Justice System on October 5, 2023, at Special Geographic Area (SGA), which was participated by 50 Tribal Leaders from Arumanen Manubo Tribe. The activity aims to educate the Tribal Leaders on the Basic Legal Processes in the mainstream and enhance their capability in Conflict Resolution. It also aims to harmonize the mainstream and customary processes in settling disputes between and among IPs. In the said activity, the participants were taught on how to document the proceedings in conflict resolution using customary laws as well as drafting of amicable settlement. The participants conveyed their heartfelt gratitude to the Ministry as they were able to learn a lot from the said activity and they had have been equipped with the necessary knowledge which they could be used in settling disputes effectively.
username: Ministry of Indigenous Peoples' Affairs - BARMM

text: Kalaban ng kapayapaan at kalaban ng bayan ang mga kritko ng confidential fund. Ito ang buwelta ni Vice President Sara Duterte sa kaniyang mga kritiko na bumabatikos sa confidential fund na kaniyang inihihirit sa Kongreso. Sa ika-122 anibersaryo ng Police Service sa Agusan Provincial Police Office (PPO) sa Camp Rafael Rodriguez, Butuan City, binigyang diin ni VP Sara na ang mga kritiko ng confidential fund ay maituturing na tutol sa kapayapaan at kaayusan. Dahil dito, sinabi ng pangalawang pangulo na ang mga ayaw sa kapayapaan at kaayusan ay malinaw na kumakalaban sa estado kaya‚Äôt dapat silang ituring na kalaban ng bayan. ‚ÄúMakinig kayo sa lahat ng sinasabi sa palibot ninyo at tandaan ninyo, kung sino man kumokontra sa confidential funds ay kumokontra sa kapayapaan. Kung sino ang kumokontra sa kapayaan ay kalaban ng bayan.‚Äù saad ni Duterte. Giit pa ng bise presidente na kailangang bigyan ng ibayong pansin ang Kapayapaan at Kaayusan dahil dito aangkla ang pagkakaroon ng kaunlaran at maayos na edukasyon sa mga kabataan. Maliban sa pagiging Department of Education (DepEd) Secretary, nagsisilbi ring co-Vice Chairperson ng National Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict (NTF-ELCAC) si VP Sara. üì∏SENATE PRIB

(Voor NL zie onder)

Pani Dorota i pan Jeffrey opowiadali nam o tym, na czym polega ich praca i z jakimi problemami i w jakich sytuacjach mo≈ºna siƒô do nich zwracaƒá. Tu mo≈ºna zwr√≥ciƒá siƒô do niego o pomoc, np. gdy potrzebujemy mediatora w konflikcie z sƒÖsiadem lub gdy czujemy siƒô bezradni w obliczu niekt√≥rych problem√≥w wychowawczych zwiƒÖzanych z naszymi dzieƒámi. Jednym s≈Çowem dzielnicowy jest przede wszystkim po to, aby pomagaƒá, a nie jedynie nadzorowaƒá i pouczaƒá!
By≈Ço te≈º mn√≥stwo praktycznych pyta≈Ñ dotyczƒÖcych meldowania wykrocze≈Ñ, zak≈Ç√≥cania spokoju przez uciƒÖ≈ºliwych sƒÖsiad√≥w czy miejscowych zasad parkowania. Jednym s≈Çowem: bardzo udane spotkanie! 

üá≥üá±We hebben deze week zeer interessante gasten bij POLKA gehad! Bij ons nieuwe filiaal in Vrouwenbuurtlab kregen we bezoek van twee wijkagenten die in Laak werkzaam zijn. Dorota en Jeffrey vertelden ons wat hun werk inhoudt en met welke problemen en situaties ze benaderd kunnen worden. Het blijkt dat de rol van een wijkagent in Nederland heel anders is dan wat wij met deze functie in Polen associ√´ren! Hier kunnen ze bijvoorbeeld benaderd worden wanneer we een bemiddelaar nodig hebben in een conflict met een buurman of wanneer we ons hulpeloos voelen bij sommige opvoedingsproblemen met onze kinderen. 
Kortom, de wijkagent is er vooral om te helpen, niet alleen om toezicht te houden en aangeven wat wel en wat niet mag.

Er waren ook veel praktische vragen over het melden van overtredingen, overlast door buren of parkeren. Kortom: een zeer geslaagde bijeenkomst!,

En conflict binnen of buiten onszelf een tijdje laten zijn in plaats van te proberen het snel op te lossen kan een uitdaging zijn. Als we echter de spanning tussen de twee tegengestelde krachten toe kunnen laten kan er een derde weg ontstaan die de twee kan verenigen en overstijgen. Jung geloofde dat deze transcendente kracht cruciaal is voor onze heelwording. De derde manier komt echter meestal als een verrassing omdat ze niet eerder onze verdediging kon binnendringen. Een overhaaste beweging om spanning los te laten kan wel de groei van het nog niet bekende derde alternatief in de weg staan. Maar als we lang genoeg de spanning kunnen laten rijpen in onze psychische baarmoeder, kunnen we letterlijk iets nieuws in onszelf baren. ¬© Marion Woodman Jungiaanse therapeute en auteur üß°

"Parental alienation is a mental state in which a child‚Äîusually one whose parents are engaged in a high-conflict separation or divorce‚Äîallies strongly with 1 parent (the offending, but favored parent) and rejects a relationship with the other parent (the alienated parent) without legitimate reason.1 This condition occurs in the context of a maladaptive family dynamic involving at least 3 individuals: the alienating parent, who intentionally and purposefully manipulates the child to reject the other parent; the child, who experiences parental alienation; and the rejected, alienated parent. A variety of tactics and maneuvers are used by alienating parents to achieve their goal, ranging from bad-mouthing and disruption of visitation time to false allegations of abuse and criminal charges." This is excerpt from an article in Psychiatric Times. It outlines exactly what my wife has done to my kids and me for the past 4 years. Because of this, I have not seen my kids for over 4 years. I used to be the one that showed up to all their practices/games, took them out walking/hiking/swimming, etc. I even got a job at the school, so I could be with them. I was their teacher/coach/motivator. Most of all, Father and Dad. I love and miss them so much. üòûüíî

BATSWANA IMPLORED TO DISCUSS ON DRUG RELATED PROBLEMS The Drug Enforcement Agency Coordinator, Ms Pearl Ramokoka has implored on Batswana to discuss drug related issues openly. Ms Ramokoka made the appeal at the University of Botswana Counselling Day commemoration organized by the University‚Äôs Careers and Counselling Centre. The day which was themed ‚ÄúDrug-Free Life: A Journey of Millions‚Äô Support #Recovery is Possible was to sensitise the students on dangers of illicit drug use. In her keynote address, Ms Ramokoka raised concern that mental health is not a subject matter that is regularly discussed by the society. ‚ÄúMental health is not normally discussed amongst families, friends, church, at social events and communities in general. More often than not, if and when we discuss mental health, it is usually from a negative perspective, due to stigma that surrounds the subject matter.‚Äù Ms Ramokoka added that, ‚Äôwe take mental health as a self-care and private matter. As a result, opening up about our emotional state is not easy in our society as it is regarded as a weakness. That should not be the case. I am indeed happy that today we are celebrating mental health in a positive and relaxed environment‚Äô‚Äô. She urged Batswana to talk to their family members when they have drug problems and mental issues. ‚ÄúIf you are challenged by the drug related problems, please, seek counselling to get a professional help. As students do not to be ashamed or embarrassed to seek for help from professionals. It is a positive step that will get you out of this devilish situation.‚Äù According to Ms Ramokoka there is a need for mind-set change in the discussions that concern drug related issues. ‚Äò‚ÄôWe need to think differently, and we need to change how we have been doing things. Let us learn to discuss issues even when there are no problems so that we sustain good behaviour‚Äô‚Äô. Ms Ramokoka added that choosing to take drugs and alcohol is an unhealthy decision as drugs will only mask your problems and they will even create more problems to one‚Äôs life. She further highlighted that Drugs change the chemistry of the brain and the body to alter moods, emotions, and behaviors and perceptions, and impacting on how individuals relate with the world around them. ‚Äò‚ÄôDrugs can make you a person you are not, they affect your brain, respiratory, blood pressure, your heart and your health in general, they also affect your finances. Drugs also put you to be in conflict with the law as it is illegal to possess drugs. #ASecureNation #BWMindsetChange
username: Ministry Of Defence and Security, Botswana

MAPANLINLANG NA TAKTIKA AT PROPAGANDA NG CPP-NPA-NDF, NAIBUNYAG NA! 

Inilantad ni Genelyn Dichoso, dating Secretary General ng Karapatan Quezon, ang mga estratehiya ng Karapatan Quezon kung paano ito gumawa ng mga propaganda para isalba ang kanilang mga kasamahan.  Ayon pa sa kanya, kung may nahuhuli naman na NPA, gagawa ang tagapagsalita ng Karapatan na sila ay mga organizers ng kababaihan, kabataan, at mga legal na organisasyon o kung ano man ang mga legal na gawain sa barangay. Palalabasin nila na ito ay legal. Si Genelyn ay mahigit 20 years ng naglingkod at ginamit ng CPP-NPA-NDF.
Tayo'y magkaisa upang mapigilan ang paglaganap ng mga mapanlinlang na propaganda at taktika ng mga teroristang grupo.

Panoorin ang buong Tagged Reloaded Presscon:

IN PHOTOS: Nagdaos ng isang oryentasyon ukol sa Executive Order No. 70 ang Bureau of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources CALABARZON, katuwang ang Department of Interior and Local Government (DILG) bilang tagapagpaliwanag sa nasabing paksa, para sa mga Focal Person mula sa mga Provincial Fisheries Offices ng kawanihan. Ito ay isinagawa sa BFAR 4A Training noong ika-4 ng Oktubre kung saan ito ay nilahukan din ng mga officer-in-charge at hepe ng iba't ibang opisina sa BFAR 4A. Ang Executive Order No. 70 na pinamagatang 'Institutionalizing the Whole-of-Nation Approach in Attaining Inclusive and Sustainable Peace, Creating a National Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict (ELCAC), and Directing the Adoption of a National Peace Framework' ay naglalayong magbigay ng komprehensibong pangkalahatang-ideya ukol sa tungkulin ng National Task Force, at maisagawa ang National Peace Framework. Ang nasabing oryentasyon ay isinagawa sa pangunguna ni Regional Focal Person for ELCAC Josefina R. Tolentino.

ùóõùóÆùòÑùó∂ùó∞ùó∏ ùóÆùóªùó± ùòÅùóµùó≤ ùóôùóÆùóπùó∏ùóπùóÆùóªùó±ùòÄ ùó™ùóÆùóø (ùóΩùóÆùó∂ùóøùòÅ ùòÅùòÑùóÆùó≤): ùó¢ùóΩùó≤ùóøùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùó£ùóÆùóøùóÆùóæùòÇùó≤ùòÅ üá´üá∞ The BAFTA-winning BBC film An Ungentlemanly Act (1992), a faithful recreation of the first 36 hours of the Falklands War, carries the tagline: ‚ÄúIn war, it is the personal stories that have the most impact.‚Äù Indeed, over the next few weeks we‚Äôll be looking at some key moments in the conflict through the eyes of those who were actually there. Our first story begins 870 miles east of the Falklands, on the remote, mountainous, snow-covered British Overseas Territory of South Georgia and the Sandwich Islands. Its ‚Äòcapital‚Äô is the smallest in the world ‚Äì the British Antarctic Survey (BAS) research station at King Edward Point, on the north-eastern coast of South Georgia, which has a permanent population of 22 scientists. In 1978, a contract was agreed between an Argentine business and Christian Salvesen, for the removal of an abandoned whaling station on the island at Grytviken, the burial place of polar explorers Sir Ernest Shackleton and Frank Wild. Two trips involving scrap merchants were made in the period December 1981 to March 1982 to assess the facilities there. However, little did the BAS realise that Argentine marines had infiltrated the working party, posing as scientists. On March 19, 1982 ‚Äì two weeks prior to the war proper ‚Äì the ‚Äòmetal workers‚Äô arrived at Leith Harbour without landing clearance and raised the Argentine flag. A formal protest was issued by the British embassy in Buenos Aires and within days two Argentine corvettes, ARA Drummond and ARA Granville, were deployed to reinforce their position. As a dependency of Falklands, BAS personnel contacted Governor Rex Hunt ‚Äì commander-in-chief and vice-admiral of the islands ‚Äì who dispatched the ice patrol vessel HMS Endurance with 22 Royal Marines. Back in Port Stanley, the famous Falklands War was about to kick off in farcical style. As it happened, a detachment of marine guards under Major Mike Norman had just relieved a similar group of soldiers from Naval Party 8901. Minus the men sent to South Georgia, this left a total of 57 Royal Marines, 25 Falkland Islands Defence Force (FIDF) volunteers, and 11 BAS hydrographers and sailors as the last line of defence against an impending Argentine attack. At 3.30pm, a Foreign Office telegram half-heartedly confirmed with Rex that ‚Äú‚Ä¶an Argentine task force could be assembling off Stanley at dawn tomorrow. You will wish to make your dispositions accordingly.‚Äù Even the local radio station was unsure of the news ‚Äì was this an April Fool‚Äôs joke? The official UK government line was to await a peaceful resolution at the UN. The governor‚Äôs thoughts, though, turned to defending the local population ‚Äì guided by the two majors at his disposal. Documents were shredded and burned, key installations were defended by the FIDF, and marines positioned themselves around Stanley. Rex Hunt, although advised to head for the hills to mount a guerrilla campaign, stood firm: Government House was to be their Alamo. The situation, to say the least, was pretty dire. Molotov cocktails and an array of small arms were brought to the Drill Hall and tactics were formed in the face of teenage volunteers, to prepare for the worst possible outcome. Argentine residents were rounded up and placed into custody at a local hotel. By 11pm, Operation Rosario ‚Äì to recapture the Malvinas ‚Äì was underway. Argentine special naval forces made an amphibious landing south of Stanley, followed by several other landings on nearby beaches. The airfield and the lighthouse were soon captured and, at 5.30am on April 2, the marines‚Äô base at Moody Barracks was destroyed by hand grenades; the invading force, grimly, thought the marines were fast asleep. Two lines of defence were formed at Government House and the Drill Hall. No Man‚Äôs Land comprised absurd obstacles like a tennis court, greenhouses and allotments. The Argentines successfully landed several armoured personnel carriers with heavy weaponry, headed in the direction of the governor ‚Äì one of which was put out of action by the marines. Within a short time, an aircraft carrier and a cruiser arrived off Camber Peninsula. Thought to be pinned down by 200 elite soldiers, the marines were, in fact, opposed by just 16 badly-equipped Argentine commandos with limited radio contact, huddled on a ridge above Government House. Adding to the theatrical nature of it all, at 7.30am, the local police chief had to intercept a Scottish exile, Henry Halliday, who was heading to work in the thick of the battle! Two hours later, faced with inevitable casualties, Governor Hunt agreed to a ceasefire. During the Battle of Government House, one Argentine commando was killed and six were wounded, versus no British casualties. A sweep of the islands was ordered but despite having superior numbers, some ham radio operators escaped the invaders‚Äô attention and relayed vital information back to the UK. (truncated)

Siblings play an important role in our lives, and respecting them is crucial for developing strong, healthy relationships. Respecting your siblings means valuing their thoughts, feelings, and personal space, listening actively, being honest and open in communication, avoiding hurtful comments or behaviors that may cause harm or conflict, giving them privacy when needed, sharing responsibilities and resources fairly, supporting each other during difficult times or celebrating achievements, setting boundaries while respecting individuality within family dynamics. By practicing these values consistently over time frames and situations, siblings can strengthen bonds and create a supportive family environment where everyone feels heard and valued.

CIKAR MAI MARTABA SARKIN ZAZZAU SHEKARU UKU (3) A BISA KARAGAR MULKIN MASARAUTAR ZAZZAU 

-#KASHI Na Daya

A ranan Asabar mai zuwa, 7ga watan Oktoba, 2023 (Rabi'ul Awwal 22, 1445AH), watau nan da kimanin kwanaki Shida (6) idan Allah Ya kaimu Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau,  Malam Dokta Ahmed Nuhu Bamalli, CFR zai cika shekaru uku a bisa karagar Mulkin Masarautan Zazzau a matsayin Sarki na Goma Sha Tara (19) a jerin Sarakunan Fulani wadanda suka mulki Masarautan tun daga Malam Musa.

Malam Ahmed Nuhu Bamalli shine Sarkin Zazzau na Biyar (5) daga zuri'an sa watau, Zuri'an Sarkin Zazzau, Malam Musa Suleiman Bamalli,  Sarki na Farko a Gidan Mallawa wanda ya kawo Tutan jaddada Musulunci a Masarautan Zazzau.

TAKAITTACEN TARIHIN SARKIN ZAZZAU, MALAM AHMED NUHU BAMALLI

Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau yana da nasaba da Gidan Sarautan Zazzau ta bangarori Biyu ne watau "Walki da Nono". Kai tsaye ya zama Sarkin Zazzau ne ta bangaren Walki (Uba) wanda da ita 'Dan Sarki a Zazzau yake zama Sarki.

Shi dai Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau, Malam Ahmed Nuhu Bamalli ya kasance a matsayin 'Da ne na Uku a wajen Mahaifinsa, Marigayi Magajin Garin Zazzau Alhaji Nuhu Bamalli, CFR.  (Biyu daga cikin 'yayensa wanda mahaifinsa ya haifa, Allah Yai masu rasuwa tun kafin a haifeshi).
Marigayi Magajin Garin Zazzau, Malam Nuhu Bamalli mahaifin Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau 'Da ne ga Malam Aliyu Yero Auta, shi kuma Aliyu Yero Auta 'Da ne ga Malam Abubakar Dadda'u, a inda Malam Abubakar Dadda'u kuma ya kasance 'Da ne ga Sarkin Zazzau Malam Musa Suleiman Bamalli wanda ya kawo Tutan jaddada Musulunci a Masarautan Zazzau kuma shi ne ya hassasa Gidan Sarautan Mallawa a Zazzau.

An haifi Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau, Malam Ahmed Nuhu Bamalli a cikin Birnin Zariya a ranan 8ga Watan Yuni, 1966. Kamar kowanen yaro a kasar Hausa, Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau ya fara Karatun Addinin Musulunci tun daga cikin gidansu da kuma wurin mabanbantan Malumma a kuma mabanbantan Garuruwa watau Garin Zariya da Kaduna.
 Ta bangaren ilimin zamani kuma Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau yayi karatun Firamare (Primary) a Makarantu Guda Uku ne wadanda suka hada da Makaranta Firamare Na Kwarbai wanda a yanzu ake kira Sarki Musa L.G.E.A Primary, School, Zaria sai Makarantan Firamare na Titin Maiduguri a Garin Kaduna ya kuma kamalla Aji Shida a Makarantan Firamare wanda ke Kofar Fadan Zazzau wanda ita ma a yanzu ake kira Makarantan Firamare Sarki Sambo, a shekarar 1978.
Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau, Malam Ahmed Nuhu Bamalli, bayan cin jarrabawan shiga Makarantan gaba da Firamare ya sami shiga shaharriyan kwallejin nan na Kaduna watau Kwallejin Gwamnati ta Kaduna (Government College, Kaduna) daga shekarar 1978 ya zuwa 1983. Ya kamalla karatunsa a wannan kwalleji da kwarewa a Fannin Addabi (Arts) kuma ya kasance Mataimakin Shugaban Daliban Kwallejin (Deputy Head Boy) a shekansa na karshe a wannan makaranta. 

Bayan kammala karatun Sakandare, Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau Malam Ahmed Nuhu Bamalli ya hallarci Jami'ar Ahmadu Bello (ABU) wanda ke Zariya inda yayi karatun Digirin sa na Farko a fannin Shari'a (Law) da na Biyu a kan Harkan Jakadanci da Hulda da Kasashen Waje (International Affairs and Diplomacy). Ya kuma halarci Jami'ar Jihar Enugu inda yai karatun Diploma kan Gudanarwa (Post Graduate Diploma Management).

Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau ya halarci kwasa-kwasai a mabanbantan Cibiyoyin Ilimi na Duniya wadanda suka hada da Jami'ar York na Kasar Ingila inda yai kwas bisa Sassanta Rigingimu (Conflict Resolution) ya kuma halarci wani kwas a  Jagorancin Cibiyoyi (Organisational Leadership) a Jami'ar Oxford. Har ila yau, Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau yana daga cikin 'ya'yan Cibiyan Gudanarwa ta Makarantan Harvard (Harvard Business School)

AIKACE-AIKACEN DA MAI MARTABA SARKIN ZAZZAU YAYI KAFIN ZAMANSA SARKI.

Kafin zamansa Sarkin Zazzau na Goma Sha Tara (19), Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau, Malam Ahmed Nuhu Bamalli, CFR yayi aiki a mabanbantan wurare na tsawon shekaru Talatin (30).

* Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau yayi aiki a cibiyoyin Kudade da Tattalin Arziki (Banking Sector),

** Yayi Aiki a Cibiyoyin Sadarwa (Telecommunications),

*** Yayi kuma aiki a Bangaren Gudanarwa (Public Sector).

Haka nan kuma Mai Martaba Sarkin Zazzau, Malam Ahmed Nuhu Bamalli, CFR ya rike mukamin Magajin Garin Zazzau, Sarauta ta Biyu mafi Daraja a jerin Sarautan 'ya'yan Sarki a Masarautan Zazzau na Tsawon Shekaru Talatin Da Tara (39), Shekaru Ashirin (20) a matsayin Wakilin Mahaifinsa Marigayi Magajin Garin Zazzau, Malam Nuhu Bamalli, CFR sai Shekaru Goma Sha Tara (19) a matsayin Magajin Garin Zazzau.

Jim kadan bayan kammala aikinsa a matsayin Jakadan Nijeriya mai Lura da Kasashen Thailand da Myanmar a ranan 7ga watan Oktoba, 2020  bayan rasuwan Marigayi Sarkin Zazzau na Goma Sha Takwas (18), Alhaji Dokta Shehu Idris wanda Allah Yai ma rasuwa a ranan 20ga Satumba, 2020, ya gaji Sarautan Zazzau a matsayin Sarki na Goma Sha Tara (19) kimanin Shekaru Dari (100) bayan ficewar Sarautan daga Gidansu.
